built with pdoc

seqeas.subduction2d

Module containing the rheologies, fault setup, and ODE cycles code for the 2D subduction case.

   1"""
   2Module containing the rheologies, fault setup, and ODE cycles code
   3for the 2D subduction case.
   4"""
   5
   6# general imports
   7import json
   8import configparser
   9import numpy as np
  10import pandas as pd
  11from scipy.integrate import solve_ivp
  12from numba import njit, objmode, float64, int64, boolean
  13from scipy.interpolate import interp1d
  14from warnings import warn
  15from abc import ABC
  16
  17# seqeas imports
  18from .kernels2d import Glinedisp, Klinedisp
  19
  20
  21class Rheology(ABC):
  22    """
  23    Abstract base class for rheologies.
  24    """
  25
  26
  27class NonlinearViscous(Rheology):
  28    r"""
  29    Implement a nonlinear viscous fault rheology, where the velocity :math:`v` is
  30    :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` given the shear stress :math:`\tau`, a strength
  31    constant :math:`\alpha_n`, and a constant exponent :math:`n`.
  32    """
  33
  34    def __init__(
  35        self,
  36        n,
  37        alpha_n,
  38        n_mid=None,
  39        alpha_n_mid=None,
  40        mid_transition=None,
  41        n_deep=None,
  42        alpha_n_deep=None,
  43        deep_transition=None,
  44        deep_transition_width=None,
  45        n_boundary=None,
  46        alpha_n_boundary=None,
  47    ):
  48        r"""
  49        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
  50
  51        Parameters
  52        ----------
  53        alpha_n : float
  54            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
  55        n : float
  56            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
  57        """
  58        # input check
  59        assert not np.logical_xor(
  60            deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None
  61        )
  62        # set number of variables
  63        self.n_vars = 2
  64        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
  65        # initialization
  66        self._n = float(n)
  67        self._n_mid = float(n_mid) if n_mid is not None else self.n
  68        self._n_deep = float(n_deep) if n_deep is not None else self.n_mid
  69        self.n_boundary = float(n_boundary) if n_boundary is not None else self.n_deep
  70        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
  71        self.alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
  72        self.alpha_n_mid = (
  73            float(alpha_n_mid) if alpha_n_mid is not None else self.alpha_n
  74        )
  75        self.alpha_n_deep = (
  76            float(alpha_n_deep) if alpha_n_deep is not None else self.alpha_n_mid
  77        )
  78        self.alpha_n_boundary = (
  79            float(alpha_n_boundary)
  80            if alpha_n_boundary is not None
  81            else self.alpha_n_deep
  82        )
  83        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
  84        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
  85        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
  86        self.deep_transition = (
  87            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
  88        )
  89        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
  90        self.deep_transition_width = (
  91            None if deep_transition_width is None else float(deep_transition_width)
  92        )
  93        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
  94
  95    @property
  96    def alpha_n(self):
  97        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
  98        return self._alpha_n
  99
 100    @alpha_n.setter
 101    def alpha_n(self, alpha_n):
 102        self._alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
 103        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
 104
 105    @property
 106    def alpha_n_mid(self):
 107        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
 108        return self._alpha_n_mid
 109
 110    @alpha_n_mid.setter
 111    def alpha_n_mid(self, alpha_n_mid):
 112        self._alpha_n_mid = float(alpha_n_mid)
 113        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
 114
 115    @property
 116    def alpha_n_deep(self):
 117        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
 118        return self._alpha_n_deep
 119
 120    @alpha_n_deep.setter
 121    def alpha_n_deep(self, alpha_n_deep):
 122        self._alpha_n_deep = float(alpha_n_deep)
 123        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
 124
 125    @property
 126    def n(self):
 127        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
 128        return self._n
 129
 130    @n.setter
 131    def n(self, n):
 132        self._n = float(n)
 133        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
 134
 135    @property
 136    def n_mid(self):
 137        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
 138        return self._n_mid
 139
 140    @n_mid.setter
 141    def n_mid(self, n_mid):
 142        self._n_mid = float(n_mid)
 143        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
 144
 145    @property
 146    def n_deep(self):
 147        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
 148        return self._n_deep
 149
 150    @n_deep.setter
 151    def n_deep(self, n_deep):
 152        self._n_deep = float(n_deep)
 153        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
 154
 155    @property
 156    def A(self):
 157        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
 158        return self._A
 159
 160    @property
 161    def A_mid(self):
 162        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
 163        return self._A_mid
 164
 165    @property
 166    def A_deep(self):
 167        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
 168        return self._A_deep
 169
 170    @staticmethod
 171    def calc_A(alpha_n, n):
 172        """Calculate A from alpha_n and n"""
 173        return alpha_n ** (1 / n)
 174
 175    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff):
 176        r"""
 177        Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of :math:`\alpha_n`, :math:`n`, and :math:`A`,
 178        assuming :math:`\alpha_n` and :math:`\alpha_{n,eff}` vary log-linearly with depth,
 179        and :math:`n` adapts between the transition points.
 180        """
 181        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
 182        # start knots list
 183        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
 184        vals_alpha_n = [self.alpha_n]
 185        vals_n = [self.n]
 186        # add optional mid transition
 187        if self.mid_transition is not None:
 188            knots.append(
 189                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))]
 190            )
 191            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_mid)
 192            vals_n.append(self.n_mid)
 193        # add optional deep transition
 194        if self.deep_transition is not None:
 195            knots.append(
 196                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))]
 197            )
 198            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_deep)
 199            vals_n.append(self.n_deep)
 200            knots.append(
 201                patch_depths[
 202                    np.argmin(
 203                        np.abs(
 204                            patch_depths
 205                            - self.deep_transition
 206                            - self.deep_transition_width
 207                        )
 208                    )
 209                ]
 210            )
 211            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
 212            vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
 213        # add final value
 214        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
 215        vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
 216        vals_alpha_n = np.array(vals_alpha_n)
 217        vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
 218        vals_n = np.array(vals_n)
 219        vals_alpha_eff = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(vals_alpha_n, vals_n, v_eff)
 220        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
 221        alpha_n_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_n))(patch_depths)
 222        alpha_eff_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_eff))(patch_depths)
 223        # get n and A
 224        n_vec = SubductionSimulation.get_n(alpha_n_vec, alpha_eff_vec, v_eff)
 225        A_vec = alpha_n_vec ** (1 / n_vec)
 226        return alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec
 227
 228
 229class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology):
 230    r"""
 231    Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively
 232    becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by
 233
 234    :math:`f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E`
 235
 236    where :math:`f_{ss}` is the steady-state friction, :math:`f_0` is a reference
 237    friction, :math:`a` and :math:`b` are the rate-and-state frictional parameters,
 238    :math:`\zeta = \log (v / v_0)` is the logarithmic velocity, :math:`\tau` is the shear
 239    stress, and :math:`\sigma_E` is the effective fault normal stress.
 240    """
 241
 242    def __init__(
 243        self,
 244        v_0,
 245        alpha_h,
 246        alpha_h_mid=None,
 247        mid_transition=None,
 248        alpha_h_deep=None,
 249        deep_transition=None,
 250        deep_transition_width=None,
 251        alpha_h_boundary=None,
 252    ):
 253        r"""
 254        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
 255
 256        Parameters
 257        ----------
 258        v_0 : float
 259            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
 260        alpha_h : float
 261            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
 262            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
 263            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
 264        """
 265        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
 266        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 267        # input check
 268        assert not np.logical_xor(
 269            deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None
 270        )
 271        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
 272        # set number of variables
 273        self.n_vars = 2
 274        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
 275        # initialization
 276        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
 277        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
 278        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
 279        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 280        self.alpha_h_mid = (
 281            float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None else self.alpha_h
 282        )
 283        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 284        self.alpha_h_deep = (
 285            float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None else self.alpha_h_mid
 286        )
 287        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 288        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
 289            float(alpha_h_boundary)
 290            if alpha_h_boundary is not None
 291            else self.alpha_h_deep
 292        )
 293        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 294        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
 295        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
 296        self.deep_transition = (
 297            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
 298        )
 299        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
 300        self.deep_transition_width = (
 301            None if deep_transition_width is None else float(deep_transition_width)
 302        )
 303        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
 304
 305    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths):
 306        r"""
 307        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
 308        varies log-linearly with depth.
 309        """
 310        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
 311        # start knots list
 312        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
 313        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
 314        # add optional mid transition
 315        if self.mid_transition is not None:
 316            knots.append(
 317                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))]
 318            )
 319            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
 320        # add optional deep transition
 321        if self.deep_transition is not None:
 322            knots.append(
 323                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))]
 324            )
 325            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
 326            knots.append(
 327                patch_depths[
 328                    np.argmin(
 329                        np.abs(
 330                            patch_depths
 331                            - self.deep_transition
 332                            - self.deep_transition_width
 333                        )
 334                    )
 335                ]
 336            )
 337            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
 338        # add final value
 339        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
 340        vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
 341        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
 342        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
 343        alpha_h_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h))(patch_depths)
 344        return alpha_h_vec
 345
 346
 347@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 348def dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A, n):
 349    r"""
 350    Calculate the velocity derivative for a power-law viscous rheology.
 351
 352    From :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` we get:
 353
 354    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{\alpha_n} \tau^{n-1} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
 355
 356    where
 357
 358    :math:`\tau^{n-1} = \left( \alpha_n v \right)^{\frac{n-1}{n}}`
 359
 360    simplifying to
 361
 362    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{A} v^{1-\frac{1}{n}} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
 363
 364    Parameters
 365    ----------
 366    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
 367        1D array of the shear stress derivative
 368    v : numpy.ndarray
 369        1D array of the current velocity
 370    A : numpy.ndarray
 371        Rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 372    n : numpy.ndarray
 373        Power-law exponent
 374
 375    Returns
 376    -------
 377    dvdt : numpy.ndarray
 378        1D array of the velocity derivative.
 379    """
 380    signs = np.sign(v)
 381    return (n / A) * (signs * v) ** (1 - 1 / n) * dtaudt
 382
 383
 384@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 385def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec):
 386    r"""
 387    Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction
 388    rate in linear space.
 389
 390    Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit
 391    formulation for the slip acceleration :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}`:
 392
 393    :math:`\frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt}`
 394
 395    Recognizing that :math:`\tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E` and assuming
 396    constant effective normal stress leads to
 397    :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt}`, which
 398    can be rearranged to give the final expression
 399
 400    :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
 401
 402    Parameters
 403    ----------
 404    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
 405        Traction derivative :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt}` [Pa/s] in linear space
 406    alpha_h_vec : float
 407        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
 408
 409    Returns
 410    -------
 411    dzetadt : numpy.ndarray
 412        Velocity derivative :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}` [1/s] in logarithmic space.
 413    """
 414    return dtaudt / alpha_h_vec
 415
 416
 417@njit(
 418    float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True
 419)
 420def get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus, delta_tau, alpha_n, n, A):
 421    r"""
 422    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change due to an instantaneous stress change
 423    to the fault patches. It is derived from:
 424
 425    :math:`\tau_{+} = \tau_{-} + \Delta \tau`
 426
 427    and plugging in the relationship :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n`, we get
 428
 429    :math:`\sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{+}} = \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{-}} + \Delta \tau`
 430
 431    and finally
 432
 433    :math:`v_{+} = \frac{\left( A \sqrt[n]{v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \right)^n}{\alpha_n}`
 434
 435    Parameters
 436    ----------
 437    v_minus : numpy.ndarray
 438        Initial velocity :math:`v_{-}` [m/s]
 439    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray
 440        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
 441    alpha_n : numpy.ndarray
 442        Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
 443    n : numpy.ndarray
 444        Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
 445    A : numpy.ndarray
 446        Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]
 447
 448    Returns
 449    -------
 450    v_plus : numpy.ndarray
 451        Velocity :math:`v_{+}` [m/s] after stress change
 452    """
 453    signs = np.sign(v_minus)
 454    temp = A * (signs * v_minus) ** (1 / n) + (signs * delta_tau)
 455    return np.abs(temp) ** (n - 1) * temp / alpha_n * signs
 456
 457
 458@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 459def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec):
 460    r"""
 461    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an
 462    instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the
 463    derivatuion from the expression in ``RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel``:
 464
 465    :math:`\log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
 466
 467    and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for :math:`\zeta`
 468    to give us the final result
 469
 470    :math:`\zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
 471
 472    Parameters
 473    ----------
 474    zeta_minus : numpy.ndarray
 475        Initial velocity :math:`\zeta_{-}` [-] in logarithmic space
 476    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray, optional
 477        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
 478    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 479        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
 480
 481    Returns
 482    -------
 483    zeta_plus : numpy.ndarray
 484        Velocity :math:`\zeta_{+}` [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
 485
 486    See Also
 487    --------
 488    alpha_h
 489    """
 490    return zeta_minus + delta_tau / alpha_h_vec
 491
 492
 493@njit(
 494    float64[:](
 495        float64,
 496        float64[:],
 497        float64,
 498        float64[:, ::1],
 499        float64[:, ::1],
 500        float64[:],
 501        float64[:],
 502        float64,
 503    ),
 504    cache=True,
 505)
 506def flat_ode_plvis(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, mu_over_2vs):
 507    r"""
 508    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 509    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
 510    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
 511
 512    Parameters
 513    ----------
 514    t : float
 515        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 516    state : numpy.ndarray
 517        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 518        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
 519    v_plate : float
 520        Plate velocity.
 521    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 522        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 523    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 524        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 525        patches onto the creeping patches.
 526    A_upper : numpy.ndarray
 527        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 528    n_upper : numpy.ndarray
 529        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
 530    mu_over_2vs : float
 531        Radiation damping factor
 532
 533    Returns
 534    -------
 535    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 536        1D array with the state derivative.
 537    """
 538    # get number of variables within state
 539    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 540    n_vars_upper = 2
 541    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
 542    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
 543    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
 544    # extract total velocities
 545    v = state[n_creeping_upper:]
 546    # get shear strain rate
 547    signs = np.sign(v)
 548    temp = mu_over_2vs * (n_upper / A_upper) * (signs * v) ** (1 - 1 / n_upper)
 549    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)) / (1 + temp)
 550    # get ODE
 551    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A_upper, n_upper)))
 552    # return
 553    return dstatedt
 554
 555
 556@njit(
 557    float64[:](
 558        float64,
 559        float64[:],
 560        float64,
 561        float64[:, ::1],
 562        float64[:, ::1],
 563        float64,
 564        float64[:],
 565        float64,
 566    ),
 567    cache=True,
 568)
 569def flat_ode_rdlog(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs):
 570    r"""
 571    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 572    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
 573    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
 574
 575    Parameters
 576    ----------
 577    t : float
 578        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 579    state : numpy.ndarray
 580        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 581        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
 582    v_plate : float
 583        Plate velocity.
 584    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 585        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 586    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 587        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 588        patches onto the creeping patches.
 589    v_0 : float
 590        Reference velocity [m/s]
 591    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 592        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
 593    mu_over_2vs : float
 594        Radiation damping factor
 595
 596    Returns
 597    -------
 598    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 599        1D array with the state derivative.
 600    """
 601    # get number of variables within state
 602    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 603    n_vars_upper = 2
 604    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
 605    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
 606    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
 607    # extract total velocities
 608    zeta = state[n_creeping_upper:]
 609    v = v_0 * np.exp(zeta)
 610    # get shear strain rate
 611    temp = mu_over_2vs * v / alpha_h_vec
 612    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)) / (1 + temp)
 613    # get ODE
 614    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec)))
 615    # return
 616    return dstatedt
 617
 618
 619@njit(
 620    float64[:](
 621        float64,
 622        float64[:],
 623        int64,
 624        float64[:],
 625        float64[:, ::1],
 626        float64[:, ::1],
 627        float64,
 628        float64,
 629        float64,
 630        float64,
 631    ),
 632    cache=True,
 633)
 634def flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
 635    t,
 636    state,
 637    n_creeping_upper,
 638    v_plate_vec,
 639    K_int,
 640    K_ext,
 641    A_upper,
 642    n_upper,
 643    A_lower,
 644    n_lower,
 645):
 646    """
 647    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 648    powerlaw-viscous rheology in both the upper and lower plate interface.
 649
 650    Parameters
 651    ----------
 652    t : float
 653        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 654    state : numpy.ndarray
 655        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 656        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
 657        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
 658    n_creeping_upper : int
 659        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
 660        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
 661        be derived from the size of ``state``.
 662    v_plate_vec : float
 663        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
 664    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 665        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 666    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 667        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 668        patches onto the creeping patches.
 669    A_upper : float
 670        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 671    n_upper : float
 672        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
 673    A_lower : float
 674        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 675    n_lower : float
 676        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
 677
 678    Returns
 679    -------
 680    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 681        1D array with the state derivative.
 682    """
 683    # get number of variables within state
 684    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 685    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 686    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 687    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
 688    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
 689    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
 690    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
 691    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
 692    # split up state
 693    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
 694    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
 695    # extract total velocities
 696    v_upper = state_upper[n_creeping_upper:]
 697    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
 698    # get shear strain rate
 699    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
 700    dtaudt = K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1)
 701    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
 702    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
 703    # get individual rheologies' ODE
 704    dstatedt_upper = np.concatenate(
 705        (
 706            v_upper,
 707            dvdt_plvis(
 708                dtaudt_upper,
 709                v_upper,
 710                np.ones_like(v_upper) * A_upper,
 711                np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_upper,
 712            ),
 713        )
 714    )
 715    dstatedt_lower = np.concatenate(
 716        (
 717            v_lower,
 718            dvdt_plvis(
 719                dtaudt_lower,
 720                v_lower,
 721                np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
 722                np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower,
 723            ),
 724        )
 725    )
 726    # concatenate and return
 727    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))
 728
 729
 730@njit(
 731    float64[:](
 732        float64,
 733        float64[:],
 734        int64,
 735        float64[:],
 736        float64[:, ::1],
 737        float64[:, ::1],
 738        float64,
 739        float64,
 740        float64,
 741        float64,
 742    ),
 743    cache=True,
 744)
 745def flat_ode_rdlog_plvis(
 746    t,
 747    state,
 748    n_creeping_upper,
 749    v_plate_vec,
 750    K_int,
 751    K_ext,
 752    v_0,
 753    alpha_h_upper,
 754    A_lower,
 755    n_lower,
 756):
 757    r"""
 758    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 759    rate-dependent (log-space) rheology in the upper and nonlinear viscous
 760    rheology in the lower plate interface.
 761
 762    Parameters
 763    ----------
 764    t : float
 765        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 766    state : numpy.ndarray
 767        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 768        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
 769        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
 770    n_creeping_upper : int
 771        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
 772        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
 773        be derived from the size of ``state``.
 774    v_plate_vec : float
 775        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
 776    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 777        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 778    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 779        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 780        patches onto the creeping patches.
 781    v_0 : float
 782        Reference velocity [m/s]
 783    alpha_h_upper : float
 784        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
 785    A_lower : float
 786        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 787    n_lower : float
 788        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
 789
 790    Returns
 791    -------
 792    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 793        1D array with the state derivative.
 794    """
 795    # get number of variables within state
 796    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 797    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 798    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 799    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
 800    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
 801    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
 802    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
 803    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
 804    # split up state
 805    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
 806    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
 807    # extract total velocities
 808    v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(state_upper[n_creeping_upper:])
 809    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
 810    # get shear strain rate
 811    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
 812    dtaudt = K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1)
 813    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
 814    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
 815    # get individual rheologies' ODE
 816    dstatedt_upper = np.concatenate(
 817        (v_upper, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt_upper, np.ones_like(v_lower) * alpha_h_upper))
 818    )
 819    dstatedt_lower = np.concatenate(
 820        (
 821            v_lower,
 822            dvdt_plvis(
 823                dtaudt_lower,
 824                v_lower,
 825                np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
 826                np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower,
 827            ),
 828        )
 829    )
 830    # concatenate and return
 831    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))
 832
 833
 834# simple rk4
 835@njit(
 836    float64[:, :](
 837        float64,
 838        float64,
 839        float64[:],
 840        float64[:],
 841        int64,
 842        float64[:],
 843        float64[:, ::1],
 844        float64[:, ::1],
 845        float64,
 846        float64,
 847        float64,
 848        float64,
 849    ),
 850    cache=True,
 851)
 852def myrk4(
 853    ti,
 854    tf,
 855    state0,
 856    t_eval,
 857    n_creeping_upper,
 858    v_plate_vec,
 859    K_int,
 860    K_ext,
 861    A_upper,
 862    n_upper,
 863    A_lower,
 864    n_lower,
 865):
 866    h = t_eval[1] - t_eval[0]
 867    num_state = state0.size
 868    num_eval = t_eval.size
 869    sol = np.zeros((num_eval, num_state))
 870    sol[0, :] = state0
 871    for i in range(1, num_eval):
 872        cur = sol[i - 1, :]
 873        k1 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
 874            ti,
 875            cur,
 876            n_creeping_upper,
 877            v_plate_vec,
 878            K_int,
 879            K_ext,
 880            A_upper,
 881            n_upper,
 882            A_lower,
 883            n_lower,
 884        )
 885        cur = sol[i - 1, :] + (h / 2) * k1
 886        k2 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
 887            ti,
 888            cur,
 889            n_creeping_upper,
 890            v_plate_vec,
 891            K_int,
 892            K_ext,
 893            A_upper,
 894            n_upper,
 895            A_lower,
 896            n_lower,
 897        )
 898        cur = sol[i - 1, :] + (h / 2) * k2
 899        k3 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
 900            ti,
 901            cur,
 902            n_creeping_upper,
 903            v_plate_vec,
 904            K_int,
 905            K_ext,
 906            A_upper,
 907            n_upper,
 908            A_lower,
 909            n_lower,
 910        )
 911        cur = sol[i - 1, :] + h * k3
 912        k4 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
 913            ti,
 914            cur,
 915            n_creeping_upper,
 916            v_plate_vec,
 917            K_int,
 918            K_ext,
 919            A_upper,
 920            n_upper,
 921            A_lower,
 922            n_lower,
 923        )
 924        sol[i, :] = sol[i - 1, :] + (h / 6) * (k1 + 2 * k2 + 2 * k3 + k4)
 925    return sol
 926
 927
 928@njit(
 929    float64[:, :](
 930        float64[:],
 931        int64[:],
 932        int64[:],
 933        int64,
 934        int64,
 935        float64[:, ::1],
 936        float64[:, ::1],
 937        float64[:],
 938        float64[:],
 939        float64[:, ::1],
 940        float64[:, ::1],
 941        float64[:],
 942        float64[:],
 943        float64[:],
 944        float64,
 945    ),
 946    cache=True,
 947)
 948def flat_run_plvis(
 949    t_eval,
 950    i_break,
 951    i_eq,
 952    n_creeping_upper,
 953    n_creeping_lower,
 954    K_int,
 955    K_ext,
 956    v_plate_vec,
 957    v_init,
 958    slip_taper,
 959    delta_tau_bounded,
 960    alpha_n_vec,
 961    n_vec,
 962    A_vec,
 963    mu_over_2vs,
 964):
 965    r"""
 966    Run the simulation.
 967
 968    Parameters
 969    ----------
 970    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
 971        Evaluation times [s]
 972    i_break : numpy.ndarray
 973        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
 974    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
 975        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
 976    n_creeping_upper : int
 977        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
 978    n_creeping_lower : int
 979        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
 980    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 981        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
 982    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 983        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
 984    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
 985        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
 986    v_init : numpy.ndarray
 987        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
 988    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
 989        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
 990    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
 991        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
 992    alpha_n_vec : numpy.ndarray
 993        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
 994        at each patch
 995    n_vec : float
 996        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-] at each patch
 997    A_vec : float
 998        Rescaled upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 999        [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
1000    mu_over_2vs : float
1001        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
1002        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
1003
1004    Returns
1005    -------
1006    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1007        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1008    """
1009    # initialize parameters
1010    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1011    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1012    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1013    n_eval = t_eval.size
1014    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1015
1016    # initialize arrays
1017    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1018    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1019    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
1020    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
1021    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1022    full_state[:] = np.nan
1023    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1024        (s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1025    )
1026
1027    # make flat ODE function arguments
1028    args = (
1029        v_plate_vec[0],
1030        K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
1031        K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :],
1032        A_vec,
1033        n_vec,
1034        mu_over_2vs,
1035    )
1036
1037    # integrate
1038    spun_up = 0
1039    i_slip = 0
1040    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1041    i = 0
1042    atol = np.ones(n_state_upper) * 1e-6
1043    atol[n_creeping_upper:] = 1e-15
1044    while i < steps.size - 1:
1045        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
1046        # get indices
1047        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1048        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1049        # call integrator
1050        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1051            sol = solve_ivp(
1052                flat_ode_plvis,
1053                t_span=[ti, tf],
1054                y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
1055                t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1056                method="LSODA",
1057                rtol=1e-6,
1058                atol=atol,
1059                args=args,
1060            )
1061            success = sol.success
1062            if success:
1063                sol = sol.y
1064            else:
1065                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
1066        if not success:
1067            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1068        # save state to output array
1069        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1070        # fill in the imposed lower state
1071        full_state[n_state_upper : n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji : jf + 1] = (
1072            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1073            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji : jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
1074        )
1075        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower :, ji : jf + 1] = (
1076            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1077        )
1078        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1079        if i == steps.size - 2:
1080            break
1081        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1082        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1083            old_full_state = full_state[
1084                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1085            ]
1086            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1087            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1088            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1089            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1090            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1091            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1092            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1093            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
1094            if stop_now:
1095                spun_up = jf
1096                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1097                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1098        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1099            break
1100        # apply step change only if there is one
1101        if jf in i_eq:
1102            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1103            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1104            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1105            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1106            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1107            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1108            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1109            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1110            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(
1111                v_minus_upper,
1112                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1113                alpha_n_vec,
1114                n_vec,
1115                A_vec,
1116            )
1117            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
1118            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1119                (s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1120            )
1121            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1122        else:
1123            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1124        # advance
1125        i += 1
1126
1127    # warn if we never spun up
1128    if not spun_up:
1129        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1130
1131    # done
1132    return full_state
1133
1134
1135@njit(
1136    float64[:, :](
1137        float64[:],
1138        int64[:],
1139        int64[:],
1140        int64,
1141        int64,
1142        float64[:, ::1],
1143        float64[:, ::1],
1144        float64[:],
1145        float64[:],
1146        float64[:, ::1],
1147        float64[:, ::1],
1148        float64,
1149        float64[:],
1150        float64,
1151    ),
1152    cache=True,
1153)
1154def flat_run_rdlog(
1155    t_eval,
1156    i_break,
1157    i_eq,
1158    n_creeping_upper,
1159    n_creeping_lower,
1160    K_int,
1161    K_ext,
1162    v_plate_vec,
1163    v_init,
1164    slip_taper,
1165    delta_tau_bounded,
1166    v_0,
1167    alpha_h_vec,
1168    mu_over_2vs,
1169):
1170    r"""
1171    Run the simulation.
1172
1173    Parameters
1174    ----------
1175    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1176        Evaluation times [s]
1177    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1178        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1179    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1180        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1181    n_creeping_upper : int
1182        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1183    n_creeping_lower : int
1184        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1185    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1186        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1187    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1188        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1189    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1190        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1191    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1192        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1193    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1194        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1195    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1196        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1197    v_0 : float
1198        Reference velocity [m/s]
1199    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
1200        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1201    mu_over_2vs : float
1202        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
1203        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
1204
1205    Returns
1206    -------
1207    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1208        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1209    """
1210    # initialize parameters
1211    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1212    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1213    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1214    n_eval = t_eval.size
1215    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1216
1217    # initialize arrays
1218    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1219    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1220    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
1221    zeta_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
1222    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
1223    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1224    full_state[:] = np.nan
1225    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1226        (s_minus_upper, zeta_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1227    )
1228
1229    # make flat ODE function arguments
1230    args = (
1231        v_plate_vec[0],
1232        K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
1233        K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :],
1234        v_0,
1235        alpha_h_vec,
1236        mu_over_2vs,
1237    )
1238
1239    # integrate
1240    spun_up = 0
1241    i_slip = 0
1242    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1243    i = 0
1244    while i < steps.size - 1:
1245        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
1246        # get indices
1247        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1248        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1249        # call integrator
1250        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1251            sol = solve_ivp(
1252                flat_ode_rdlog,
1253                t_span=[ti, tf],
1254                y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
1255                t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1256                method="LSODA",
1257                args=args,
1258            )
1259            success = sol.success
1260            if success:
1261                sol = sol.y
1262            else:
1263                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
1264        if not success:
1265            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1266        # save state to output array
1267        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1268        # fill in the imposed lower state
1269        full_state[n_state_upper : n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji : jf + 1] = (
1270            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1271            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji : jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
1272        )
1273        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower :, ji : jf + 1] = (
1274            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1275        )
1276        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1277        if i == steps.size - 2:
1278            break
1279        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1280        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1281            old_full_state = full_state[
1282                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1283            ]
1284            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1285            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1286            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1287            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1288            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1289            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1290            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1291            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
1292            if stop_now:
1293                spun_up = jf
1294                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1295                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1296        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1297            break
1298        # apply step change only if there is one
1299        if jf in i_eq:
1300            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1301            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1302            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1303            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1304            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1305            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1306            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1307            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1308            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(
1309                zeta_minus_upper,
1310                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1311                alpha_h_vec,
1312            )
1313            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
1314            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1315                (s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1316            )
1317            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1318        else:
1319            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1320        # advance
1321        i += 1
1322
1323    # warn if we never spun up
1324    if not spun_up:
1325        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1326
1327    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = v_0 * np.exp(
1328        full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :]
1329    )
1330
1331    # done
1332    return full_state
1333
1334
1335@njit(
1336    float64[:, :](
1337        float64[:],
1338        int64[:],
1339        int64[:],
1340        int64,
1341        int64,
1342        float64[:, ::1],
1343        float64[:, ::1],
1344        float64[:],
1345        float64[:],
1346        float64[:, ::1],
1347        float64[:, ::1],
1348        float64,
1349        float64,
1350        float64,
1351        float64,
1352        boolean,
1353    ),
1354    cache=True,
1355)
1356def flat_run_plvis_plvis(
1357    t_eval,
1358    i_break,
1359    i_eq,
1360    n_creeping_upper,
1361    n_creeping_lower,
1362    K_int,
1363    K_ext,
1364    v_plate_vec,
1365    v_init,
1366    slip_taper,
1367    delta_tau_bounded,
1368    alpha_n_upper,
1369    n_upper,
1370    alpha_n_lower,
1371    n_lower,
1372    simple_rk4,
1373):
1374    """
1375    Run the simulation.
1376
1377    Parameters
1378    ----------
1379    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1380        Evaluation times [s]
1381    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1382        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1383    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1384        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1385    n_creeping_upper : int
1386        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1387    n_creeping_lower : int
1388        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1389    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1390        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1391    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1392        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1393    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1394        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1395    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1396        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1397    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1398        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1399    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1400        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1401    alpha_n_upper : float
1402        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1403    n_upper : float
1404        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1405    alpha_n_lower : float
1406        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1407    n_lower : float
1408        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1409    simple_rk4 : bool
1410        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1411
1412    Returns
1413    -------
1414    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1415        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1416    """
1417    # initialize parameters
1418    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1419    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1420    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1421    A_upper = alpha_n_upper ** (1 / n_upper)
1422    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1423    n_eval = t_eval.size
1424    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1425
1426    # initialize arrays
1427    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1428    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1429    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
1430    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1431    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1432    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1433    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1434    full_state[:] = np.nan
1435    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1436        (s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1437    )
1438
1439    # make flat ODE function arguments
1440    args = (
1441        n_creeping_upper,
1442        v_plate_vec,
1443        K_int,
1444        K_ext,
1445        A_upper,
1446        n_upper,
1447        A_lower,
1448        n_lower,
1449    )
1450
1451    # integrate
1452    spun_up = 0
1453    i_slip = 0
1454    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1455    i = 0
1456    while i < steps.size - 1:
1457        # get indices
1458        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1459        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1460        # call integrator
1461        if simple_rk4:
1462            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji : jf + 1], *args).T
1463        else:
1464            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1465                sol = solve_ivp(
1466                    flat_ode_plvis_plvis,
1467                    t_span=[ti, tf],
1468                    y0=state_plus,
1469                    t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1470                    method="RK45",
1471                    rtol=1e-9,
1472                    atol=1e-12,
1473                    args=args,
1474                )
1475                success = sol.success
1476                sol = sol.y
1477            if not success:
1478                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1479        # save state to output array
1480        full_state[:, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1481        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1482        if i == steps.size - 2:
1483            break
1484        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1485        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1486            old_full_state = full_state[
1487                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1488            ]
1489            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1490            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1491            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1492            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1493            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1494            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1495            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1496            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1497            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1498            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1499            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1500            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1501            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1502            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1503            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1504            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1505            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1506            if stop_now:
1507                spun_up = jf
1508                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1509                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1510        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1511            break
1512        # apply step change only if there is one
1513        if jf in i_eq:
1514            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1515            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1516            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1517            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1518            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1519            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1520            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1521            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1522            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(
1523                v_minus_upper,
1524                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1525                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_upper,
1526                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_upper,
1527                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_upper,
1528            )
1529            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(
1530                v_minus_lower,
1531                delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1532                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1533                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1534                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower,
1535            )
1536            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1537                (s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1538            )
1539            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1540        else:
1541            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1542        # advance
1543        i += 1
1544
1545    # warn if we never spun up
1546    if not spun_up:
1547        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1548
1549    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1550    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1551
1552    # done
1553    return full_state
1554
1555
1556@njit(
1557    float64[:, :](
1558        float64[:],
1559        int64[:],
1560        int64[:],
1561        int64,
1562        int64,
1563        float64[:, ::1],
1564        float64[:, ::1],
1565        float64[:],
1566        float64[:],
1567        float64[:, ::1],
1568        float64[:, ::1],
1569        float64,
1570        float64,
1571        float64,
1572        float64,
1573        boolean,
1574    ),
1575    cache=True,
1576)
1577def flat_run_rdlog_plvis(
1578    t_eval,
1579    i_break,
1580    i_eq,
1581    n_creeping_upper,
1582    n_creeping_lower,
1583    K_int,
1584    K_ext,
1585    v_plate_vec,
1586    v_init,
1587    slip_taper,
1588    delta_tau_bounded,
1589    v_0,
1590    alpha_h_upper,
1591    alpha_n_lower,
1592    n_lower,
1593    simple_rk4,
1594):
1595    r"""
1596    Run the simulation.
1597
1598    Parameters
1599    ----------
1600    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1601        Evaluation times [s]
1602    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1603        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1604    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1605        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1606    n_creeping_upper : int
1607        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1608    n_creeping_lower : int
1609        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1610    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1611        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1612    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1613        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1614    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1615        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1616    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1617        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1618    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1619        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1620    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1621        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1622    v_0 : float
1623        Reference velocity [m/s]
1624    alpha_h_upper : float
1625        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1626    alpha_n_lower : float
1627        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1628    n_lower : float
1629        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1630    simple_rk4 : bool
1631        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1632
1633    Returns
1634    -------
1635    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1636        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1637    """
1638    # initialize parameters
1639    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1640    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1641    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1642    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1643    n_eval = t_eval.size
1644    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1645
1646    # initialize arrays
1647    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1648    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1649    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
1650    v_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
1651    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1652    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1653    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1654    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1655    full_state[:] = np.nan
1656    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1657        (s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1658    )
1659
1660    # make flat ODE function arguments
1661    args = (
1662        n_creeping_upper,
1663        v_plate_vec,
1664        K_int,
1665        K_ext,
1666        v_0,
1667        alpha_h_upper,
1668        A_lower,
1669        n_lower,
1670    )
1671
1672    # integrate
1673    spun_up = 0
1674    i_slip = 0
1675    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1676    i = 0
1677    while i < steps.size - 1:
1678        # get indices
1679        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1680        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1681        # call integrator
1682        if simple_rk4:
1683            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji : jf + 1], *args).T
1684        else:
1685            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1686                sol = solve_ivp(
1687                    flat_ode_rdlog_plvis,
1688                    t_span=[ti, tf],
1689                    y0=state_plus,
1690                    t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1691                    method="RK45",
1692                    rtol=1e-9,
1693                    atol=1e-12,
1694                    args=args,
1695                )
1696                success = sol.success
1697                sol = sol.y
1698            if not success:
1699                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1700        # save state to output array
1701        full_state[:, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1702        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1703        if i == steps.size - 2:
1704            break
1705        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1706        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1707            old_full_state = full_state[
1708                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1709            ]
1710            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1711            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1712            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1713            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1714            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1715            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1716            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1717            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1718            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1719            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1720            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1721            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1722            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1723            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1724            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1725            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1726            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1727            if stop_now:
1728                spun_up = jf
1729                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1730                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1731        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1732            break
1733        # apply step change only if there is one
1734        if jf in i_eq:
1735            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1736            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1737            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1738            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1739            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1740            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1741            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1742            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1743            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(
1744                zeta_minus_upper,
1745                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1746                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_h_upper,
1747            )
1748            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(
1749                v_minus_lower,
1750                delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1751                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1752                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1753                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower,
1754            )
1755            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1756                (s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1757            )
1758            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1759        else:
1760            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1761        # advance
1762        i += 1
1763
1764    # warn if we never spun up
1765    if not spun_up:
1766        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1767
1768    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = v_0 * np.exp(
1769        full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :]
1770    )
1771    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1772    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1773
1774    # done
1775    return full_state
1776
1777
1778@njit(
1779    float64[:, :](float64[:, ::1], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1]),
1780    cache=True,
1781)
1782# optional(float64[:, ::1]), optional(float64[:, ::1])))
1783def get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(
1784    full_state, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, G_surf, deep_creep_slip
1785):  # , locked_slip):
1786    """
1787    Calculate the surface displacements given the output of ``run``.
1788
1789    Parameters
1790    ----------
1791    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1792        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1793    n_creeping_upper : int
1794        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1795    n_creeping_lower : int
1796        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1797    G_surf : numpy.ndarray
1798        Surface displacements Green's matrix [-] (dimensions must whether `locked_slip`
1799        and/or `deep_creep_slip` are passed to function)
1800    deep_creep_slip : numpy.ndarray
1801        Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches
1802    locked_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
1803        Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches
1804
1805    Returns
1806    -------
1807    surf_disp : numpy.ndarray
1808        Surface displacement timeseries.
1809    """
1810    # extract timeseries from solution
1811    slip_upper = full_state[:n_creeping_upper, :]
1812    slip_lower = full_state[
1813        2 * n_creeping_upper : 2 * n_creeping_upper + n_creeping_lower, :
1814    ]
1815    # add the locked and deep patches to the combined upper & lower slip history matrix
1816    slips_all = np.concatenate((slip_upper, slip_lower), axis=0)
1817    # if locked_slip is not None:s
1818    #     slips_all = np.concatenate((locked_slip[:, :slip_upper.shape[1]], slips_all),
1819    #                                axis=0)
1820    # if deep_creep_slip is not None:
1821    slips_all = np.concatenate((slips_all, deep_creep_slip), axis=0)
1822    # calculate all surface displacements for last full cycle
1823    surf_disps = G_surf @ slips_all
1824    return surf_disps
1825
1826
1827class Fault2D:
1828    """
1829    Base class for the subduction fault mesh.
1830    """
1831
1832    def __init__(
1833        self,
1834        theta,
1835        D_lock,
1836        H,
1837        nu,
1838        E,
1839        v_s,
1840        halflen,
1841        upper_rheo,
1842        n_upper,
1843        lower_rheo,
1844        n_lower_left,
1845        n_lower_right,
1846        halflen_factor_lower,
1847        D_max=None,
1848        x1_pretrench=None,
1849    ):
1850        """
1851        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1852        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1853
1854        Parameters
1855        ----------
1856        theta : float
1857            Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
1858        D_lock : float
1859            Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1860        H : float
1861            Subducting plate thickness [m].
1862        nu : float
1863            Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
1864        E : float
1865            Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
1866        v_s : float
1867            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1868        halflen : float
1869            Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches.
1870            If ``D_max`` and ``x1_pretrench`` are not set, this length is also used for all
1871            creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
1872        upper_rheo : Rheology
1873            Upper plate interface's rheology.
1874        n_upper : int
1875            Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
1876        lower_rheo : Rheology
1877            Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass ``None`` if it should not be simulated,
1878            but enforced to have the plate velocity.
1879        n_lower_left : int
1880            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
1881        n_lower_right : int
1882            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
1883        halflen_factor_lower : float
1884            Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower
1885            plate interface.
1886        D_max : float, optional
1887            Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1888            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1889            locked zone. (``x1_pretrench`` must be set as well.)
1890        x1_pretrench : float, optional
1891            Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive).
1892            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1893            locked zone. (``D_max`` must be set as well.)
1894
1895        References
1896        ----------
1897
1898        .. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010).
1899           *An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones.*
1900           Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3).
1901           doi:`10.1029/2009JB006611 <https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JB006611>`_.
1902        """
1903        # initialize
1904        self.theta = float(theta)
1905        """ Subducting plate dip angle [rad] """
1906        assert 0 < self.theta < np.pi / 2
1907        self.D_lock = float(D_lock)
1908        """ Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1909        assert self.D_lock > 0
1910        self.H = float(H)
1911        """ Subducting plate thickness [m] """
1912        assert self.H >= 0
1913        self.nu = float(nu)
1914        """ Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone """
1915        self.E = float(E)
1916        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1917        self.halflen = float(halflen)
1918        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface """
1919        assert self.halflen > 0
1920        self.upper_rheo = upper_rheo
1921        """ Upper plate interface's rheology """
1922        assert isinstance(self.upper_rheo, Rheology)
1923        self.n_upper = int(n_upper)
1924        """ Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface """
1925        assert self.n_upper >= 1
1926        self.lower_rheo = lower_rheo
1927        """ Lower plate interface's rheology """
1928        assert isinstance(self.lower_rheo, Rheology) or (self.lower_rheo is None)
1929        self.n_lower_left = int(n_lower_left)
1930        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend) """
1931        assert self.n_lower_left >= 1
1932        self.n_lower_right = int(n_lower_right)
1933        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend) """
1934        assert self.n_lower_right >= 1
1935        self.halflen_factor_lower = float(halflen_factor_lower)
1936        """ Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length """
1937        assert self.halflen_factor_lower >= 1
1938        self.lower_halflen = self.halflen * self.halflen_factor_lower
1939        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface """
1940        if self.lower_rheo is not None:
1941            assert (
1942                self.H >= 2 * self.lower_halflen
1943            ), "Plate too thin for given patch sizes."
1944        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1945        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1946        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1947        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1948
1949        # switch between constant or linearly-varying patch sizes
1950        if (D_max is not None) and (x1_pretrench is not None):
1951            D_max = float(D_max)
1952            x1_pretrench = float(x1_pretrench)
1953            assert D_max > 0
1954            assert x1_pretrench > 0
1955            variable_mesh = True
1956        else:
1957            D_max = None
1958            x1_pretrench = None
1959            variable_mesh = False
1960        self.D_max = D_max
1961        """ Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional) """
1962        self.x1_pretrench = x1_pretrench
1963        """ Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional) """
1964        self.variable_mesh = variable_mesh
1965        """ Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not """
1966
1967        # create mesh, centered about the x2 axis
1968        if self.variable_mesh:
1969            # project the locking depth onto dip angle
1970            L_lock = self.D_lock / np.sin(self.theta)
1971            # get number of locked and creeping patches on upper interface
1972            n_lock = int(L_lock // (2 * self.halflen))
1973            n_creep_up = self.n_upper - n_lock
1974            assert n_creep_up > 0, "Current geometry yields no upper creeping patches."
1975            # project maximum interface depth onto dip angle
1976            L_max = self.D_max / np.sin(self.theta)
1977            # get length of creeping segment that needs to be linearly varying
1978            delta_L = L_max - n_lock * 2 * self.halflen
1979            # get linear half-length increase necessary given the number of patches
1980            # and length of creeping segment, on all three interface regions
1981            delta_h_upper = (delta_L - 2 * self.halflen * n_creep_up) / (
1982                n_creep_up**2 - n_creep_up
1983            )
1984            delta_h_lower_right = (
1985                L_max - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_right
1986            ) / (self.n_lower_right**2 - self.n_lower_right)
1987            delta_h_lower_left = (
1988                self.x1_pretrench - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_left
1989            ) / (self.n_lower_left**2 - self.n_lower_left)
1990            # check that we're not running into numerical problems from starkly
1991            # increasing patch sizes
1992            if any(
1993                [
1994                    d > 0.2
1995                    for d in [
1996                        delta_h_upper / self.halflen,
1997                        delta_h_lower_right / self.lower_halflen,
1998                        delta_h_lower_left / self.lower_halflen,
1999                    ]
2000                ]
2001            ):
2002                raise ValueError("Half-length increase greater than 20%.")
2003            # build vector of half-lengths
2004            halflen_vec = np.concatenate(
2005                [
2006                    np.ones(n_lock) * self.halflen,
2007                    self.halflen + np.arange(n_creep_up) * delta_h_upper,
2008                    (
2009                        self.lower_halflen
2010                        + np.arange(self.n_lower_left) * delta_h_lower_left
2011                    )[::-1],
2012                    self.lower_halflen
2013                    + np.arange(self.n_lower_right) * delta_h_lower_right,
2014                ]
2015            )
2016        else:
2017            # build half-length vector from constant size
2018            halflen_vec = (
2019                np.ones(self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left + self.n_lower_right)
2020                * self.halflen
2021            )
2022            halflen_vec[self.n_upper :] *= self.halflen_factor_lower
2023        self.halflen_vec = halflen_vec
2024        """ Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault """
2025        s = self.H * np.tan(self.theta / 2)
2026        R = np.array(
2027            [
2028                [np.cos(-self.theta), -np.sin(-self.theta)],
2029                [np.sin(-self.theta), np.cos(-self.theta)],
2030            ]
2031        )
2032        # upper plate interface
2033        upper_right_x1 = np.concatenate(
2034            [[0], np.cumsum(2 * self.halflen_vec[: self.n_upper])]
2035        )
2036        upper_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(upper_right_x1)
2037        upper_right = R @ np.stack([upper_right_x1, upper_right_x2], axis=0)
2038        # lower left plate interface
2039        temp = self.halflen_vec[
2040            self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left - 1 : self.n_upper - 1 : -1
2041        ]
2042        lower_left_x1 = -s - np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2 * temp)])[::-1]
2043        lower_left_x2 = -self.H * np.ones(self.n_lower_left + 1)
2044        lower_left = np.stack([lower_left_x1, lower_left_x2], axis=0)
2045        # lower right
2046        lower_right_x1 = np.concatenate(
2047            [[0], np.cumsum(2 * self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left :])]
2048        )
2049        lower_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(lower_right_x1)
2050        lower_right = R @ np.stack([lower_right_x1, lower_right_x2], axis=0) - np.array(
2051            [[s], [self.H]]
2052        )
2053        # concatenate mesh parts
2054        self.end_upper = upper_right
2055        """ 2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m] """
