2056        self.end_lower = np.concatenate([lower_left, lower_right[:, 1:]], axis=1)
2057        """ 2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m] """
2058        self.end = np.concatenate([self.end_upper, self.end_lower], axis=1)
2059        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m] """
2060        self.mid = (
2061            np.concatenate(
2062                [
2063                    upper_right[:, :-1] + upper_right[:, 1:],
2064                    lower_left[:, :-1] + lower_left[:, 1:],
2065                    lower_right[:, :-1] + lower_right[:, 1:],
2066                ],
2067                axis=1,
2068            )
2069            / 2
2070        )
2071        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2072        self.mid_x1 = self.mid[0, :]
2073        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2074        self.mid_x2 = self.mid[1, :]
2075        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2076        # access subparts
2077        self.ix_upper = np.arange(self.mid_x1.size) < upper_right_x1.size
2078        """ Mask of upper fault interface patches """
2079        self.ix_lower = ~self.ix_upper
2080        """ Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing) """
2081        # locked is the part that slips coseismically on the upper plate interface
2082        self.x1_lock = self.D_lock / np.tan(self.theta)
2083        """ Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
2084        ix_locked = self.mid_x1 <= self.x1_lock - self.halflen
2085        ix_locked[self.n_upper :] = False
2086        self.ix_locked = ix_locked
2087        """ Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically """
2088        self.n_locked = (self.ix_locked).sum()
2089        """ Number [-] of locked patches """
2090        # assert self.n_locked == n_lock
2091        self.n_creeping = (~self.ix_locked).sum()
2092        """ Number [-] of creeping patches """
2093        self.n_creeping_upper = (~self.ix_locked[: self.n_upper]).sum()
2094        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface """
2095        # assert self.n_creeping_upper == n_creep_up
2096        self.n_creeping_lower = self.n_creeping - self.n_creeping_upper
2097        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface """
2098        assert self.n_creeping_lower == n_lower_left + n_lower_right
2099        self.mid_x1_locked = self.mid_x1[self.ix_locked]
2100        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
2101        self.mid_x2_locked = self.mid_x2[self.ix_locked]
2102        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
2103        self.mid_x1_creeping = self.mid_x1[~self.ix_locked]
2104        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
2105        self.mid_x2_creeping = self.mid_x2[~self.ix_locked]
2106        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
2107        # for later calculations, need theta and unit vectors in vector form
2108        theta_vec = np.ones_like(self.mid_x1) * self.theta
2109        theta_vec[self.n_upper : self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left] = np.pi
2110        theta_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left :] += np.pi
2111        self.theta_vec = theta_vec
2112        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches """
2113        self.e_f = np.stack([np.sin(self.theta_vec), np.cos(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
2114        """ Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches"""
2115        self.e_s = np.stack([-np.cos(self.theta_vec), np.sin(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
2116        """ Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction """
2117        # get external (from the locked to the creeping patches) stress kernel
2118        K = Klinedisp(
2119            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2120            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2121            self.mid_x1_locked,
2122            self.mid_x2_locked,
2123            self.halflen_vec[self.ix_locked],
2124            self.theta_vec[self.ix_locked],
2125            self.nu,
2126            self.E,
2127        )[:, : self.n_locked]
2128        Kx1x1 = K[: self.n_creeping, :]
2129        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping : 2 * self.n_creeping, :]
2130        Kx1x2 = K[2 * self.n_creeping : 3 * self.n_creeping, :]
2131        K = (
2132            np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()])
2133            .reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_locked)
2134            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2135        )
2136        self.K_ext = np.einsum(
2137            "ki,ijkl,li->ij",
2138            self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2139            K,
2140            self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2141            optimize=True,
2142        )
2143        """ External stress kernel [Pa/m] """
2144        # get internal (within creeping patches) stress kernel
2145        K = Klinedisp(
2146            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2147            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2148            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2149            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2150            self.halflen_vec[~self.ix_locked],
2151            self.theta_vec[~self.ix_locked],
2152            self.nu,
2153            self.E,
2154        )[:, : self.n_creeping]
2155        Kx1x1 = K[: self.n_creeping, :]
2156        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping : 2 * self.n_creeping, :]
2157        Kx1x2 = K[2 * self.n_creeping : 3 * self.n_creeping, :]
2158        K = (
2159            np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()])
2160            .reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_creeping)
2161            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2162        )
2163        self.K_int = np.einsum(
2164            "ki,ijkl,li->ij",
2165            self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2166            K,
2167            self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2168            optimize=True,
2169        )
2170        """ Internal stress kernel [Pa/m] """
2171        self.n_state_upper = self.upper_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_upper
2172        """ Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable """
2173        self.n_state_lower = (
2174            self.lower_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_lower
2175            if self.lower_rheo is not None
2176            else 2 * self.n_creeping_lower
2177        )
2178        """ Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable """
2179        if (self.n_creeping_upper == 0) or (self.n_creeping_lower == 0):
2180            raise ValueError(
2181                "Defined geometry results in zero creeping patches in "
2182                "either the upper or lower plate interface."
2183            )
2184        # # if upper rheology is Burgers, tell it our specific shear modulus
2185        # if isinstance(self.upper_rheo, rheologies.LinearBurgers):
2186        #     self.upper_rheo.set_G(self.K_int[:self.n_creeping_upper, :self.n_creeping_upper])
2187        # discretized locking depth
2188        self.D_lock_disc = -self.end_upper[1, self.n_locked]
2189        """ Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
2190        self.x1_lock_disc = self.D_lock_disc / np.tan(self.theta)
2191        """ Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
2192
2193
2194class SubductionSimulation:
2195    """
2196    Subduction simulation container class.
2197    """
2198
2199    def __init__(
2200        self,
2201        v_plate,
2202        n_cycles_max,
2203        n_samples_per_eq,
2204        delta_tau_max,
2205        v_max,
2206        fault,
2207        Ds_0,
2208        Ds_0_logsigma,
2209        T_rec,
2210        T_rec_logsigma,
2211        D_asp_min,
2212        D_asp_max,
2213        T_anchor,
2214        T_last,
2215        enforce_v_plate,
2216        largehalflen,
2217        t_obs,
2218        pts_surf,
2219    ):
2220        """
2221        Create a subduction simulation.
2222
2223        Parameters
2224        ----------
2225        v_plate : float
2226            Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
2227        n_cycles_max : int
2228            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
2229        n_samples_per_eq : int
2230            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
2231        delta_tau_max : float
2232            Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
2233        v_max : float
2234            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
2235        fault : Fault2D
2236            Fault object
2237        Ds_0 : numpy.ndarray
2238            Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
2239        Ds_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2240            Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
2241        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
2242            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
2243        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2244            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
2245        D_asp_min : numpy.ndarray
2246            Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
2247        D_asp_max : numpy.ndarray
2248            Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
2249        T_anchor : str
2250            Anchor date where observations end
2251        T_last : list
2252            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
2253        enforce_v_plate : bool
2254            Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
2255        largehalflen : float
2256            Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
2257        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2258            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2259            or as Timestamps
2260        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2261            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2262        """
2263
2264        # save general sequence & fault parameters
2265        self.v_plate = float(v_plate)
2266        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology """
2267        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
2268        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
2269        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
2270        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
2271        self.delta_tau_max = float(delta_tau_max)
2272        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches """
2273        self.v_max = float(v_max)
2274        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches """
2275
2276        # define fault
2277        assert isinstance(fault, Fault2D)
2278        if not (
2279            isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous)
2280            or isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic)
2281        ) or not (
2282            isinstance(fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or (fault.lower_rheo is None)
2283        ):
2284            raise NotImplementedError(
2285                "SubductionSimulation is only implemented for "
2286                "NonlinearViscous or RateStateSteadyLogarithmic "
2287                "rheologies in the upper interface, and NonlinearViscous "
2288                "rheology in the lower interface."
2289            )
2290        self.fault = fault
2291        """ Fault object """
2292
2293        # cast earthquake slips as NumPy array
2294        self.Ds_0 = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0)
2295        """ Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es) """
2296        self.Ds_0_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0_logsigma)
2297        """ Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space """
2298        # load recurrence times
2299        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
2300        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
2301        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
2302        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
2303        # load the minimum and maximum depths of the earthquakes
2304        self.D_asp_min = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_min)
2305        """ Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
2306        self.D_asp_max = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_max)
2307        """ Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
2308        assert all([D <= self.fault.D_lock for D in self.D_asp_max]), (
2309            f"Asperity depths {self.D_asp_max / 1e3} km are deeper than the "
2310            f"locking depth {self.fault.D_lock / 1e3}."
2311        )
2312        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
2313        """ Anchor date where observations end """
2314        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
2315        self.T_last = T_last
2316        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
2317        # create a NumPy array that for each locked asperity has the slip per earthquake
2318        self.slip_mask = np.logical_and(
2319            self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1) < -self.D_asp_min.reshape(1, -1),
2320            self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1) > -self.D_asp_max.reshape(1, -1),
2321        )
2322        """ Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch """
2323        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
2324        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
2325        self.n_eq = self.Ds_0.size
2326        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
2327        self.n_eq_per_asp = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
2328        """ Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle """
2329
2330        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
2331        rng = np.random.default_rng()
2332        # first, create realizations of occurence times
2333        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
2334        # (ignore zero-slip earthquakes)
2335        self.T_rec_per_asp = [
2336            rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n)
2337            for t, s, n in zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)
2338        ]
2339        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
2340        self.Ds_0_per_asp = [
2341            rng.lognormal(np.log(d), s, n) if d > 0 else np.array([d] * n)
2342            for d, s, n in zip(self.Ds_0, self.Ds_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)
2343        ]
2344        """ Fault slip [m] realization """
2345
2346        # sanity check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
2347        self.slip_asperities = self.slip_mask.astype(int) * self.Ds_0.reshape(1, -1)
2348        """ Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity """
2349        v_eff_in_asp = (self.slip_asperities / self.T_rec.reshape(1, -1)).sum(axis=1)
2350        assert np.allclose(v_eff_in_asp, self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25), (
2351            "The nominal plate rate is not recovered in all asperities.\n"
2352            f"Plate velocity = {self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25}\n"
2353            f"Effective velocity in each asperity:\n{v_eff_in_asp}"
2354        )
2355
2356        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
2357        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate (enforced or not)
2358        # get the effective recurrence time as implied by the T_rec realizations
2359        T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(t) for t in self.T_rec_per_asp])
2360        # same for the effective cumulative slip
2361        Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(d) for d in self.Ds_0_per_asp])
2362        # we need to scale each individual sequence such that it implies the same
2363        # recurrence time and cumulative slip in each asperity
2364        # (again ignoring zero-slip earthquakes)
2365        T_fullcycle_eff_mean = np.mean(T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff)
2366        Ds_0_fullcycle_mean = np.ma.masked_equal(Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff, 0).mean()
2367        T_rec_per_asp_adj = [
2368            np.array(self.T_rec_per_asp[i])
2369            * T_fullcycle_eff_mean
2370            / T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i]
2371            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2372        ]
2373        Ds_0_per_asp_adj = [
2374            (
2375                np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i])
2376                * Ds_0_fullcycle_mean
2377                / Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i]
2378                if self.Ds_0[i] > 0
2379                else np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i])
2380            )
2381            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2382        ]
2383        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
2384        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
2385        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
2386        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
2387        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not """
2388        ix_nonzero_slip = np.argmax(self.Ds_0 > 0)
2389        v_plate_eff = (
2390            sum(Ds_0_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
2391            / sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
2392            / 86400
2393            / 365.25
2394        )
2395        if self.enforce_v_plate:
2396            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate / v_plate_eff
2397            for i in range(self.n_eq):
2398                T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
2399            v_plate_eff = self.v_plate
2400        self.v_plate_eff = v_plate_eff
2401        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
2402        self.T_eff = sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[0])
2403        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
2404
2405        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
2406        temp_slips = np.vstack(
2407            [
2408                self.slip_mask[:, i].reshape(1, -1) * Ds_0_per_asp_adj[i].reshape(-1, 1)
2409                for i in range(self.n_eq)
2410            ]
2411        )
2412        year_offsets = [
2413            (pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")).n / 365.25
2414            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2415        ]
2416        eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
2417            [
2418                self.T_eff
2419                - (
2420                    np.cumsum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[i])
2421                    - T_rec_per_asp_adj[i]
2422                    + year_offsets[i]
2423                )
2424                for i in range(self.n_eq)
2425            ]
2426        )
2427        # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
2428        eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
2429        # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
2430        eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=temp_slips)
2431        eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
2432        eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
2433        # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
2434        agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
2435        agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.fault.n_locked)})
2436        eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
2437        # convert time column to index and sort
2438        eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
2439        eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
2440        assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
2441        self.eq_df = eq_df
2442        """
2443        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
2444        for each asperity
2445        """
2446
2447        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
2448        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
2449        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate(
2450            [[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff], self.eq_df.index.values]
2451        )
2452        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
2453        t_eval = np.concatenate(
2454            [
2455                np.logspace(
2456                    0, np.log10(1 + T_frac[i]), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False
2457                )
2458                - 1
2459                + i_frac_cumsum[i]
2460                + j * self.T_eff
2461                for j in range(self.n_cycles_max)
2462                for i, t in enumerate(T_frac)
2463            ]
2464        )
2465        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
2466        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
2467        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
2468        self.t_eval = np.sort(
2469            np.concatenate([t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff])
2470        )
2471        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
2472        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
2473        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
2474
2475        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
2476        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
2477        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
2478        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
2479        self.ix_break = [
2480            i * (self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
2481            for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)
2482        ]
2483        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
2484        self.ix_eq = [
2485            self.ix_break[i] + j * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1
2486            for i in range(self.n_cycles_max)
2487            for j in range(1, 1 + self.n_slips)
2488        ]
2489        """ Indices of earthquakes """
2490
2491        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
2492        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
2493        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
2494        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
2495            t_obs = (
2496                self.T_eff
2497                + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)).total_seconds().values
2498                / 86400
2499                / 365.25
2500            )
2501        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
2502            if np.all(t_obs < 0):
2503                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
2504                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
2505            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), (
2506                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of "
2507                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
2508            )
2509        else:
2510            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
2511        self.t_obs = t_obs
2512        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
2513        # combine all possible timesteps
2514        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2515        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted)))
2516        """
2517        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
2518        [decimal years since cycle start]
2519        """
2520        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
2521        self.ix_break_joint = np.flatnonzero(
2522            np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_break])
2523        )
2524        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
2525        self.ix_eq_joint = np.flatnonzero(
2526            np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_eq])
2527        )
2528        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
2529        self.ix_obs_joint = np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, t_obs_shifted))
2530        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
2531
2532        # get vectors of upper plate rheology parameters
2533        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2534            # alpha_h
2535            self.alpha_h_vec = self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
2536                -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2537            )
2538            r""" Depth-variable :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
2539        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2540            # A, alpha_n, and n
2541            alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec = self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
2542                -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper], self.v_plate
2543            )
2544            self.alpha_n_vec = alpha_n_vec
2545            r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] of upper plate interface """
2546            self.n_vec = n_vec
2547            r""" Depth-variable :math:`n` [-] of upper plate interface """
2548            self.A_vec = A_vec
2549            r""" Depth-variable :math:`A ` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] of upper plate interface """
2550        else:
2551            raise NotImplementedError
2552
2553        # get unbounded delta_tau
2554        self.delta_tau_unbounded = self.fault.K_ext @ self.eq_df.values.T
2555        """ Unbounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2556        # get pseudoinverse of K_int for tapered slip
2557        self.K_int_inv_upper = np.linalg.pinv(
2558            self.fault.K_int[
2559                : self.fault.n_creeping_upper, : self.fault.n_creeping_upper
2560            ]
2561        )
2562        """ Inverse of K_int [m/Pa] """
2563        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower = (
2564            (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_max)
2565            ** (1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
2566            - (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_plate)
2567            ** (1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
2568            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None
2569            else np.inf
2570        )
2571        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in lower plate from capped velocity """
2572        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2573            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_max) ** (
2574                1 / self.n_vec
2575            ) - (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_plate) ** (1 / self.n_vec)
2576        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2577            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = self.alpha_h_vec * (
2578                np.log(self.v_max / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0)
2579                - np.log(self.v_plate / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0)
2580            )
2581        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
2582        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in upper plate from capped velocity """
2583        self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper = np.fmin(
2584            self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
2585        )
2586        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in upper plate """
2587        self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower = (
2588            min(self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower)
2589            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None
2590            else np.inf
2591        )
2592        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in lower plate """
2593        # create tapered slip by making delta_tau linearly increase until delta_tau_max
2594        delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded.copy()
2595        delta_tau_bounded[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] = np.fmin(
2596            self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper.reshape(-1, 1),
2597            self.delta_tau_unbounded[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :],
2598        )
2599        self.delta_tau_bounded = delta_tau_bounded
2600        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2601        # get the additional slip
2602        self.slip_taper = (
2603            self.K_int_inv_upper
2604            @ (self.delta_tau_bounded - self.delta_tau_unbounded)[
2605                : self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :
2606            ]
2607        )
2608        # check if the lower plate should have been bounded as well
2609        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2610            assert not np.any(
2611                np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, :])
2612                > self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower
2613            ), (
2614                "Maximum stress change delta_tau_bounded "
2615                f"{np.max(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded)):.2e} Pa in lower interface "
2616                f"above delta_tau_max = {self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower:.2e} Pa"
2617            )
2618        self.slip_taper_ts = (
2619            pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=self.slip_taper.T)
2620            .cumsum(axis=0)
2621            .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2622        )
2623        """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
2624
2625        # need the imagined location and orientation of the deep creep patches
2626        self.largehalflen = float(largehalflen)
2627        """ Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m] """
2628        self.mid_deep_x1 = np.array(
2629            [
2630                self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2631                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2632                * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2633                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2634                * self.largehalflen,
2635                self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2636                - self.fault.halflen_vec[
2637                    self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1
2638                ]
2639                - self.largehalflen,
2640                self.fault.mid_x1[-1]
2641                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2642                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.largehalflen,
2643            ]
2644        )
2645        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2646        self.mid_deep_x2 = np.array(
2647            [
2648                self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2649                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2650                * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2651                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2652                * self.largehalflen,
2653                self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1],
2654                self.fault.mid_x2[-1]
2655                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2656                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.largehalflen,
2657            ]
2658        )
2659        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2660        self.theta_vec_deep = np.array(
2661            [
2662                self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1],
2663                np.pi,
2664                self.fault.theta_vec[-1],
2665            ]
2666        )
2667        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for deep creep fault patches """
2668
2669        # create the Green's matrices
2670        self.pts_surf = pts_surf
2671        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
2672        self.n_stations = self.pts_surf.size
2673        """ Number of surface observing stations """
2674        self.G_surf_fault = Glinedisp(
2675            self.pts_surf,
2676            0,
2677            self.fault.mid_x1,
2678            self.fault.mid_x2,
2679            self.fault.halflen_vec,
2680            self.fault.theta_vec,
2681            self.fault.nu,
2682        )[:, : self.fault.mid_x1.size]
2683        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the main fault patches to surface motion """
2684        self.G_surf_deep = Glinedisp(
2685            self.pts_surf,
2686            0,
2687            self.mid_deep_x1,
2688            self.mid_deep_x2,
2689            self.largehalflen,
2690            self.theta_vec_deep,
2691            self.fault.nu,
2692        )[:, :3]
2693        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the deep creep patches to surface motion """
2694        self.G_surf = np.hstack([self.G_surf_fault, self.G_surf_deep])
2695        """ Joint Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the entire ESPM to surface motion """
2696
2697        # calculate the best initial velocity state from the steady state ODE
2698        v_plate_vec = np.ones(self.fault.n_creeping) * self.v_plate
2699        v_plate_vec[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :] *= -1
2700        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2701        """ Vector with the plate velocity for each creeping patch [m/s] """
2702        # get the initial velocity, taking advantage of the option that there could be a
2703        # deep transition zone
2704        v_init = v_plate_vec.copy()
2705        if self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition is not None:
2706            ix_deep = np.argmin(
2707                np.abs(
2708                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2709                    - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition
2710                    - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition_width
2711                )
2712            )
2713            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2714                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(
2715                    self.v_plate * 1e-6, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False
2716                )
2717            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2718                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(
2719                    0, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False
2720                )
2721        self.v_init = v_init
2722        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """
2723
2724    @property
2725    def locked_slip(self):
2726        """Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan"""
2727        return (
2728            self.eq_df.cumsum(axis=0)
2729            .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2730            .values.T
2731        )
2732
2733    @property
2734    def deep_creep_slip(self):
2735        """Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches for observation timestamps"""
2736        return (
2737            np.tile(self.t_obs.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
2738            * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
2739            * self.v_plate_eff
2740            * 86400
2741            * 365.25
2742        )
2743
2744    @staticmethod
2745    def read_config_file(config_file):
2746        """
2747        Read a configuration file and return it as a parsed dictionary.
2748
2749        Parameters
2750        ----------
2751        config_file : str
2752            Path to INI configuration file.
2753
2754        Returns
2755        -------
2756        cfg_dict : dict
2757            Parsed configuration file.
2758        """
2759
2760        # load configuration file
2761        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
2762        cfg.optionxform = str
2763        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
2764            cfg.read_file(f)
2765        cfg_seq, cfg_fault, cfg_mesh = cfg["sequence"], cfg["fault"], cfg["mesh"]
2766
2767        # parse rheologies
2768        upper_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["upper_rheo"])
2769        upper_rheo_type = upper_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2770        upper_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in upper_rheo_dict.items()}
2771        try:
2772            lower_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["lower_rheo"])
2773        except KeyError:
2774            lower_rheo_type = None
2775            lower_rheo_kw_args = None
2776        else:
2777            lower_rheo_type = lower_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2778            lower_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in lower_rheo_dict.items()}
2779
2780        # parse everything else
2781        cfg_dict = {
2782            "theta": np.deg2rad(cfg_fault.getfloat("theta_deg")),
2783            "D_lock": cfg_fault.getfloat("D_lock"),
2784            "H": cfg_fault.getfloat("H"),
2785            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
2786            "E": cfg_fault.getfloat("E"),
2787            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
2788            "halflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen"),
2789            "n_upper": cfg_mesh.getint("n_up"),
2790            "n_lower_left": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_l"),
2791            "n_lower_right": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_r"),
2792            "halflen_factor_lower": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen_factor_lower"),
2793            "D_max": cfg_mesh.getfloat("D_max", fallback=None),
2794            "x1_pretrench": cfg_mesh.getfloat("x1_pretrench", fallback=None),
2795            "v_plate": cfg_seq.getfloat("v_plate"),
2796            "n_cycles_max": cfg_seq.getint("n_cycles_max"),
2797            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_seq.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
2798            "delta_tau_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("delta_tau_max", fallback=np.inf),
2799            "v_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_max", fallback=np.inf),
2800            "Ds_0": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0"])),
2801            "Ds_0_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0_logsigma"])),
2802            "T_rec": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec"])),
2803            "T_rec_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec_logsigma"])),
2804            "D_asp_min": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_min"])),
2805            "D_asp_max": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_max"])),
2806            "T_anchor": cfg_seq.get("T_anchor"),
2807            "T_last": json.loads(cfg_seq["T_last"]),
2808            "enforce_v_plate": cfg_seq.getboolean("enforce_v_plate"),
2809            "largehalflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("largehalflen"),
2810            "upper_rheo_type": upper_rheo_type,
2811            "lower_rheo_type": lower_rheo_type,
2812            "upper_rheo_kw_args": upper_rheo_kw_args,
2813            "lower_rheo_kw_args": lower_rheo_kw_args,
2814        }
2815        return cfg_dict
2816
2817    @classmethod
2818    def from_config_dict(cls, cfg, t_obs, pts_surf):
2819        """
2820        Create a SubductionSimulation object from a configuration dictionary.
2821
2822        Parameters
2823        ----------
2824        cfg : dict
2825            Dictionary containing all parsed elements from the configuration file
2826        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2827            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2828            or as Timestamps
2829        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2830            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2831
2832        See Also
2833        --------
2834        read_config_file : To load a configuration file into a dictionary.
2835        """
2836
2837        # create rheology objects
2838        upper_rheo = globals()[cfg["upper_rheo_type"]](**cfg["upper_rheo_kw_args"])
2839        if cfg["lower_rheo_type"] is None:
2840            lower_rheo = None
2841        else:
2842            lower_rheo = globals()[cfg["lower_rheo_type"]](**cfg["lower_rheo_kw_args"])
2843
2844        # create fault object
2845        fault = Fault2D(
2846            theta=cfg["theta"],
2847            D_lock=cfg["D_lock"],
2848            H=cfg["H"],
2849            nu=cfg["nu"],
2850            E=cfg["E"],
2851            v_s=cfg["v_s"],
2852            halflen=cfg["halflen"],
2853            upper_rheo=upper_rheo,
2854            n_upper=cfg["n_upper"],
2855            lower_rheo=lower_rheo,
2856            n_lower_left=cfg["n_lower_left"],
2857            n_lower_right=cfg["n_lower_right"],
2858            halflen_factor_lower=cfg["halflen_factor_lower"],
2859            D_max=cfg["D_max"],
2860            x1_pretrench=cfg["x1_pretrench"],
2861        )
2862
2863        # create simulation object
2864        return cls(
2865            v_plate=cfg["v_plate"],
2866            n_cycles_max=cfg["n_cycles_max"],
2867            n_samples_per_eq=cfg["n_samples_per_eq"],
2868            delta_tau_max=cfg["delta_tau_max"],
2869            v_max=cfg["v_max"],
2870            fault=fault,
2871            Ds_0=cfg["Ds_0"],
2872            Ds_0_logsigma=cfg["Ds_0_logsigma"],
2873            T_rec=cfg["T_rec"],
2874            T_rec_logsigma=cfg["T_rec_logsigma"],
2875            D_asp_min=cfg["D_asp_min"],
2876            D_asp_max=cfg["D_asp_max"],
2877            T_anchor=cfg["T_anchor"],
2878            T_last=cfg["T_last"],
2879            enforce_v_plate=cfg["enforce_v_plate"],
2880            largehalflen=cfg["largehalflen"],
2881            t_obs=t_obs,
2882            pts_surf=pts_surf,
2883        )
2884
2885    @staticmethod
2886    def get_n(alpha_n, alpha_eff, v_eff):
2887        r"""
2888        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2889
2890        Parameters
2891        ----------
2892        alpha_n : float
2893            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2894        alpha_eff : float
2895            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2896        v_eff : float
2897            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2898
2899        Returns
2900        -------
2901        n : float
2902            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2903        """
2904        return (np.log(alpha_n) + np.log(v_eff)) / (np.log(alpha_eff) + np.log(v_eff))
2905
2906    @staticmethod
2907    def get_alpha_n(alpha_eff, n, v_eff):
2908        r"""
2909        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2910
2911        Parameters
2912        ----------
2913        alpha_eff : float
2914            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2915        n : float
2916            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2917        v_eff : float
2918            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2919
2920        Returns
2921        -------
2922        alpha_n : float
2923            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2924        """
2925        alpha_n = alpha_eff**n * v_eff ** (n - 1)
2926        return alpha_n
2927
2928    @staticmethod
2929    def get_alpha_eff(alpha_n, n, v_eff):
2930        r"""
2931        Calculate the effective linear viscous strength constant from the real one.
2932
2933        Parameters
2934        ----------
2935        alpha_n : float
2936            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2937        n : float
2938            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2939        v_eff : float
2940            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2941
2942        Returns
2943        -------
2944        alpha_eff : float
2945            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2946        """
2947        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2948            temp = v_eff.copy()
2949            temp[temp == 0] = np.nan
2950        else:
2951            temp = v_eff
2952        alpha_eff = alpha_n ** (1 / n) * temp ** ((1 - n) / n)
2953        return alpha_eff
2954
2955    @staticmethod
2956    def get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(alpha_h, v_eff):
2957        r"""
2958        Calculate the effective viscosity from the rate-dependent friction.
2959
2960        Parameters
2961        ----------
2962        alpha_h : float
2963            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
2964            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
2965            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
2966        v_eff : float
2967            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2968
2969        Returns
2970        -------
2971        alpha_eff : float
2972            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2973        """
2974        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2975            temp = v_eff.copy()
2976            temp[temp == 0] = np.nan
2977        else:
2978            temp = v_eff
2979        alpha_eff = alpha_h / temp
2980        return alpha_eff
2981
2982    def run(self, simple_rk4=False):
2983        """
2984        Run a full simulation.
2985        """
2986        # run forward integration
2987        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2988            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2989                full_state = flat_run_rdlog(
2990                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
2991                    self.ix_break_joint,
2992                    self.ix_eq_joint,
2993                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
2994                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
2995                    self.fault.K_int,
2996                    self.fault.K_ext,
2997                    self.v_plate_vec,
2998                    self.v_init,
2999                    self.slip_taper,
3000                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3001                    self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0,
3002                    self.alpha_h_vec,
3003                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
3004                )
3005            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3006                full_state = flat_run_plvis(
3007                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
3008                    self.ix_break_joint,
3009                    self.ix_eq_joint,
3010                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3011                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3012                    self.fault.K_int,
3013                    self.fault.K_ext,
3014                    self.v_plate_vec,
3015                    self.v_init,
3016                    self.slip_taper,
3017                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3018                    self.alpha_n_vec,
3019                    self.n_vec,
3020                    self.A_vec,
3021                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
3022                )
3023            else:
3024                raise NotImplementedError
3025        elif isinstance(self.fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3026            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3027                full_state = flat_run_plvis_plvis(
3028                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
3029                    self.ix_break_joint,
3030                    self.ix_eq_joint,
3031                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3032                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3033                    self.fault.K_int,
3034                    self.fault.K_ext,
3035                    self.v_plate_vec,
3036                    self.v_init,
3037                    self.slip_taper,
3038                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3039                    self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_n,
3040                    self.fault.upper_rheo.n,
3041                    self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
3042                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n,
3043                    simple_rk4,
3044                )
3045            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3046                full_state = flat_run_rdlog_plvis(
3047                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
3048                    self.ix_break_joint,
3049                    self.ix_eq_joint,
3050                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3051                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3052                    self.fault.K_int,
3053                    self.fault.K_ext,
3054                    self.v_plate_vec,
3055                    self.v_init,
3056                    self.slip_taper,
3057                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3058                    self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0,
3059                    self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_h,
3060                    self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
3061                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n,
3062                    simple_rk4,
3063                )
3064            else:
3065                raise NotImplementedError
3066        else:
3067            raise NotImplementedError
3068        # extract the observations that were actually requested
3069        obs_state = full_state[:, self.ix_obs_joint].copy()
3070        # since we're only calculating transient surface displacements, need to
3071        # remove the tapered slip due to bounded stresses
3072        obs_state[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] -= self.slip_taper_ts.values.T
3073        # convert to surface displacements
3074        surf_disps = get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(
3075            obs_state,
3076            self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3077            self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3078            np.ascontiguousarray(self.G_surf[:, self.fault.n_locked :]),
3079            self.deep_creep_slip,
3080        )
3081        return full_state, obs_state, surf_disps
3082
3083    def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
3084        """
3085        Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens.
3086        """
3087        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
3088        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
3089            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
3090        )
3091        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
3092        if n_slips_obs == 0:
3093            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
3094        else:
3095            i_slips_obs = [
3096                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
3097                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
3098            ]
3099            obs_zeroed[:, : i_slips_obs[0]] -= obs_zeroed[
3100                :, i_slips_obs[0] - 1
3101            ].reshape(-1, 1)
3102            obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0] :] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0]].reshape(
3103                -1, 1
3104            )
3105            for i in range(1, n_slips_obs):
3106                obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[i] :] -= obs_zeroed[
3107                    :, i_slips_obs[i]
3108                ].reshape(-1, 1)
3109        return obs_zeroed
3110
3111    def _reduce_full_state(self, data):
3112        # get all NaN columns
3113        cols_all_nan = np.all(np.isnan(data), axis=0)
3114        # check if there was early stopping
3115        if cols_all_nan.sum() > 0:
3116            # get the border indices where integrations have been skipped
3117            ix_last, ix_first = np.flatnonzero(cols_all_nan)[[0, -1]]
3118            ix_last -= 1
3119            ix_first += 1
3120            # get indices before and after the NaN period
3121            ix_valid = np.r_[0:ix_last, ix_first : self.t_eval_joint.size]
3122            # subset data
3123            data = data[:, ix_valid]
3124            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint[ix_valid].copy()
3125            t_sub[ix_last:] -= self.t_eval_joint[ix_first] - self.t_eval_joint[ix_last]
3126            n_cyc_completed = int(np.round(self.t_eval_joint[ix_last] / self.T_eff)) + 1
3127        else:
3128            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint.copy()
3129            n_cyc_completed = self.n_cycles_max + 1
3130        # done
3131        return data, t_sub, n_cyc_completed
3132
3133    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
3134        """
3135        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
3136
3137        Parameters
3138        ----------
3139        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
3140            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
3141        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
3142            Noisy surface observations.
3143
3144        Returns
3145        -------
3146        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3147        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3148        """
3149        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3150
3151        # some helper variables
3152        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf)
3153        i_off = 3 * np.std(obs_zeroed.ravel())
3154        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
3155        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
3156            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
3157        )
3158        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
3159        if n_slips_obs > 0:
3160            i_slips_obs = [
3161                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
3162                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
3163            ]
3164            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
3165        else:
3166            t_last_slips = []
3167        # start plot
3168        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
3169        for tslip in t_last_slips:
3170            ax[0].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
3171            ax[1].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
3172        for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
3173            if obs_noisy is not None:
3174                ax[0].plot(
3175                    self.t_obs,
3176                    obs_noisy[ix, :] + i * i_off,
3177                    ".",
3178                    c="k",
3179                    rasterized=True,
3180                )
3181                ax[1].plot(
3182                    self.t_obs,
3183                    obs_noisy[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i * i_off,
3184                    ".",
3185                    c="k",
3186                    rasterized=True,
3187                )
3188            ax[0].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, :] + i * i_off, c=f"C{i}")
3189            ax[1].plot(
3190                self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i * i_off, c=f"C{i}"
3191            )
3192        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
3193        ax[0].set_ylabel("Horizontal [m]")
3194        ax[1].set_ylabel("Vertical [m]")
3195        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
3196        return fig, ax
3197
3198    def plot_fault_velocities(self, full_state):
3199        """
3200        Plot the velocities on all creeping fault patches.
3201
3202        Parameters
3203        ----------
3204        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3205            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3206
3207        Returns
3208        -------
3209        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3210        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3211        """
3212        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3213        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm
3214        from cmcrameri import cm
3215
3216        # extract velocities
3217        vels = (
3218            full_state[
3219                np.r_[
3220                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper,
3221                    self.fault.n_state_upper
3222                    + self.fault.n_creeping_lower : self.fault.n_state_upper
3223                    + self.fault.n_state_lower,
3224                ],
3225                :,
3226            ]
3227            / self.v_plate
3228        )
3229        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
3230        vels, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(vels)
3231        # normalize time
3232        t_sub /= self.T_eff
3233        # prepare plot
3234        norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1, vmin=-1, vmax=100)
3235        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
3236            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
3237            ax = [ax]
3238        else:
3239            fig, ax = plt.subplots(
3240                nrows=2, sharex=True, figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained"
3241            )
3242        # plot velocities
3243        c = ax[0].pcolormesh(
3244            t_sub,
3245            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3246            vels[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
3247            norm=norm,
3248            cmap=cm.vik,
3249            shading="flat",
3250        )
3251        ax[0].set_yticks(self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3)
3252        # add vertical lines for cycle breaks
3253        for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
3254            ax[0].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
3255        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
3256        ax[0].invert_yaxis()
3257        # repeat for lower interface, if simulated
3258        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3259            c = ax[1].pcolormesh(
3260                t_sub,
3261                self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
3262                -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, :-1],
3263                norm=norm,
3264                cmap=cm.vik,
3265                shading="flat",
3266            )
3267            ax[1].set_yticks(self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3)
3268            # add horizontal lines to show where the lower interface is below the locked zone
3269            ax[1].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
3270            ax[1].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
3271            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
3272                ax[1].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
3273            ax[1].invert_yaxis()
3274        # finish figure
3275        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
3276            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
3277            ax[0].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3278        else:
3279            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
3280            ax[1].set_ylabel("Lower Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
3281            ax[1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3282        fig.colorbar(
3283            c,
3284            ax=ax,
3285            location="right",
3286            orientation="vertical",
3287            fraction=0.05,
3288            label="$v/v_{plate}$",
3289        )
3290        fig.suptitle("Normalized Fault Patch Velocities")
3291        return fig, ax
3292
3293    def plot_fault_slip(
3294        self, full_state, deficit=True, include_locked=True, include_deep=True
3295    ):
3296        """
3297        Plot the cumulative slip (deficit) for the fault patches.
3298
3299        Parameters
3300        ----------
3301        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3302            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3303        deficit : bool, optional
3304            If ``True`` (default), remove the plate velocity to plot slip deficit,
3305            otherwise keep it included.
3306        include_locked : bool, optional
3307            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the locked patches.
3308        include_deep : bool, optional
3309            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the semi-infinite patches
3310            at the end of the interfaces.
3311
3312        Returns
3313        -------
3314        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3315        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3316        """
3317        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3318        from matplotlib.colors import Normalize, SymLogNorm
3319        from cmcrameri import cm
3320
3321        # extract slip
3322        slip = full_state[
3323            np.r_[
3324                : self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3325                self.fault.n_state_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper
3326                + self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3327            ],
3328            :,
3329        ]
3330        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
3331        slip, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(slip)
3332        # normalize to slip per full cycle
3333        cum_slip_per_cycle = self.v_plate_eff * self.T_eff * 86400 * 365.25
3334        slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
3335        # add optional slip histories, if desired
3336        if include_locked:
3337            eq_df_joint = pd.DataFrame(
3338                index=(
3339                    self.eq_df.index.values.reshape(1, -1)
3340                    + self.T_eff * np.arange(n_cyc_completed).reshape(-1, 1)
3341                ).ravel(),
3342                data=np.tile(self.eq_df.values, (n_cyc_completed, 1)),
3343            )
3344            locked_slip = (
3345                eq_df_joint.cumsum(axis=0)
3346                .reindex(index=t_sub, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3347                .values.T
3348            )
3349            locked_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
3350        if include_deep:
3351            deep_creep_slip = (
3352                np.tile(t_sub.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
3353                * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
3354                * self.v_plate_eff
3355                * 86400
3356                * 365.25
3357            )
3358            deep_creep_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
3359        # remove plate velocity to get slip deficit, if desired
3360        if deficit:
3361            cmap = cm.vik
3362            norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1e-2, vmin=-1, vmax=1)
3363            slip[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
3364            slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :] += t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
3365            slip -= slip[:, -2].reshape(-1, 1)
3366            if include_locked:
3367                locked_slip -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
3368            if include_deep:
3369                deep_creep_slip -= (
3370                    t_sub.reshape(1, -1) * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
3371                ) / self.T_eff
3372        else:
3373            norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=n_cyc_completed)
3374            cmap = cm.batlow
3375        # normalize time
3376        t_sub /= self.T_eff
3377        # prepare figure
3378        nrows = (
3379            1
3380            + int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
3381            + int(include_locked)
3382            + int(include_deep) * 3
3383        )
3384        hr_locked = (
3385            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked] - self.fault.end_upper[0, 0]
3386        ) / (self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0])
3387        hr_lower = (self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]) / (
3388            self.fault.end_upper[0, -1] - self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked]
3389        )
3390        hr = (
3391            [hr_locked] * int(include_locked)
3392            + [1]
3393            + [hr_locked, hr_locked] * int(include_deep)
3394            + [hr_lower] * int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
3395            + [hr_locked] * int(include_deep)
3396        )
3397        fig, ax = plt.subplots(
3398            nrows=nrows,
3399            sharex=True,
3400            gridspec_kw={"height_ratios": hr},
3401            figsize=(10, 5),
3402            layout="constrained",
3403        )
3404        iax = 0
3405        # plot locked
3406        if include_locked:
3407            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3408                t_sub,
3409                self.fault.end_upper[0, : self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
3410                locked_slip[:, :-1],
3411                norm=norm,
3412                cmap=cmap,
3413                shading="flat",
3414            )
3415            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Locked\n$x_1$ [km]")
3416            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [0, self.fault.n_locked]] / 1e3
3417            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
3418            iax += 1
3419        # plot upper creeping
3420        c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3421            t_sub,
3422            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3423            slip[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
3424            norm=norm,
3425            cmap=cmap,
3426            shading="flat",
3427        )
3428        ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
3429        temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3
3430        ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
3431        iax += 1
3432        # plot end patch on upper interface
3433        if include_deep:
3434            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_upper[0, -1], self.mid_deep_x1[0]]) / 1e3
3435            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3436                t_sub,
3437                temp_x1,
3438                deep_creep_slip[0, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
3439                norm=norm,
3440                cmap=cmap,
3441                shading="flat",
3442            )
3443            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
3444            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
3445            iax += 1
3446        # plot left end patch on lower interface
3447        if include_deep:
3448            temp_x1 = np.array([self.mid_deep_x1[1], self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]]) / 1e3
3449            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3450                t_sub,
3451                temp_x1,
3452                -deep_creep_slip[1, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
3453                norm=norm,
3454                cmap=cmap,
3455                shading="flat",
3456            )
3457            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
3458            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, ["$-\\infty$", f"{temp_x1[1]:.0f}"])
3459            iax += 1
3460        # plot lower creeping
3461        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3462            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3463                t_sub,
3464                self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
3465                -slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, :-1],
3466                norm=norm,
3467                cmap=cmap,
3468                shading="flat",
3469            )
3470            ax[iax].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
3471            ax[iax].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
3472            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
3473            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3
3474            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
3475            iax += 1
3476        # plot right end patch on lower interface
3477        if include_deep:
3478            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_lower[0, -1], self.mid_deep_x1[2]]) / 1e3
3479            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3480                t_sub,
3481                temp_x1,
3482                -deep_creep_slip[2, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
3483                norm=norm,
3484                cmap=cmap,
3485                shading="flat",
3486            )
3487            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
3488            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
3489            iax += 1
3490        # finish figure
3491        for iax in range(len(ax)):
3492            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
3493                ax[iax].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
3494            ax[iax].invert_yaxis()
3495        ax[-1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3496        fig.colorbar(
3497            c,
3498            ax=ax,
3499            location="right",
3500            orientation="vertical",
3501            fraction=0.05,
3502            label="$(s - t*v_{plate})/s_{full}$" if deficit else "$s/s_{full}$",
3503        )
3504        suptitle = "Normalized Fault Patch Slip"
3505        if deficit:
3506            suptitle += " Deficit"
3507        fig.suptitle(suptitle)
3508        return fig, ax
3509
3510    def plot_eq_velocities(self, full_state):
3511        """
3512        Plot the before and after velocities on all creeping fault patches
3513        for each distinct earthquake.
3514
3515        Parameters
3516        ----------
3517        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3518            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3519
3520        Returns
3521        -------
3522        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3523        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3524        """
3525        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3526
3527        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
3528        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
3529        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3530        tdiff = np.array(
3531            [np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
3532        )
3533        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
3534            warn(
3535                "Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
3536                f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds."
3537            )
3538        ix_eq_last = [
3539            np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last
3540        ]
3541        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
3542        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), (
3543            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the "
3544            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
3545        )
3546        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
3547        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
3548        slip_avg = [
3549            slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
3550            for ieq in range(n_eq_found)
3551        ]
3552        # extract velocities
3553        vels = (
3554            full_state[
3555                np.r_[
3556                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper,
3557                    self.fault.n_state_upper
3558                    + self.fault.n_creeping_lower : self.fault.n_state_upper
3559                    + self.fault.n_state_lower,
3560                ],
3561                :,
3562            ]
3563            / self.v_plate
3564        )
3565        # prepare plot
3566        fig, ax = plt.subplots(
3567            nrows=n_eq_found,
3568            ncols=1 if self.fault.lower_rheo is None else 2,
3569            sharey=True,
3570            layout="constrained",
3571        )
3572        ax = np.asarray(ax).reshape(n_eq_found, -1)
3573        # loop over earthquakes
3574        for irow, ieq in enumerate(ix_eq_last):
3575            # repeat plot for before and after
3576            for ioff, label in enumerate(["before", "after"]):
3577                ax[irow, 0].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
3578                ax[irow, 0].plot(
3579                    self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
3580                    vels[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, ieq - 1 + ioff],
3581                    c=f"C{ioff}",
3582                    label=label,
3583                )
3584                if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3585                    ax[irow, 1].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
3586                    ax[irow, 1].plot(
3587                        self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :] / 1e3,
3588                        -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, ieq - 1 + ioff],
3589                        c=f"C{ioff}",
3590                        label=label,
3591                    )
3592        # finish plot
3593        for irow in range(n_eq_found):
3594            ax[irow, 0].set_title(f"Upper Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
3595            ax[irow, 0].legend()
3596            ax[irow, 0].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3597            ax[irow, 0].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
3598            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3599                ax[irow, 1].set_title(f"Lower Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
3600                ax[irow, 1].axvline(0, c="k", lw=1)
3601                ax[irow, 1].axvline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
3602                ax[irow, 1].tick_params(labelleft=True)
3603                ax[irow, 1].legend()
3604                ax[irow, 1].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3605                ax[irow, 1].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
3606        fig.suptitle("Normalized Earthquake Velocity Changes")
3607        return fig, ax
3608
3609    def plot_fault(self):
3610        """
3611        Plot the fault.
3612
3613        Returns
3614        -------
3615        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3616        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3617        """
3618        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3619
3620        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 3), layout="constrained")
3621        ax.plot(
3622            self.fault.end_upper[0, : self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
3623            self.fault.end_upper[1, : self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
3624            marker="|",
3625            markeredgecolor="k",
3626            label="Locked",
3627        )
3628        ax.plot(
3629            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3630            self.fault.end_upper[1, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3631            marker="|",
3632            markeredgecolor="k",
3633            label="Upper Creeping",
3634        )
3635        ax.plot(
3636            self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
3637            self.fault.end_lower[1, :] / 1e3,
3638            marker="|",
3639            markeredgecolor="k",
3640            label="Lower Creeping",
3641        )
3642        ax.plot(
3643            self.pts_surf / 1e3,
3644            np.zeros_like(self.pts_surf),
3645            "^",
3646            markeredgecolor="none",
3647            markerfacecolor="k",
3648            label="Observers",
3649        )
3650        ax.axhline(0, lw=1, c="0.5", zorder=-1)
3651        ax.legend()
3652        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3653        ax.set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
3654        ax.set_title("Fault Mesh and Observer Locations")
3655        ax.set_aspect("equal")
3656        return fig, ax
3657
3658    def plot_slip_phases(self, full_state, post_inter_transition=0.01, normalize=True):
3659        """
3660        Plot the cumulative slip on the fault for the three different
3661        phases (coseismic, early postseismic, and interseismic).
3662
3663        Only works if there is a single earthquake in the sequence.
3664
3665        Parameters
3666        ----------
3667        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3668            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3669        post_inter_transition : float, optional
3670            Fraction of the recurrence time that should be considered
3671            early postseismic and not interseismic.
3672
3673        Returns
3674        -------
3675        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3676        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3677        """
3678        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3679        from scipy.interpolate import interp1d
3680
3681        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
3682        if not self.n_eq == 1:
3683            raise NotImplementedError(
3684                "Don't know how to plot slip phases if "
3685                "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence."
3686            )
3687        # get coseismic slip
3688        co = np.concatenate([self.eq_df.values.ravel(), self.slip_taper.ravel()])
3689        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
3690        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3691        ix_eq_last = (
3692            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
3693            - self.ix_break_joint[-2]
3694        )
3695        # reorganize interseismic slip
3696        slip = full_state[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.ix_break_joint[-2] :]
3697        slip_pre = slip[:, :ix_eq_last]
3698        slip_post = slip[:, ix_eq_last:]
3699        slip_pre += (slip_post[:, -1] - slip_pre[:, 0]).reshape(-1, 1)
3700        slip_joint = np.hstack([slip_post, slip_pre])
3701        slip_joint -= slip_joint[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
3702        # same for time
3703        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2] :].copy()
3704        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
3705        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
3706        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
3707        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
3708        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
3709        # since slip_joint is now already cumulative slip since the earthquake,
3710        # with the tapered slip removed, we can just read out the early
3711        # postseismic and rest interseismic cumulative slip distributions
3712        post = interp1d(t_last_joint, slip_joint)(post_inter_transition * self.T_eff)
3713        inter = slip_joint[:, -1] - post
3714        post = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), post])
3715        inter = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), inter])
3716        # optionally, normalize by total expected cumulative slip over the entire cycle
3717        if normalize:
3718            total_slip = self.T_eff * self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25
3719            co /= total_slip
3720            post /= total_slip
3721            inter /= total_slip
3722        # make figure
3723        fig, ax = plt.subplots(layout="constrained")
3724        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[: self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, co, label="Coseismic")
3725        ax.plot(
3726            self.fault.mid_x1[: self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, post, label="Postseismic"
3727        )
3728        ax.plot(
3729            self.fault.mid_x1[: self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, inter, label="Interseismic"
3730        )
3731        ax.legend()
3732        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3733        ax.set_ylabel(
3734            "Normalized cumulative slip [-]" if normalize else "Cumulative Slip [m]"
3735        )
3736        ax.set_title(
3737            "Slip Phases (Post-/Interseismic cutoff at "
3738            f"{post_inter_transition:.1%} "
3739            "$T_{rec}$)"
3740        )
3741        return fig, ax
3742
3743    def plot_viscosity(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
3744        """
3745        Plot the viscosity structure with depth for the steady state, as well as
3746        for the immediate pre- and coseismic velocities.
3747
3748        For multiple earthquakes, it will use the minimum preseismic and maximum
3749        postseismic velocities.
3750
3751        Parameters
3752        ----------
3753        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3754            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3755        return_viscosities : bool, optional
3756            Also return the preseismic, steady-state, and postseismic viscosities.
3757
3758        Returns
3759        -------
3760        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3761        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3762        """
3763        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3764
3765        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
3766        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
3767        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3768        tdiff = np.array(
3769            [np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
3770        )
3771        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
3772            warn(
3773                "Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
3774                f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds."
3775            )
3776        ix_eq_last = [
3777            np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last
3778        ]
3779        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
3780        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), (
3781            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the "
3782            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
3783        )
3784        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
3785        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
3786        slip_avg = [
3787            slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
3788            for ieq in range(n_eq_found)
3789        ]
3790        # extract preseismic velocities
3791        vels_pre = np.array(
3792            [
3793                full_state[
3794                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper, ix - 1
3795                ]
3796                for ix in ix_eq_last
3797            ]
3798        ).T
3799        vels_post = np.array(
3800            [
3801                full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper, ix]
3802                for ix in ix_eq_last
3803            ]
3804        ).T
3805        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3806            # calculate viscosity profiles
3807            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3808                self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_pre
3809            )
3810            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3811                self.alpha_n_vec, self.n_vec, self.v_plate_eff
3812            )
3813            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3814                self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_post
3815            )
3816        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
