3817            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3818                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_pre
3819            )
3820            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3821                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.v_plate_eff
3822            )
3823            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3824                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_post
3825            )
3826        else:
3827            raise NotImplementedError()
3828        vis_mins = 10 ** np.floor(
3829            np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_post * 0.999).min(axis=0))
3830        )
3831        vis_maxs = 10 ** np.ceil(
3832            np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_pre * 1.001).max(axis=0))
3833        )
3834        # make plot
3835        fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=n_eq_found, sharey=True, layout="constrained")
3836        ax = np.atleast_1d(ax)
3837        ax[0].set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
3838        for i in range(n_eq_found):
3839            ax[i].fill_betweenx(
3840                [0, self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[1] / 1e3],
3841                vis_mins[i],
3842                vis_maxs[i],
3843                facecolor="0.8",
3844                label="Locked",
3845            )
3846            ax[i].fill_betweenx(
3847                self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
3848                vis_pre[:, i],
3849                vis_post[:, i],
3850                alpha=0.5,
3851                label="Simulated",
3852            )
3853            ax[i].plot(
3854                vis_ss,
3855                self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
3856                label="Plate Rate",
3857            )
3858            ax[i].set_xscale("log")
3859            ax[i].legend(loc="lower left")
3860            ax[i].set_ylim(
3861                self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper - 1] / 1e3, 0
3862            )
3863            ax[i].set_xlim(vis_mins[i], vis_maxs[i])
3864            ax[i].set_title(f"$s={slip_avg[i]:.2g}$ m")
3865            ax[i].set_xlabel(r"$\alpha_{eff}$ [Pa * s/m]")
3866        # finish
3867        if return_viscosities:
3868            return fig, ax, vis_pre, vis_ss, vis_post
3869        else:
3870            return fig, ax
3871
3872    def plot_viscosity_timeseries(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
3873        """
3874        Plot the viscosity timeseries with depth for the entire last cycle.
3875
3876        Parameters
3877        ----------
3878        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3879            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3880        return_viscosities : bool, optional
3881            Also return the viscosity timeseries.
3882
3883        Returns
3884        -------
3885        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3886        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3887        """
3888        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3889        from matplotlib.colors import LogNorm
3890        from cmcrameri import cm
3891
3892        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
3893        if not self.n_eq == 1:
3894            raise NotImplementedError(
3895                "Don't know how to plot viscosity timeseries if "
3896                "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence."
3897            )
3898        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
3899        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3900        ix_eq_last = (
3901            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
3902            - self.ix_break_joint[-2]
3903        )
3904        # reorganize interseismic velocities
3905        vels = full_state[
3906            self.fault.n_creeping_upper : 2 * self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3907            self.ix_break_joint[-2] :,
3908        ]
3909        vels_pre = vels[:, :ix_eq_last]
3910        vels_post = vels[:, ix_eq_last:]
3911        vels = np.hstack([vels_post, vels_pre])
3912        # same for time
3913        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2] :].copy()
3914        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
3915        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
3916        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
3917        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
3918        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
3919        # convert velocities to effective viscosity
3920        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3921            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3922                self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels
3923            )
3924        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3925            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3926                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels
3927            )
3928        else:
3929            raise NotImplementedError()
3930        # get index of deep transition
3931        patch_depths = -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
3932        ix_deep = np.argmin(
3933            np.abs(patch_depths - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition)
3934        )
3935        # subset vels to skip zero-velocity uppermost patch
3936        vis_ts = vis_ts[1:, :]
3937        # get percentage of final viscosity
3938        rel_vis = vis_ts / vis_ts[:, -1][:, None]
3939        rel_vis_masked = np.ma.MaskedArray(
3940            rel_vis, np.diff(rel_vis, axis=1, prepend=rel_vis[:, 0][:, None]) <= 0
3941        ).filled(np.nan)
3942        levels = [0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8]
3943        rel_vis_iquant = np.concatenate(
3944            [
3945                np.nanargmax(rel_vis_masked > lvl, axis=1, keepdims=True)
3946                for lvl in levels
3947            ],
3948            axis=1,
3949        )
3950        # normalize time
3951        t_sub = t_last_joint / self.T_eff
3952        # prepare plot
3953        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
3954        # plot velocities
3955        c = ax.pcolormesh(
3956            t_sub,
3957            np.abs(
3958                self.fault.end_upper[
3959                    1, self.fault.n_locked + 1 : self.fault.n_locked + ix_deep + 1
3960                ]
3961                / 1e3
3962            ),
3963            vis_ts[: ix_deep - 1, :-1],
3964            norm=LogNorm(
3965                vmin=10 ** np.floor(np.log10(np.median(vis_ts[: ix_deep - 1, 0]))),
3966                vmax=10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(vis_ts[: ix_deep - 1, -1]))),
3967            ),
3968            cmap=cm.batlow,
3969            shading="flat",
3970        )
3971        for i in range(len(levels)):
3972            ax.plot(
3973                t_sub[rel_vis_iquant[: ix_deep - 1, i]],
3974                patch_depths[1:ix_deep] / 1e3,
3975                color="w",
3976            )
3977        ax.set_xscale("symlog", linthresh=1e-3)
3978        ax.set_xlim([0, 1])
3979        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
3980        ax.invert_yaxis()
3981        # finish figure
3982        ax.set_ylabel("Depth $x_2$ [km]")
3983        ax.set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3984        fig.colorbar(
3985            c,
3986            ax=ax,
3987            location="right",
3988            orientation="vertical",
3989            fraction=0.05,
3990            label=r"$\alpha_{eff}$",
3991        )
3992        fig.suptitle("Effective Viscosity Timeseries")
3993        # finish
3994        if return_viscosities:
3995            return fig, ax, t_sub, vis_ts
3996        else:
3997            return fig, ax
class Rheology(abc.ABC): 
22class Rheology(ABC):
23    """
24    Abstract base class for rheologies.
25    """

Abstract base class for rheologies.

class NonlinearViscous(Rheology): 
 28class NonlinearViscous(Rheology):
 29    r"""
 30    Implement a nonlinear viscous fault rheology, where the velocity :math:`v` is
 31    :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` given the shear stress :math:`\tau`, a strength
 32    constant :math:`\alpha_n`, and a constant exponent :math:`n`.
 33    """
 34
 35    def __init__(
 36        self,
 37        n,
 38        alpha_n,
 39        n_mid=None,
 40        alpha_n_mid=None,
 41        mid_transition=None,
 42        n_deep=None,
 43        alpha_n_deep=None,
 44        deep_transition=None,
 45        deep_transition_width=None,
 46        n_boundary=None,
 47        alpha_n_boundary=None,
 48    ):
 49        r"""
 50        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
 51
 52        Parameters
 53        ----------
 54        alpha_n : float
 55            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
 56        n : float
 57            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
 58        """
 59        # input check
 60        assert not np.logical_xor(
 61            deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None
 62        )
 63        # set number of variables
 64        self.n_vars = 2
 65        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
 66        # initialization
 67        self._n = float(n)
 68        self._n_mid = float(n_mid) if n_mid is not None else self.n
 69        self._n_deep = float(n_deep) if n_deep is not None else self.n_mid
 70        self.n_boundary = float(n_boundary) if n_boundary is not None else self.n_deep
 71        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
 72        self.alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
 73        self.alpha_n_mid = (
 74            float(alpha_n_mid) if alpha_n_mid is not None else self.alpha_n
 75        )
 76        self.alpha_n_deep = (
 77            float(alpha_n_deep) if alpha_n_deep is not None else self.alpha_n_mid
 78        )
 79        self.alpha_n_boundary = (
 80            float(alpha_n_boundary)
 81            if alpha_n_boundary is not None
 82            else self.alpha_n_deep
 83        )
 84        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
 85        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
 86        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
 87        self.deep_transition = (
 88            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
 89        )
 90        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
 91        self.deep_transition_width = (
 92            None if deep_transition_width is None else float(deep_transition_width)
 93        )
 94        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
 95
 96    @property
 97    def alpha_n(self):
 98        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
 99        return self._alpha_n
100
101    @alpha_n.setter
102    def alpha_n(self, alpha_n):
103        self._alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
104        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
105
106    @property
107    def alpha_n_mid(self):
108        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
109        return self._alpha_n_mid
110
111    @alpha_n_mid.setter
112    def alpha_n_mid(self, alpha_n_mid):
113        self._alpha_n_mid = float(alpha_n_mid)
114        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
115
116    @property
117    def alpha_n_deep(self):
118        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
119        return self._alpha_n_deep
120
121    @alpha_n_deep.setter
122    def alpha_n_deep(self, alpha_n_deep):
123        self._alpha_n_deep = float(alpha_n_deep)
124        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
125
126    @property
127    def n(self):
128        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
129        return self._n
130
131    @n.setter
132    def n(self, n):
133        self._n = float(n)
134        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
135
136    @property
137    def n_mid(self):
138        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
139        return self._n_mid
140
141    @n_mid.setter
142    def n_mid(self, n_mid):
143        self._n_mid = float(n_mid)
144        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
145
146    @property
147    def n_deep(self):
148        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
149        return self._n_deep
150
151    @n_deep.setter
152    def n_deep(self, n_deep):
153        self._n_deep = float(n_deep)
154        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
155
156    @property
157    def A(self):
158        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
159        return self._A
160
161    @property
162    def A_mid(self):
163        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
164        return self._A_mid
165
166    @property
167    def A_deep(self):
168        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
169        return self._A_deep
170
171    @staticmethod
172    def calc_A(alpha_n, n):
173        """Calculate A from alpha_n and n"""
174        return alpha_n ** (1 / n)
175
176    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff):
177        r"""
178        Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of :math:`\alpha_n`, :math:`n`, and :math:`A`,
179        assuming :math:`\alpha_n` and :math:`\alpha_{n,eff}` vary log-linearly with depth,
180        and :math:`n` adapts between the transition points.
181        """
182        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
183        # start knots list
184        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
185        vals_alpha_n = [self.alpha_n]
186        vals_n = [self.n]
187        # add optional mid transition
188        if self.mid_transition is not None:
189            knots.append(
190                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))]
191            )
192            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_mid)
193            vals_n.append(self.n_mid)
194        # add optional deep transition
195        if self.deep_transition is not None:
196            knots.append(
197                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))]
198            )
199            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_deep)
200            vals_n.append(self.n_deep)
201            knots.append(
202                patch_depths[
203                    np.argmin(
204                        np.abs(
205                            patch_depths
206                            - self.deep_transition
207                            - self.deep_transition_width
208                        )
209                    )
210                ]
211            )
212            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
213            vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
214        # add final value
215        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
216        vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
217        vals_alpha_n = np.array(vals_alpha_n)
218        vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
219        vals_n = np.array(vals_n)
220        vals_alpha_eff = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(vals_alpha_n, vals_n, v_eff)
221        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
222        alpha_n_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_n))(patch_depths)
223        alpha_eff_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_eff))(patch_depths)
224        # get n and A
225        n_vec = SubductionSimulation.get_n(alpha_n_vec, alpha_eff_vec, v_eff)
226        A_vec = alpha_n_vec ** (1 / n_vec)
227        return alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec

Implement a nonlinear viscous fault rheology, where the velocity \( v \) is \( v = \tau^n / \alpha_n \) given the shear stress \( \tau \), a strength constant \( \alpha_n \), and a constant exponent \( n \).

NonlinearViscous( n, alpha_n, n_mid=None, alpha_n_mid=None, mid_transition=None, n_deep=None, alpha_n_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None, n_boundary=None, alpha_n_boundary=None) 
35    def __init__(
36        self,
37        n,
38        alpha_n,
39        n_mid=None,
40        alpha_n_mid=None,
41        mid_transition=None,
42        n_deep=None,
43        alpha_n_deep=None,
44        deep_transition=None,
45        deep_transition_width=None,
46        n_boundary=None,
47        alpha_n_boundary=None,
48    ):
49        r"""
50        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
51
52        Parameters
53        ----------
54        alpha_n : float
55            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
56        n : float
57            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
58        """
59        # input check
60        assert not np.logical_xor(
61            deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None
62        )
63        # set number of variables
64        self.n_vars = 2
65        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
66        # initialization
67        self._n = float(n)
68        self._n_mid = float(n_mid) if n_mid is not None else self.n
69        self._n_deep = float(n_deep) if n_deep is not None else self.n_mid
70        self.n_boundary = float(n_boundary) if n_boundary is not None else self.n_deep
71        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
72        self.alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
73        self.alpha_n_mid = (
74            float(alpha_n_mid) if alpha_n_mid is not None else self.alpha_n
75        )
76        self.alpha_n_deep = (
77            float(alpha_n_deep) if alpha_n_deep is not None else self.alpha_n_mid
78        )
79        self.alpha_n_boundary = (
80            float(alpha_n_boundary)
81            if alpha_n_boundary is not None
82            else self.alpha_n_deep
83        )
84        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
85        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
86        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
87        self.deep_transition = (
88            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
89        )
90        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
91        self.deep_transition_width = (
92            None if deep_transition_width is None else float(deep_transition_width)
93        )
94        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """

Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.

Parameters
  • alpha_n (float): Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n (float): Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]
n_vars

Number of variables to track by rheology [-]

n_boundary

Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]

alpha_n 
96    @property
97    def alpha_n(self):
98        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
99        return self._alpha_n

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

alpha_n_mid 
106    @property
107    def alpha_n_mid(self):
108        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
109        return self._alpha_n_mid

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

alpha_n_deep 
116    @property
117    def alpha_n_deep(self):
118        r"""Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]"""
119        return self._alpha_n_deep

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

alpha_n_boundary

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

mid_transition

Depth [m] for the middle transition point

deep_transition

(Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point

deep_transition_width

(Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point

n 
126    @property
127    def n(self):
128        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
129        return self._n

137    def n_mid(self):
138        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
139        return self._n_mid

147    def n_deep(self):
148        """Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]"""
149        return self._n_deep

A 
156    @property
157    def A(self):
158        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
159        return self._A

A_mid 
161    @property
162    def A_mid(self):
163        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
164        return self._A_mid

166    @property
167    def A_deep(self):
168        r"""Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]"""
169        return self._A_deep

Rescaled strength term \( A = \alpha_n^{1/n} \) [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]

@staticmethod
def calc_A(alpha_n, n): 
171    @staticmethod
172    def calc_A(alpha_n, n):
173        """Calculate A from alpha_n and n"""
174        return alpha_n ** (1 / n)

Calculate A from alpha_n and n

def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff): 
176    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff):
177        r"""
178        Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of :math:`\alpha_n`, :math:`n`, and :math:`A`,
179        assuming :math:`\alpha_n` and :math:`\alpha_{n,eff}` vary log-linearly with depth,
180        and :math:`n` adapts between the transition points.
181        """
182        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
183        # start knots list
184        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
185        vals_alpha_n = [self.alpha_n]
186        vals_n = [self.n]
187        # add optional mid transition
188        if self.mid_transition is not None:
189            knots.append(
190                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))]
191            )
192            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_mid)
193            vals_n.append(self.n_mid)
194        # add optional deep transition
195        if self.deep_transition is not None:
196            knots.append(
197                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))]
198            )
199            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_deep)
200            vals_n.append(self.n_deep)
201            knots.append(
202                patch_depths[
203                    np.argmin(
204                        np.abs(
205                            patch_depths
206                            - self.deep_transition
207                            - self.deep_transition_width
208                        )
209                    )
210                ]
211            )
212            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
213            vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
214        # add final value
215        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
216        vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
217        vals_alpha_n = np.array(vals_alpha_n)
218        vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
219        vals_n = np.array(vals_n)
220        vals_alpha_eff = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(vals_alpha_n, vals_n, v_eff)
221        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
222        alpha_n_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_n))(patch_depths)
223        alpha_eff_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_eff))(patch_depths)
224        # get n and A
225        n_vec = SubductionSimulation.get_n(alpha_n_vec, alpha_eff_vec, v_eff)
226        A_vec = alpha_n_vec ** (1 / n_vec)
227        return alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec

Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of \( \alpha_n \), \( n \), and \( A \), assuming \( \alpha_n \) and \( \alpha_{n,eff} \) vary log-linearly with depth, and \( n \) adapts between the transition points.

class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology): 
230class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology):
231    r"""
232    Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively
233    becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by
234
235    :math:`f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E`
236
237    where :math:`f_{ss}` is the steady-state friction, :math:`f_0` is a reference
238    friction, :math:`a` and :math:`b` are the rate-and-state frictional parameters,
239    :math:`\zeta = \log (v / v_0)` is the logarithmic velocity, :math:`\tau` is the shear
240    stress, and :math:`\sigma_E` is the effective fault normal stress.
241    """
242
243    def __init__(
244        self,
245        v_0,
246        alpha_h,
247        alpha_h_mid=None,
248        mid_transition=None,
249        alpha_h_deep=None,
250        deep_transition=None,
251        deep_transition_width=None,
252        alpha_h_boundary=None,
253    ):
254        r"""
255        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
256
257        Parameters
258        ----------
259        v_0 : float
260            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
261        alpha_h : float
262            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
263            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
264            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
265        """
266        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
267        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
268        # input check
269        assert not np.logical_xor(
270            deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None
271        )
272        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
273        # set number of variables
274        self.n_vars = 2
275        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
276        # initialization
277        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
278        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
279        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
280        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
281        self.alpha_h_mid = (
282            float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None else self.alpha_h
283        )
284        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
285        self.alpha_h_deep = (
286            float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None else self.alpha_h_mid
287        )
288        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
289        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
290            float(alpha_h_boundary)
291            if alpha_h_boundary is not None
292            else self.alpha_h_deep
293        )
294        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
295        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
296        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
297        self.deep_transition = (
298            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
299        )
300        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
301        self.deep_transition_width = (
302            None if deep_transition_width is None else float(deep_transition_width)
303        )
304        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
305
306    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths):
307        r"""
308        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
309        varies log-linearly with depth.
310        """
311        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
312        # start knots list
313        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
314        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
315        # add optional mid transition
316        if self.mid_transition is not None:
317            knots.append(
318                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))]
319            )
320            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
321        # add optional deep transition
322        if self.deep_transition is not None:
323            knots.append(
324                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))]
325            )
326            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
327            knots.append(
328                patch_depths[
329                    np.argmin(
330                        np.abs(
331                            patch_depths
332                            - self.deep_transition
333                            - self.deep_transition_width
334                        )
335                    )
336                ]
337            )
338            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
339        # add final value
340        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
341        vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
342        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
343        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
344        alpha_h_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h))(patch_depths)
345        return alpha_h_vec

Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by

\( f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E \)

where \( f_{ss} \) is the steady-state friction, \( f_0 \) is a reference friction, \( a \) and \( b \) are the rate-and-state frictional parameters, \( \zeta = \log (v / v_0) \) is the logarithmic velocity, \( \tau \) is the shear stress, and \( \sigma_E \) is the effective fault normal stress.

RateStateSteadyLogarithmic( v_0, alpha_h, alpha_h_mid=None, mid_transition=None, alpha_h_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None, alpha_h_boundary=None) 
243    def __init__(
244        self,
245        v_0,
246        alpha_h,
247        alpha_h_mid=None,
248        mid_transition=None,
249        alpha_h_deep=None,
250        deep_transition=None,
251        deep_transition_width=None,
252        alpha_h_boundary=None,
253    ):
254        r"""
255        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
256
257        Parameters
258        ----------
259        v_0 : float
260            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
261        alpha_h : float
262            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
263            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
264            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
265        """
266        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
267        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
268        # input check
269        assert not np.logical_xor(
270            deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None
271        )
272        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
273        # set number of variables
274        self.n_vars = 2
275        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
276        # initialization
277        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
278        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
279        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
280        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
281        self.alpha_h_mid = (
282            float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None else self.alpha_h
283        )
284        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
285        self.alpha_h_deep = (
286            float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None else self.alpha_h_mid
287        )
288        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
289        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
290            float(alpha_h_boundary)
291            if alpha_h_boundary is not None
292            else self.alpha_h_deep
293        )
294        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
295        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
296        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
297        self.deep_transition = (
298            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
299        )
300        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
301        self.deep_transition_width = (
302            None if deep_transition_width is None else float(deep_transition_width)
303        )
304        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """

Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.

Parameters
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
  • alpha_h (float): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \), where \( a \) and \( b \) [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties, and \( \sigma_E \) [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
alpha_h

Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

n_vars

Number of variables to track by rheology [-]

v_0

Reference velocity \( v_0 \) [m/s]

alpha_h_mid

Middle rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

alpha_h_deep

Deep rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

alpha_h_boundary

Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

mid_transition

Depth [m] for the middle transition point

deep_transition

(Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point

deep_transition_width

(Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point

def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths): 
306    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths):
307        r"""
308        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
309        varies log-linearly with depth.
310        """
311        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
312        # start knots list
313        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
314        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
315        # add optional mid transition
316        if self.mid_transition is not None:
317            knots.append(
318                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))]
319            )
320            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
321        # add optional deep transition
322        if self.deep_transition is not None:
323            knots.append(
324                patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))]
325            )
326            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
327            knots.append(
328                patch_depths[
329                    np.argmin(
330                        np.abs(
331                            patch_depths
332                            - self.deep_transition
333                            - self.deep_transition_width
334                        )
335                    )
336                ]
337            )
338            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
339        # add final value
340        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
341        vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
342        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
343        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
344        alpha_h_vec = 10 ** interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h))(patch_depths)
345        return alpha_h_vec

Calculate the depth-dependent array of \( \alpha_h \), assuming it varies log-linearly with depth.

@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A, n): 
348@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
349def dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A, n):
350    r"""
351    Calculate the velocity derivative for a power-law viscous rheology.
352
353    From :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` we get:
354
355    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{\alpha_n} \tau^{n-1} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
356
357    where
358
359    :math:`\tau^{n-1} = \left( \alpha_n v \right)^{\frac{n-1}{n}}`
360
361    simplifying to
362
363    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{A} v^{1-\frac{1}{n}} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
364
365    Parameters
366    ----------
367    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
368        1D array of the shear stress derivative
369    v : numpy.ndarray
370        1D array of the current velocity
371    A : numpy.ndarray
372        Rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
373    n : numpy.ndarray
374        Power-law exponent
375
376    Returns
377    -------
378    dvdt : numpy.ndarray
379        1D array of the velocity derivative.
380    """
381    signs = np.sign(v)
382    return (n / A) * (signs * v) ** (1 - 1 / n) * dtaudt

Calculate the velocity derivative for a power-law viscous rheology.

From \( v = \tau^n / \alpha_n \) we get:

\( \frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{\alpha_n} \tau^{n-1} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

where

\( \tau^{n-1} = \left( \alpha_n v \right)^{\frac{n-1}{n}} \)

simplifying to

\( \frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{A} v^{1-\frac{1}{n}} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

Parameters
  • dtaudt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array of the shear stress derivative
  • v (numpy.ndarray): 1D array of the current velocity
  • A (numpy.ndarray): Rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n (numpy.ndarray): Power-law exponent
Returns
  • dvdt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array of the velocity derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec): 
385@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
386def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec):
387    r"""
388    Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction
389    rate in linear space.
390
391    Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit
392    formulation for the slip acceleration :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}`:
393
394    :math:`\frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt}`
395
396    Recognizing that :math:`\tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E` and assuming
397    constant effective normal stress leads to
398    :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt}`, which
399    can be rearranged to give the final expression
400
401    :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
402
403    Parameters
404    ----------
405    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
406        Traction derivative :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt}` [Pa/s] in linear space
407    alpha_h_vec : float
408        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
409
410    Returns
411    -------
412    dzetadt : numpy.ndarray
413        Velocity derivative :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}` [1/s] in logarithmic space.
414    """
415    return dtaudt / alpha_h_vec

Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction rate in linear space.

Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit formulation for the slip acceleration \( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \):

\( \frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \)

Recognizing that \( \tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E \) and assuming constant effective normal stress leads to \( \frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt} \), which can be rearranged to give the final expression

\( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

Parameters
  • dtaudt (numpy.ndarray): Traction derivative \( \frac{d \tau}{dt} \) [Pa/s] in linear space
  • alpha_h_vec (float): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
Returns
  • dzetadt (numpy.ndarray): Velocity derivative \( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \) [1/s] in logarithmic space.
@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus, delta_tau, alpha_n, n, A): 
418@njit(
419    float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True
420)
421def get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus, delta_tau, alpha_n, n, A):
422    r"""
423    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change due to an instantaneous stress change
424    to the fault patches. It is derived from:
425
426    :math:`\tau_{+} = \tau_{-} + \Delta \tau`
427
428    and plugging in the relationship :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n`, we get
429
430    :math:`\sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{+}} = \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{-}} + \Delta \tau`
431
432    and finally
433
434    :math:`v_{+} = \frac{\left( A \sqrt[n]{v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \right)^n}{\alpha_n}`
435
436    Parameters
437    ----------
438    v_minus : numpy.ndarray
439        Initial velocity :math:`v_{-}` [m/s]
440    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray
441        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
442    alpha_n : numpy.ndarray
443        Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
444    n : numpy.ndarray
445        Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
446    A : numpy.ndarray
447        Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]
448
449    Returns
450    -------
451    v_plus : numpy.ndarray
452        Velocity :math:`v_{+}` [m/s] after stress change
453    """
454    signs = np.sign(v_minus)
455    temp = A * (signs * v_minus) ** (1 / n) + (signs * delta_tau)
456    return np.abs(temp) ** (n - 1) * temp / alpha_n * signs

Calculate the instantaneous velocity change due to an instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. It is derived from:

\( \tau_{+} = \tau_{-} + \Delta \tau \)

and plugging in the relationship \( v = \tau^n / \alpha_n \), we get

\( \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{+}} = \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \)

and finally

\( v_{+} = \frac{\left( A \sqrt[n]{v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \right)^n}{\alpha_n} \)

Parameters
  • v_minus (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity \( v_{-} \) [m/s]
  • delta_tau (numpy.ndarray): Traction stress change \( \Delta \tau \) [Pa]
  • alpha_n (numpy.ndarray): Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n (numpy.ndarray): Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]
  • A (numpy.ndarray): Rescaled strength term \( A = \alpha_n^{1/n} \) [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]
Returns
  • v_plus (numpy.ndarray): Velocity \( v_{+} \) [m/s] after stress change
@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec): 
459@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
460def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec):
461    r"""
462    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an
463    instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the
464    derivatuion from the expression in ``RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel``:
465
466    :math:`\log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
467
468    and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for :math:`\zeta`
469    to give us the final result
470
471    :math:`\zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
472
473    Parameters
474    ----------
475    zeta_minus : numpy.ndarray
476        Initial velocity :math:`\zeta_{-}` [-] in logarithmic space
477    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray, optional
478        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
479    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
480        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
481
482    Returns
483    -------
484    zeta_plus : numpy.ndarray
485        Velocity :math:`\zeta_{+}` [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
486
487    See Also
488    --------
489    alpha_h
490    """
491    return zeta_minus + delta_tau / alpha_h_vec

Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the derivatuion from the expression in RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel:

\( \log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h \)

and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for \( \zeta \) to give us the final result

\( \zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h \)

Parameters
  • zeta_minus (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity \( \zeta_{-} \) [-] in logarithmic space
  • delta_tau (numpy.ndarray, optional): Traction stress change \( \Delta \tau \) [Pa]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
Returns
  • zeta_plus (numpy.ndarray): Velocity \( \zeta_{+} \) [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
See Also

alpha_h

@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_plvis(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, mu_over_2vs): 
494@njit(
495    float64[:](
496        float64,
497        float64[:],
498        float64,
499        float64[:, ::1],
500        float64[:, ::1],
501        float64[:],
502        float64[:],
503        float64,
504    ),
505    cache=True,
506)
507def flat_ode_plvis(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, mu_over_2vs):
508    r"""
509    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
510    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
511    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
512
513    Parameters
514    ----------
515    t : float
516        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
517    state : numpy.ndarray
518        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
519        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
520    v_plate : float
521        Plate velocity.
522    K_int : numpy.ndarray
523        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
524    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
525        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
526        patches onto the creeping patches.
527    A_upper : numpy.ndarray
528        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
529    n_upper : numpy.ndarray
530        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
531    mu_over_2vs : float
532        Radiation damping factor
533
534    Returns
535    -------
536    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
537        1D array with the state derivative.
538    """
539    # get number of variables within state
540    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
541    n_vars_upper = 2
542    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
543    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
544    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
545    # extract total velocities
546    v = state[n_creeping_upper:]
547    # get shear strain rate
548    signs = np.sign(v)
549    temp = mu_over_2vs * (n_upper / A_upper) * (signs * v) ** (1 - 1 / n_upper)
550    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)) / (1 + temp)
551    # get ODE
552    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A_upper, n_upper)))
553    # return
554    return dstatedt

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
  • v_plate (float): Plate velocity.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • A_upper (numpy.ndarray): Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_upper (numpy.ndarray): Upper plate interface power-law exponent
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_rdlog(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
557@njit(
558    float64[:](
559        float64,
560        float64[:],
561        float64,
562        float64[:, ::1],
563        float64[:, ::1],
564        float64,
565        float64[:],
566        float64,
567    ),
568    cache=True,
569)
570def flat_ode_rdlog(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs):
571    r"""
572    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
573    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
574    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
575
576    Parameters
577    ----------
578    t : float
579        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
580    state : numpy.ndarray
581        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
582        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
583    v_plate : float
584        Plate velocity.
585    K_int : numpy.ndarray
586        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
587    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
588        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
589        patches onto the creeping patches.
590    v_0 : float
591        Reference velocity [m/s]
592    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
593        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
594    mu_over_2vs : float
595        Radiation damping factor
596
597    Returns
598    -------
599    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
600        1D array with the state derivative.
601    """
602    # get number of variables within state
603    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
604    n_vars_upper = 2
605    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
606    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
607    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
608    # extract total velocities
609    zeta = state[n_creeping_upper:]
610    v = v_0 * np.exp(zeta)
611    # get shear strain rate
612    temp = mu_over_2vs * v / alpha_h_vec
613    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)) / (1 + temp)
614    # get ODE
615    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec)))
616    # return
617    return dstatedt

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
  • v_plate (float): Plate velocity.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_plvis_plvis( t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower): 
620@njit(
621    float64[:](
622        float64,
623        float64[:],
624        int64,
625        float64[:],
626        float64[:, ::1],
627        float64[:, ::1],
628        float64,
629        float64,
630        float64,
631        float64,
632    ),
633    cache=True,
634)
635def flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
636    t,
637    state,
638    n_creeping_upper,
639    v_plate_vec,
640    K_int,
641    K_ext,
642    A_upper,
643    n_upper,
644    A_lower,
645    n_lower,
646):
647    """
648    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
649    powerlaw-viscous rheology in both the upper and lower plate interface.
650
651    Parameters
652    ----------
653    t : float
654        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
655    state : numpy.ndarray
656        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
657        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
658        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
659    n_creeping_upper : int
660        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
661        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
662        be derived from the size of ``state``.
663    v_plate_vec : float
664        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
665    K_int : numpy.ndarray
666        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
667    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
668        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
669        patches onto the creeping patches.
670    A_upper : float
671        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
672    n_upper : float
673        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
674    A_lower : float
675        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
676    n_lower : float
677        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
678
679    Returns
680    -------
681    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
682        1D array with the state derivative.
683    """
684    # get number of variables within state
685    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
686    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
687    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
688    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
689    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
690    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
691    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
692    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
693    # split up state
694    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
695    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
696    # extract total velocities
697    v_upper = state_upper[n_creeping_upper:]
698    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
699    # get shear strain rate
700    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
701    dtaudt = K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1)
702    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
703    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
704    # get individual rheologies' ODE
705    dstatedt_upper = np.concatenate(
706        (
707            v_upper,
708            dvdt_plvis(
709                dtaudt_upper,
710                v_upper,
711                np.ones_like(v_upper) * A_upper,
712                np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_upper,
713            ),
714        )
715    )
716    dstatedt_lower = np.concatenate(
717        (
718            v_lower,
719            dvdt_plvis(
720                dtaudt_lower,
721                v_lower,
722                np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
723                np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower,
724            ),
725        )
726    )
727    # concatenate and return
728    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with powerlaw-viscous rheology in both the upper and lower plate interface.

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity, lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface. The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then be derived from the size of state.
  • v_plate_vec (float): Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • A_upper (float): Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_upper (float): Upper plate interface power-law exponent
  • A_lower (float): Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_rdlog_plvis( t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_upper, A_lower, n_lower): 
731@njit(
732    float64[:](
733        float64,
734        float64[:],
735        int64,
736        float64[:],
737        float64[:, ::1],
738        float64[:, ::1],
739        float64,
740        float64,
741        float64,
742        float64,
743    ),
744    cache=True,
745)
746def flat_ode_rdlog_plvis(
747    t,
748    state,
749    n_creeping_upper,
750    v_plate_vec,
751    K_int,
752    K_ext,
753    v_0,
754    alpha_h_upper,
755    A_lower,
756    n_lower,
757):
758    r"""
759    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
760    rate-dependent (log-space) rheology in the upper and nonlinear viscous
761    rheology in the lower plate interface.
762
763    Parameters
764    ----------
765    t : float
766        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
767    state : numpy.ndarray
768        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
769        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
770        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
771    n_creeping_upper : int
772        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
773        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
774        be derived from the size of ``state``.
775    v_plate_vec : float
776        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
777    K_int : numpy.ndarray
778        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
779    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
780        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
781        patches onto the creeping patches.
782    v_0 : float
783        Reference velocity [m/s]
784    alpha_h_upper : float
785        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
786    A_lower : float
787        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
788    n_lower : float
789        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
790
791    Returns
792    -------
793    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
794        1D array with the state derivative.
795    """
796    # get number of variables within state
797    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
798    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
799    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
800    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
801    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
802    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
803    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
804    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
805    # split up state
806    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
807    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
808    # extract total velocities
809    v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(state_upper[n_creeping_upper:])
810    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
811    # get shear strain rate
812    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
813    dtaudt = K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1)
814    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
815    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
816    # get individual rheologies' ODE
817    dstatedt_upper = np.concatenate(
818        (v_upper, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt_upper, np.ones_like(v_lower) * alpha_h_upper))
819    )
820    dstatedt_lower = np.concatenate(
821        (
822            v_lower,
823            dvdt_plvis(
824                dtaudt_lower,
825                v_lower,
826                np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
827                np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower,
828            ),
829        )
830    )
831    # concatenate and return
832    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with rate-dependent (log-space) rheology in the upper and nonlinear viscous rheology in the lower plate interface.

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity, lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface. The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then be derived from the size of state.
  • v_plate_vec (float): Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_upper (float): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • A_lower (float): Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64, float64, float64[:], float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
def myrk4( ti, tf, state0, t_eval, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower): 
836@njit(
837    float64[:, :](
838        float64,
839        float64,
840        float64[:],
841        float64[:],
842        int64,
843        float64[:],
844        float64[:, ::1],
845        float64[:, ::1],
846        float64,
847        float64,
848        float64,
849        float64,
850    ),
851    cache=True,
852)
853def myrk4(
854    ti,
855    tf,
856    state0,
857    t_eval,
858    n_creeping_upper,
859    v_plate_vec,
860    K_int,
861    K_ext,
862    A_upper,
863    n_upper,
864    A_lower,
865    n_lower,
866):
867    h = t_eval[1] - t_eval[0]
868    num_state = state0.size
869    num_eval = t_eval.size
870    sol = np.zeros((num_eval, num_state))
871    sol[0, :] = state0
872    for i in range(1, num_eval):
873        cur = sol[i - 1, :]
874        k1 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
875            ti,
876            cur,
877            n_creeping_upper,
878            v_plate_vec,
879            K_int,
880            K_ext,
881            A_upper,
882            n_upper,
883            A_lower,
884            n_lower,
885        )
886        cur = sol[i - 1, :] + (h / 2) * k1
887        k2 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
888            ti,
889            cur,
890            n_creeping_upper,
891            v_plate_vec,
892            K_int,
893            K_ext,
894            A_upper,
895            n_upper,
896            A_lower,
897            n_lower,
898        )
899        cur = sol[i - 1, :] + (h / 2) * k2
900        k3 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
901            ti,
902            cur,
903            n_creeping_upper,
904            v_plate_vec,
905            K_int,
906            K_ext,
907            A_upper,
908            n_upper,
909            A_lower,
910            n_lower,
911        )
912        cur = sol[i - 1, :] + h * k3
913        k4 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(
914            ti,
915            cur,
916            n_creeping_upper,
917            v_plate_vec,
918            K_int,
919            K_ext,
920            A_upper,
921            n_upper,
922            A_lower,
923            n_lower,
924        )
925        sol[i, :] = sol[i - 1, :] + (h / 6) * (k1 + 2 * k2 + 2 * k3 + k4)
926    return sol
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_run_plvis( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
 929@njit(
 930    float64[:, :](
 931        float64[:],
 932        int64[:],
 933        int64[:],
 934        int64,
 935        int64,
 936        float64[:, ::1],
 937        float64[:, ::1],
 938        float64[:],
 939        float64[:],
 940        float64[:, ::1],
 941        float64[:, ::1],
 942        float64[:],
 943        float64[:],
 944        float64[:],
 945        float64,
 946    ),
 947    cache=True,
 948)
 949def flat_run_plvis(
 950    t_eval,
 951    i_break,
 952    i_eq,
 953    n_creeping_upper,
 954    n_creeping_lower,
 955    K_int,
 956    K_ext,
 957    v_plate_vec,
 958    v_init,
 959    slip_taper,
 960    delta_tau_bounded,
 961    alpha_n_vec,
 962    n_vec,
 963    A_vec,
 964    mu_over_2vs,
 965):
 966    r"""
 967    Run the simulation.
 968
 969    Parameters
 970    ----------
 971    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
 972        Evaluation times [s]
 973    i_break : numpy.ndarray
 974        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
 975    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
 976        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
 977    n_creeping_upper : int
 978        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
 979    n_creeping_lower : int
 980        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
 981    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 982        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
 983    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 984        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
 985    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
 986        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
 987    v_init : numpy.ndarray
 988        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
 989    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
 990        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
 991    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
 992        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
 993    alpha_n_vec : numpy.ndarray
 994        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
 995        at each patch
 996    n_vec : float
 997        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-] at each patch
 998    A_vec : float
 999        Rescaled upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
1000        [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
1001    mu_over_2vs : float
1002        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
1003        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
1004
1005    Returns
1006    -------
1007    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1008        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1009    """
1010    # initialize parameters
1011    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1012    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1013    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1014    n_eval = t_eval.size
1015    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1016
1017    # initialize arrays
1018    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1019    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1020    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
1021    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
1022    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1023    full_state[:] = np.nan
1024    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1025        (s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1026    )
1027
1028    # make flat ODE function arguments
1029    args = (
1030        v_plate_vec[0],
1031        K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
1032        K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :],
1033        A_vec,
1034        n_vec,
1035        mu_over_2vs,
1036    )
1037
1038    # integrate
1039    spun_up = 0
1040    i_slip = 0
1041    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1042    i = 0
1043    atol = np.ones(n_state_upper) * 1e-6
1044    atol[n_creeping_upper:] = 1e-15
1045    while i < steps.size - 1:
1046        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
1047        # get indices
1048        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1049        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1050        # call integrator
1051        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1052            sol = solve_ivp(
1053                flat_ode_plvis,
1054                t_span=[ti, tf],
1055                y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
1056                t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1057                method="LSODA",
1058                rtol=1e-6,
1059                atol=atol,
1060                args=args,
1061            )
1062            success = sol.success
1063            if success:
1064                sol = sol.y
1065            else:
1066                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
1067        if not success:
1068            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1069        # save state to output array
1070        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1071        # fill in the imposed lower state
1072        full_state[n_state_upper : n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji : jf + 1] = (
1073            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1074            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji : jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
1075        )
1076        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower :, ji : jf + 1] = (
1077            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1078        )
1079        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1080        if i == steps.size - 2:
1081            break
1082        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1083        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1084            old_full_state = full_state[
1085                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1086            ]
1087            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1088            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1089            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1090            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1091            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1092            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1093            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1094            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
1095            if stop_now:
1096                spun_up = jf
1097                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1098                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1099        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1100            break
1101        # apply step change only if there is one
1102        if jf in i_eq:
1103            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1104            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1105            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1106            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1107            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1108            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1109            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1110            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1111            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(
1112                v_minus_upper,
1113                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1114                alpha_n_vec,
1115                n_vec,
1116                A_vec,
1117            )
1118            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
1119            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1120                (s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1121            )
1122            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1123        else:
1124            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1125        # advance
1126        i += 1
1127
1128    # warn if we never spun up
1129    if not spun_up:
1130        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1131
1132    # done
1133    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • alpha_n_vec (numpy.ndarray): Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
  • n_vec (float): Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-] at each patch
  • A_vec (float): Rescaled upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor \( \mu / 2 v_s \), where \( \mu \) is the shear modulus [Pa] and \( v_s \) is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_run_rdlog( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
1136@njit(
1137    float64[:, :](
1138        float64[:],
1139        int64[:],
1140        int64[:],
1141        int64,
1142        int64,
1143        float64[:, ::1],
1144        float64[:, ::1],
1145        float64[:],
1146        float64[:],
1147        float64[:, ::1],
1148        float64[:, ::1],
1149        float64,
1150        float64[:],
1151        float64,
1152    ),
1153    cache=True,
1154)
1155def flat_run_rdlog(
1156    t_eval,
1157    i_break,
1158    i_eq,
1159    n_creeping_upper,
1160    n_creeping_lower,
1161    K_int,
1162    K_ext,
1163    v_plate_vec,
1164    v_init,
1165    slip_taper,
1166    delta_tau_bounded,
1167    v_0,
1168    alpha_h_vec,
1169    mu_over_2vs,
1170):
1171    r"""
1172    Run the simulation.
1173
1174    Parameters
1175    ----------
1176    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1177        Evaluation times [s]
1178    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1179        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1180    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1181        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1182    n_creeping_upper : int
1183        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1184    n_creeping_lower : int
1185        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1186    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1187        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1188    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1189        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1190    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1191        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1192    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1193        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1194    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1195        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1196    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1197        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1198    v_0 : float
1199        Reference velocity [m/s]
1200    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
1201        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1202    mu_over_2vs : float
1203        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
1204        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
1205
1206    Returns
1207    -------
1208    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1209        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1210    """
1211    # initialize parameters
1212    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1213    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1214    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1215    n_eval = t_eval.size
1216    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1217
1218    # initialize arrays
1219    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1220    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1221    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
1222    zeta_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
1223    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
1224    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1225    full_state[:] = np.nan
1226    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1227        (s_minus_upper, zeta_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1228    )
1229
1230    # make flat ODE function arguments
1231    args = (
1232        v_plate_vec[0],
1233        K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
1234        K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :],
1235        v_0,
1236        alpha_h_vec,
1237        mu_over_2vs,
1238    )
1239
1240    # integrate
1241    spun_up = 0
1242    i_slip = 0
1243    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1244    i = 0
1245    while i < steps.size - 1:
1246        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
1247        # get indices
1248        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1249        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1250        # call integrator
1251        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1252            sol = solve_ivp(
1253                flat_ode_rdlog,
1254                t_span=[ti, tf],
1255                y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
1256                t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1257                method="LSODA",
1258                args=args,
1259            )
1260            success = sol.success
1261            if success:
1262                sol = sol.y
1263            else:
1264                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
1265        if not success:
1266            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1267        # save state to output array
1268        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1269        # fill in the imposed lower state
1270        full_state[n_state_upper : n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji : jf + 1] = (
1271            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1272            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji : jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
1273        )
1274        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower :, ji : jf + 1] = (
1275            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
1276        )
1277        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1278        if i == steps.size - 2:
1279            break
1280        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1281        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1282            old_full_state = full_state[
1283                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1284            ]
1285            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1286            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1287            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1288            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1289            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1290            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1291            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1292            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
1293            if stop_now:
1294                spun_up = jf
1295                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1296                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1297        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1298            break
1299        # apply step change only if there is one
1300        if jf in i_eq:
1301            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
