1302            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1303            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1304            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1305            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1306            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1307            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1308            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1309            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(
1310                zeta_minus_upper,
1311                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1312                alpha_h_vec,
1313            )
1314            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
1315            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1316                (s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1317            )
1318            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1319        else:
1320            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1321        # advance
1322        i += 1
1323
1324    # warn if we never spun up
1325    if not spun_up:
1326        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1327
1328    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = v_0 * np.exp(
1329        full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :]
1330    )
1331
1332    # done
1333    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor \( \mu / 2 v_s \), where \( \mu \) is the shear modulus [Pa] and \( v_s \) is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
def flat_run_plvis_plvis( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, alpha_n_upper, n_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower, simple_rk4): 
1336@njit(
1337    float64[:, :](
1338        float64[:],
1339        int64[:],
1340        int64[:],
1341        int64,
1342        int64,
1343        float64[:, ::1],
1344        float64[:, ::1],
1345        float64[:],
1346        float64[:],
1347        float64[:, ::1],
1348        float64[:, ::1],
1349        float64,
1350        float64,
1351        float64,
1352        float64,
1353        boolean,
1354    ),
1355    cache=True,
1356)
1357def flat_run_plvis_plvis(
1358    t_eval,
1359    i_break,
1360    i_eq,
1361    n_creeping_upper,
1362    n_creeping_lower,
1363    K_int,
1364    K_ext,
1365    v_plate_vec,
1366    v_init,
1367    slip_taper,
1368    delta_tau_bounded,
1369    alpha_n_upper,
1370    n_upper,
1371    alpha_n_lower,
1372    n_lower,
1373    simple_rk4,
1374):
1375    """
1376    Run the simulation.
1377
1378    Parameters
1379    ----------
1380    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1381        Evaluation times [s]
1382    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1383        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1384    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1385        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1386    n_creeping_upper : int
1387        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1388    n_creeping_lower : int
1389        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1390    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1391        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1392    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1393        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1394    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1395        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1396    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1397        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1398    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1399        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1400    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1401        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1402    alpha_n_upper : float
1403        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1404    n_upper : float
1405        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1406    alpha_n_lower : float
1407        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1408    n_lower : float
1409        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1410    simple_rk4 : bool
1411        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1412
1413    Returns
1414    -------
1415    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1416        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1417    """
1418    # initialize parameters
1419    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1420    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1421    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1422    A_upper = alpha_n_upper ** (1 / n_upper)
1423    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1424    n_eval = t_eval.size
1425    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1426
1427    # initialize arrays
1428    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1429    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1430    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
1431    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1432    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1433    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1434    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1435    full_state[:] = np.nan
1436    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1437        (s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1438    )
1439
1440    # make flat ODE function arguments
1441    args = (
1442        n_creeping_upper,
1443        v_plate_vec,
1444        K_int,
1445        K_ext,
1446        A_upper,
1447        n_upper,
1448        A_lower,
1449        n_lower,
1450    )
1451
1452    # integrate
1453    spun_up = 0
1454    i_slip = 0
1455    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1456    i = 0
1457    while i < steps.size - 1:
1458        # get indices
1459        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1460        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1461        # call integrator
1462        if simple_rk4:
1463            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji : jf + 1], *args).T
1464        else:
1465            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1466                sol = solve_ivp(
1467                    flat_ode_plvis_plvis,
1468                    t_span=[ti, tf],
1469                    y0=state_plus,
1470                    t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1471                    method="RK45",
1472                    rtol=1e-9,
1473                    atol=1e-12,
1474                    args=args,
1475                )
1476                success = sol.success
1477                sol = sol.y
1478            if not success:
1479                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1480        # save state to output array
1481        full_state[:, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1482        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1483        if i == steps.size - 2:
1484            break
1485        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1486        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1487            old_full_state = full_state[
1488                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1489            ]
1490            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1491            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1492            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1493            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1494            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1495            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1496            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1497            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1498            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1499            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1500            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1501            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1502            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1503            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1504            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1505            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1506            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1507            if stop_now:
1508                spun_up = jf
1509                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1510                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1511        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1512            break
1513        # apply step change only if there is one
1514        if jf in i_eq:
1515            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1516            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1517            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1518            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1519            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1520            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1521            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1522            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1523            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(
1524                v_minus_upper,
1525                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1526                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_upper,
1527                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_upper,
1528                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_upper,
1529            )
1530            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(
1531                v_minus_lower,
1532                delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1533                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1534                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1535                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower,
1536            )
1537            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1538                (s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1539            )
1540            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1541        else:
1542            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1543        # advance
1544        i += 1
1545
1546    # warn if we never spun up
1547    if not spun_up:
1548        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1549
1550    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1551    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1552
1553    # done
1554    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • alpha_n_upper (float): Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n_upper (float): Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-]
  • alpha_n_lower (float): Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
  • simple_rk4 (bool): Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
def flat_run_rdlog_plvis( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, v_0, alpha_h_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower, simple_rk4): 
1557@njit(
1558    float64[:, :](
1559        float64[:],
1560        int64[:],
1561        int64[:],
1562        int64,
1563        int64,
1564        float64[:, ::1],
1565        float64[:, ::1],
1566        float64[:],
1567        float64[:],
1568        float64[:, ::1],
1569        float64[:, ::1],
1570        float64,
1571        float64,
1572        float64,
1573        float64,
1574        boolean,
1575    ),
1576    cache=True,
1577)
1578def flat_run_rdlog_plvis(
1579    t_eval,
1580    i_break,
1581    i_eq,
1582    n_creeping_upper,
1583    n_creeping_lower,
1584    K_int,
1585    K_ext,
1586    v_plate_vec,
1587    v_init,
1588    slip_taper,
1589    delta_tau_bounded,
1590    v_0,
1591    alpha_h_upper,
1592    alpha_n_lower,
1593    n_lower,
1594    simple_rk4,
1595):
1596    r"""
1597    Run the simulation.
1598
1599    Parameters
1600    ----------
1601    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1602        Evaluation times [s]
1603    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1604        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1605    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1606        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1607    n_creeping_upper : int
1608        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1609    n_creeping_lower : int
1610        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1611    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1612        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1613    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1614        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1615    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1616        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1617    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1618        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1619    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1620        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1621    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1622        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1623    v_0 : float
1624        Reference velocity [m/s]
1625    alpha_h_upper : float
1626        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1627    alpha_n_lower : float
1628        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1629    n_lower : float
1630        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1631    simple_rk4 : bool
1632        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1633
1634    Returns
1635    -------
1636    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1637        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1638    """
1639    # initialize parameters
1640    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1641    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1642    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1643    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1644    n_eval = t_eval.size
1645    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1646
1647    # initialize arrays
1648    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1649    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1650    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
1651    v_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
1652    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1653    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1654    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1655    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1656    full_state[:] = np.nan
1657    state_plus = np.concatenate(
1658        (s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower)
1659    )
1660
1661    # make flat ODE function arguments
1662    args = (
1663        n_creeping_upper,
1664        v_plate_vec,
1665        K_int,
1666        K_ext,
1667        v_0,
1668        alpha_h_upper,
1669        A_lower,
1670        n_lower,
1671    )
1672
1673    # integrate
1674    spun_up = 0
1675    i_slip = 0
1676    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1677    i = 0
1678    while i < steps.size - 1:
1679        # get indices
1680        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1681        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1682        # call integrator
1683        if simple_rk4:
1684            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji : jf + 1], *args).T
1685        else:
1686            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1687                sol = solve_ivp(
1688                    flat_ode_rdlog_plvis,
1689                    t_span=[ti, tf],
1690                    y0=state_plus,
1691                    t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1692                    method="RK45",
1693                    rtol=1e-9,
1694                    atol=1e-12,
1695                    args=args,
1696                )
1697                success = sol.success
1698                sol = sol.y
1699            if not success:
1700                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1701        # save state to output array
1702        full_state[:, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1703        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1704        if i == steps.size - 2:
1705            break
1706        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1707        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1708            old_full_state = full_state[
1709                :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1710            ]
1711            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1712            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1713            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1714            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1715            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1716            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1717            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1718            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1719            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1720            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1721            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1722            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1723            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1724            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1725            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1726            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1727            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1728            if stop_now:
1729                spun_up = jf
1730                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1731                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1732        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1733            break
1734        # apply step change only if there is one
1735        if jf in i_eq:
1736            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1737            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1738            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1739            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1740            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1741            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1742            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1743            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1744            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(
1745                zeta_minus_upper,
1746                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1747                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_h_upper,
1748            )
1749            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(
1750                v_minus_lower,
1751                delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1752                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1753                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1754                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower,
1755            )
1756            state_plus = np.concatenate(
1757                (s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper, s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower)
1758            )
1759            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1760        else:
1761            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1762        # advance
1763        i += 1
1764
1765    # warn if we never spun up
1766    if not spun_up:
1767        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1768
1769    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = v_0 * np.exp(
1770        full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :]
1771    )
1772    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1773    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1774
1775    # done
1776    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_upper (float): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • alpha_n_lower (float): Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
  • simple_rk4 (bool): Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:, ::1], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1]), cache=True)
def get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis( full_state, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, G_surf, deep_creep_slip): 
1779@njit(
1780    float64[:, :](float64[:, ::1], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1]),
1781    cache=True,
1782)
1783# optional(float64[:, ::1]), optional(float64[:, ::1])))
1784def get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(
1785    full_state, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, G_surf, deep_creep_slip
1786):  # , locked_slip):
1787    """
1788    Calculate the surface displacements given the output of ``run``.
1789
1790    Parameters
1791    ----------
1792    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1793        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1794    n_creeping_upper : int
1795        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1796    n_creeping_lower : int
1797        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1798    G_surf : numpy.ndarray
1799        Surface displacements Green's matrix [-] (dimensions must whether `locked_slip`
1800        and/or `deep_creep_slip` are passed to function)
1801    deep_creep_slip : numpy.ndarray
1802        Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches
1803    locked_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
1804        Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches
1805
1806    Returns
1807    -------
1808    surf_disp : numpy.ndarray
1809        Surface displacement timeseries.
1810    """
1811    # extract timeseries from solution
1812    slip_upper = full_state[:n_creeping_upper, :]
1813    slip_lower = full_state[
1814        2 * n_creeping_upper : 2 * n_creeping_upper + n_creeping_lower, :
1815    ]
1816    # add the locked and deep patches to the combined upper & lower slip history matrix
1817    slips_all = np.concatenate((slip_upper, slip_lower), axis=0)
1818    # if locked_slip is not None:s
1819    #     slips_all = np.concatenate((locked_slip[:, :slip_upper.shape[1]], slips_all),
1820    #                                axis=0)
1821    # if deep_creep_slip is not None:
1822    slips_all = np.concatenate((slips_all, deep_creep_slip), axis=0)
1823    # calculate all surface displacements for last full cycle
1824    surf_disps = G_surf @ slips_all
1825    return surf_disps

Calculate the surface displacements given the output of run.

Parameters
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • G_surf (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacements Green's matrix [-] (dimensions must whether locked_slip and/or deep_creep_slip are passed to function)
  • deep_creep_slip (numpy.ndarray): Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches
  • locked_slip (numpy.ndarray, optional): Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches
Returns
  • surf_disp (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacement timeseries.
class Fault2D: 
1828class Fault2D:
1829    """
1830    Base class for the subduction fault mesh.
1831    """
1832
1833    def __init__(
1834        self,
1835        theta,
1836        D_lock,
1837        H,
1838        nu,
1839        E,
1840        v_s,
1841        halflen,
1842        upper_rheo,
1843        n_upper,
1844        lower_rheo,
1845        n_lower_left,
1846        n_lower_right,
1847        halflen_factor_lower,
1848        D_max=None,
1849        x1_pretrench=None,
1850    ):
1851        """
1852        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1853        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1854
1855        Parameters
1856        ----------
1857        theta : float
1858            Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
1859        D_lock : float
1860            Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1861        H : float
1862            Subducting plate thickness [m].
1863        nu : float
1864            Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
1865        E : float
1866            Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
1867        v_s : float
1868            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1869        halflen : float
1870            Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches.
1871            If ``D_max`` and ``x1_pretrench`` are not set, this length is also used for all
1872            creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
1873        upper_rheo : Rheology
1874            Upper plate interface's rheology.
1875        n_upper : int
1876            Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
1877        lower_rheo : Rheology
1878            Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass ``None`` if it should not be simulated,
1879            but enforced to have the plate velocity.
1880        n_lower_left : int
1881            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
1882        n_lower_right : int
1883            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
1884        halflen_factor_lower : float
1885            Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower
1886            plate interface.
1887        D_max : float, optional
1888            Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1889            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1890            locked zone. (``x1_pretrench`` must be set as well.)
1891        x1_pretrench : float, optional
1892            Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive).
1893            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1894            locked zone. (``D_max`` must be set as well.)
1895
1896        References
1897        ----------
1898
1899        .. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010).
1900           *An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones.*
1901           Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3).
1902           doi:`10.1029/2009JB006611 <https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JB006611>`_.
1903        """
1904        # initialize
1905        self.theta = float(theta)
1906        """ Subducting plate dip angle [rad] """
1907        assert 0 < self.theta < np.pi / 2
1908        self.D_lock = float(D_lock)
1909        """ Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1910        assert self.D_lock > 0
1911        self.H = float(H)
1912        """ Subducting plate thickness [m] """
1913        assert self.H >= 0
1914        self.nu = float(nu)
1915        """ Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone """
1916        self.E = float(E)
1917        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1918        self.halflen = float(halflen)
1919        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface """
1920        assert self.halflen > 0
1921        self.upper_rheo = upper_rheo
1922        """ Upper plate interface's rheology """
1923        assert isinstance(self.upper_rheo, Rheology)
1924        self.n_upper = int(n_upper)
1925        """ Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface """
1926        assert self.n_upper >= 1
1927        self.lower_rheo = lower_rheo
1928        """ Lower plate interface's rheology """
1929        assert isinstance(self.lower_rheo, Rheology) or (self.lower_rheo is None)
1930        self.n_lower_left = int(n_lower_left)
1931        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend) """
1932        assert self.n_lower_left >= 1
1933        self.n_lower_right = int(n_lower_right)
1934        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend) """
1935        assert self.n_lower_right >= 1
1936        self.halflen_factor_lower = float(halflen_factor_lower)
1937        """ Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length """
1938        assert self.halflen_factor_lower >= 1
1939        self.lower_halflen = self.halflen * self.halflen_factor_lower
1940        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface """
1941        if self.lower_rheo is not None:
1942            assert (
1943                self.H >= 2 * self.lower_halflen
1944            ), "Plate too thin for given patch sizes."
1945        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1946        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1947        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1948        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1949
1950        # switch between constant or linearly-varying patch sizes
1951        if (D_max is not None) and (x1_pretrench is not None):
1952            D_max = float(D_max)
1953            x1_pretrench = float(x1_pretrench)
1954            assert D_max > 0
1955            assert x1_pretrench > 0
1956            variable_mesh = True
1957        else:
1958            D_max = None
1959            x1_pretrench = None
1960            variable_mesh = False
1961        self.D_max = D_max
1962        """ Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional) """
1963        self.x1_pretrench = x1_pretrench
1964        """ Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional) """
1965        self.variable_mesh = variable_mesh
1966        """ Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not """
1967
1968        # create mesh, centered about the x2 axis
1969        if self.variable_mesh:
1970            # project the locking depth onto dip angle
1971            L_lock = self.D_lock / np.sin(self.theta)
1972            # get number of locked and creeping patches on upper interface
1973            n_lock = int(L_lock // (2 * self.halflen))
1974            n_creep_up = self.n_upper - n_lock
1975            assert n_creep_up > 0, "Current geometry yields no upper creeping patches."
1976            # project maximum interface depth onto dip angle
1977            L_max = self.D_max / np.sin(self.theta)
1978            # get length of creeping segment that needs to be linearly varying
1979            delta_L = L_max - n_lock * 2 * self.halflen
1980            # get linear half-length increase necessary given the number of patches
1981            # and length of creeping segment, on all three interface regions
1982            delta_h_upper = (delta_L - 2 * self.halflen * n_creep_up) / (
1983                n_creep_up**2 - n_creep_up
1984            )
1985            delta_h_lower_right = (
1986                L_max - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_right
1987            ) / (self.n_lower_right**2 - self.n_lower_right)
1988            delta_h_lower_left = (
1989                self.x1_pretrench - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_left
1990            ) / (self.n_lower_left**2 - self.n_lower_left)
1991            # check that we're not running into numerical problems from starkly
1992            # increasing patch sizes
1993            if any(
1994                [
1995                    d > 0.2
1996                    for d in [
1997                        delta_h_upper / self.halflen,
1998                        delta_h_lower_right / self.lower_halflen,
1999                        delta_h_lower_left / self.lower_halflen,
2000                    ]
2001                ]
2002            ):
2003                raise ValueError("Half-length increase greater than 20%.")
2004            # build vector of half-lengths
2005            halflen_vec = np.concatenate(
2006                [
2007                    np.ones(n_lock) * self.halflen,
2008                    self.halflen + np.arange(n_creep_up) * delta_h_upper,
2009                    (
2010                        self.lower_halflen
2011                        + np.arange(self.n_lower_left) * delta_h_lower_left
2012                    )[::-1],
2013                    self.lower_halflen
2014                    + np.arange(self.n_lower_right) * delta_h_lower_right,
2015                ]
2016            )
2017        else:
2018            # build half-length vector from constant size
2019            halflen_vec = (
2020                np.ones(self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left + self.n_lower_right)
2021                * self.halflen
2022            )
2023            halflen_vec[self.n_upper :] *= self.halflen_factor_lower
2024        self.halflen_vec = halflen_vec
2025        """ Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault """
2026        s = self.H * np.tan(self.theta / 2)
2027        R = np.array(
2028            [
2029                [np.cos(-self.theta), -np.sin(-self.theta)],
2030                [np.sin(-self.theta), np.cos(-self.theta)],
2031            ]
2032        )
2033        # upper plate interface
2034        upper_right_x1 = np.concatenate(
2035            [[0], np.cumsum(2 * self.halflen_vec[: self.n_upper])]
2036        )
2037        upper_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(upper_right_x1)
2038        upper_right = R @ np.stack([upper_right_x1, upper_right_x2], axis=0)
2039        # lower left plate interface
2040        temp = self.halflen_vec[
2041            self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left - 1 : self.n_upper - 1 : -1
2042        ]
2043        lower_left_x1 = -s - np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2 * temp)])[::-1]
2044        lower_left_x2 = -self.H * np.ones(self.n_lower_left + 1)
2045        lower_left = np.stack([lower_left_x1, lower_left_x2], axis=0)
2046        # lower right
2047        lower_right_x1 = np.concatenate(
2048            [[0], np.cumsum(2 * self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left :])]
2049        )
2050        lower_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(lower_right_x1)
2051        lower_right = R @ np.stack([lower_right_x1, lower_right_x2], axis=0) - np.array(
2052            [[s], [self.H]]
2053        )
2054        # concatenate mesh parts
2055        self.end_upper = upper_right
2056        """ 2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m] """
2057        self.end_lower = np.concatenate([lower_left, lower_right[:, 1:]], axis=1)
2058        """ 2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m] """
2059        self.end = np.concatenate([self.end_upper, self.end_lower], axis=1)
2060        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m] """
2061        self.mid = (
2062            np.concatenate(
2063                [
2064                    upper_right[:, :-1] + upper_right[:, 1:],
2065                    lower_left[:, :-1] + lower_left[:, 1:],
2066                    lower_right[:, :-1] + lower_right[:, 1:],
2067                ],
2068                axis=1,
2069            )
2070            / 2
2071        )
2072        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2073        self.mid_x1 = self.mid[0, :]
2074        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2075        self.mid_x2 = self.mid[1, :]
2076        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2077        # access subparts
2078        self.ix_upper = np.arange(self.mid_x1.size) < upper_right_x1.size
2079        """ Mask of upper fault interface patches """
2080        self.ix_lower = ~self.ix_upper
2081        """ Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing) """
2082        # locked is the part that slips coseismically on the upper plate interface
2083        self.x1_lock = self.D_lock / np.tan(self.theta)
2084        """ Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
2085        ix_locked = self.mid_x1 <= self.x1_lock - self.halflen
2086        ix_locked[self.n_upper :] = False
2087        self.ix_locked = ix_locked
2088        """ Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically """
2089        self.n_locked = (self.ix_locked).sum()
2090        """ Number [-] of locked patches """
2091        # assert self.n_locked == n_lock
2092        self.n_creeping = (~self.ix_locked).sum()
2093        """ Number [-] of creeping patches """
2094        self.n_creeping_upper = (~self.ix_locked[: self.n_upper]).sum()
2095        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface """
2096        # assert self.n_creeping_upper == n_creep_up
2097        self.n_creeping_lower = self.n_creeping - self.n_creeping_upper
2098        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface """
2099        assert self.n_creeping_lower == n_lower_left + n_lower_right
2100        self.mid_x1_locked = self.mid_x1[self.ix_locked]
2101        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
2102        self.mid_x2_locked = self.mid_x2[self.ix_locked]
2103        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
2104        self.mid_x1_creeping = self.mid_x1[~self.ix_locked]
2105        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
2106        self.mid_x2_creeping = self.mid_x2[~self.ix_locked]
2107        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
2108        # for later calculations, need theta and unit vectors in vector form
2109        theta_vec = np.ones_like(self.mid_x1) * self.theta
2110        theta_vec[self.n_upper : self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left] = np.pi
2111        theta_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left :] += np.pi
2112        self.theta_vec = theta_vec
2113        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches """
2114        self.e_f = np.stack([np.sin(self.theta_vec), np.cos(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
2115        """ Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches"""
2116        self.e_s = np.stack([-np.cos(self.theta_vec), np.sin(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
2117        """ Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction """
2118        # get external (from the locked to the creeping patches) stress kernel
2119        K = Klinedisp(
2120            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2121            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2122            self.mid_x1_locked,
2123            self.mid_x2_locked,
2124            self.halflen_vec[self.ix_locked],
2125            self.theta_vec[self.ix_locked],
2126            self.nu,
2127            self.E,
2128        )[:, : self.n_locked]
2129        Kx1x1 = K[: self.n_creeping, :]
2130        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping : 2 * self.n_creeping, :]
2131        Kx1x2 = K[2 * self.n_creeping : 3 * self.n_creeping, :]
2132        K = (
2133            np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()])
2134            .reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_locked)
2135            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2136        )
2137        self.K_ext = np.einsum(
2138            "ki,ijkl,li->ij",
2139            self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2140            K,
2141            self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2142            optimize=True,
2143        )
2144        """ External stress kernel [Pa/m] """
2145        # get internal (within creeping patches) stress kernel
2146        K = Klinedisp(
2147            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2148            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2149            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2150            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2151            self.halflen_vec[~self.ix_locked],
2152            self.theta_vec[~self.ix_locked],
2153            self.nu,
2154            self.E,
2155        )[:, : self.n_creeping]
2156        Kx1x1 = K[: self.n_creeping, :]
2157        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping : 2 * self.n_creeping, :]
2158        Kx1x2 = K[2 * self.n_creeping : 3 * self.n_creeping, :]
2159        K = (
2160            np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()])
2161            .reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_creeping)
2162            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2163        )
2164        self.K_int = np.einsum(
2165            "ki,ijkl,li->ij",
2166            self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2167            K,
2168            self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2169            optimize=True,
2170        )
2171        """ Internal stress kernel [Pa/m] """
2172        self.n_state_upper = self.upper_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_upper
2173        """ Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable """
2174        self.n_state_lower = (
2175            self.lower_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_lower
2176            if self.lower_rheo is not None
2177            else 2 * self.n_creeping_lower
2178        )
2179        """ Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable """
2180        if (self.n_creeping_upper == 0) or (self.n_creeping_lower == 0):
2181            raise ValueError(
2182                "Defined geometry results in zero creeping patches in "
2183                "either the upper or lower plate interface."
2184            )
2185        # # if upper rheology is Burgers, tell it our specific shear modulus
2186        # if isinstance(self.upper_rheo, rheologies.LinearBurgers):
2187        #     self.upper_rheo.set_G(self.K_int[:self.n_creeping_upper, :self.n_creeping_upper])
2188        # discretized locking depth
2189        self.D_lock_disc = -self.end_upper[1, self.n_locked]
2190        """ Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
2191        self.x1_lock_disc = self.D_lock_disc / np.tan(self.theta)
2192        """ Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface """

Base class for the subduction fault mesh.

Fault2D( theta, D_lock, H, nu, E, v_s, halflen, upper_rheo, n_upper, lower_rheo, n_lower_left, n_lower_right, halflen_factor_lower, D_max=None, x1_pretrench=None) 
1833    def __init__(
1834        self,
1835        theta,
1836        D_lock,
1837        H,
1838        nu,
1839        E,
1840        v_s,
1841        halflen,
1842        upper_rheo,
1843        n_upper,
1844        lower_rheo,
1845        n_lower_left,
1846        n_lower_right,
1847        halflen_factor_lower,
1848        D_max=None,
1849        x1_pretrench=None,
1850    ):
1851        """
1852        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1853        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1854
1855        Parameters
1856        ----------
1857        theta : float
1858            Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
1859        D_lock : float
1860            Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1861        H : float
1862            Subducting plate thickness [m].
1863        nu : float
1864            Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
1865        E : float
1866            Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
1867        v_s : float
1868            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1869        halflen : float
1870            Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches.
1871            If ``D_max`` and ``x1_pretrench`` are not set, this length is also used for all
1872            creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
1873        upper_rheo : Rheology
1874            Upper plate interface's rheology.
1875        n_upper : int
1876            Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
1877        lower_rheo : Rheology
1878            Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass ``None`` if it should not be simulated,
1879            but enforced to have the plate velocity.
1880        n_lower_left : int
1881            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
1882        n_lower_right : int
1883            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
1884        halflen_factor_lower : float
1885            Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower
1886            plate interface.
1887        D_max : float, optional
1888            Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1889            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1890            locked zone. (``x1_pretrench`` must be set as well.)
1891        x1_pretrench : float, optional
1892            Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive).
1893            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1894            locked zone. (``D_max`` must be set as well.)
1895
1896        References
1897        ----------
1898
1899        .. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010).
1900           *An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones.*
1901           Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3).
1902           doi:`10.1029/2009JB006611 <https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JB006611>`_.
1903        """
1904        # initialize
1905        self.theta = float(theta)
1906        """ Subducting plate dip angle [rad] """
1907        assert 0 < self.theta < np.pi / 2
1908        self.D_lock = float(D_lock)
1909        """ Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1910        assert self.D_lock > 0
1911        self.H = float(H)
1912        """ Subducting plate thickness [m] """
1913        assert self.H >= 0
1914        self.nu = float(nu)
1915        """ Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone """
1916        self.E = float(E)
1917        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1918        self.halflen = float(halflen)
1919        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface """
1920        assert self.halflen > 0
1921        self.upper_rheo = upper_rheo
1922        """ Upper plate interface's rheology """
1923        assert isinstance(self.upper_rheo, Rheology)
1924        self.n_upper = int(n_upper)
1925        """ Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface """
1926        assert self.n_upper >= 1
1927        self.lower_rheo = lower_rheo
1928        """ Lower plate interface's rheology """
1929        assert isinstance(self.lower_rheo, Rheology) or (self.lower_rheo is None)
1930        self.n_lower_left = int(n_lower_left)
1931        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend) """
1932        assert self.n_lower_left >= 1
1933        self.n_lower_right = int(n_lower_right)
1934        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend) """
1935        assert self.n_lower_right >= 1
1936        self.halflen_factor_lower = float(halflen_factor_lower)
1937        """ Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length """
1938        assert self.halflen_factor_lower >= 1
1939        self.lower_halflen = self.halflen * self.halflen_factor_lower
1940        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface """
1941        if self.lower_rheo is not None:
1942            assert (
1943                self.H >= 2 * self.lower_halflen
1944            ), "Plate too thin for given patch sizes."
1945        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1946        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1947        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1948        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1949
1950        # switch between constant or linearly-varying patch sizes
1951        if (D_max is not None) and (x1_pretrench is not None):
1952            D_max = float(D_max)
1953            x1_pretrench = float(x1_pretrench)
1954            assert D_max > 0
1955            assert x1_pretrench > 0
1956            variable_mesh = True
1957        else:
1958            D_max = None
1959            x1_pretrench = None
1960            variable_mesh = False
1961        self.D_max = D_max
1962        """ Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional) """
1963        self.x1_pretrench = x1_pretrench
1964        """ Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional) """
1965        self.variable_mesh = variable_mesh
1966        """ Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not """
1967
1968        # create mesh, centered about the x2 axis
1969        if self.variable_mesh:
1970            # project the locking depth onto dip angle
1971            L_lock = self.D_lock / np.sin(self.theta)
1972            # get number of locked and creeping patches on upper interface
1973            n_lock = int(L_lock // (2 * self.halflen))
1974            n_creep_up = self.n_upper - n_lock
1975            assert n_creep_up > 0, "Current geometry yields no upper creeping patches."
1976            # project maximum interface depth onto dip angle
1977            L_max = self.D_max / np.sin(self.theta)
1978            # get length of creeping segment that needs to be linearly varying
1979            delta_L = L_max - n_lock * 2 * self.halflen
1980            # get linear half-length increase necessary given the number of patches
1981            # and length of creeping segment, on all three interface regions
1982            delta_h_upper = (delta_L - 2 * self.halflen * n_creep_up) / (
1983                n_creep_up**2 - n_creep_up
1984            )
1985            delta_h_lower_right = (
1986                L_max - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_right
1987            ) / (self.n_lower_right**2 - self.n_lower_right)
1988            delta_h_lower_left = (
1989                self.x1_pretrench - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_left
1990            ) / (self.n_lower_left**2 - self.n_lower_left)
1991            # check that we're not running into numerical problems from starkly
1992            # increasing patch sizes
1993            if any(
1994                [
1995                    d > 0.2
1996                    for d in [
1997                        delta_h_upper / self.halflen,
1998                        delta_h_lower_right / self.lower_halflen,
1999                        delta_h_lower_left / self.lower_halflen,
2000                    ]
2001                ]
2002            ):
2003                raise ValueError("Half-length increase greater than 20%.")
2004            # build vector of half-lengths
2005            halflen_vec = np.concatenate(
2006                [
2007                    np.ones(n_lock) * self.halflen,
2008                    self.halflen + np.arange(n_creep_up) * delta_h_upper,
2009                    (
2010                        self.lower_halflen
2011                        + np.arange(self.n_lower_left) * delta_h_lower_left
2012                    )[::-1],
2013                    self.lower_halflen
2014                    + np.arange(self.n_lower_right) * delta_h_lower_right,
2015                ]
2016            )
2017        else:
2018            # build half-length vector from constant size
2019            halflen_vec = (
2020                np.ones(self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left + self.n_lower_right)
2021                * self.halflen
2022            )
2023            halflen_vec[self.n_upper :] *= self.halflen_factor_lower
2024        self.halflen_vec = halflen_vec
2025        """ Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault """
2026        s = self.H * np.tan(self.theta / 2)
2027        R = np.array(
2028            [
2029                [np.cos(-self.theta), -np.sin(-self.theta)],
2030                [np.sin(-self.theta), np.cos(-self.theta)],
2031            ]
2032        )
2033        # upper plate interface
2034        upper_right_x1 = np.concatenate(
2035            [[0], np.cumsum(2 * self.halflen_vec[: self.n_upper])]
2036        )
2037        upper_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(upper_right_x1)
2038        upper_right = R @ np.stack([upper_right_x1, upper_right_x2], axis=0)
2039        # lower left plate interface
2040        temp = self.halflen_vec[
2041            self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left - 1 : self.n_upper - 1 : -1
2042        ]
2043        lower_left_x1 = -s - np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2 * temp)])[::-1]
2044        lower_left_x2 = -self.H * np.ones(self.n_lower_left + 1)
2045        lower_left = np.stack([lower_left_x1, lower_left_x2], axis=0)
2046        # lower right
2047        lower_right_x1 = np.concatenate(
2048            [[0], np.cumsum(2 * self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left :])]
2049        )
2050        lower_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(lower_right_x1)
2051        lower_right = R @ np.stack([lower_right_x1, lower_right_x2], axis=0) - np.array(
2052            [[s], [self.H]]
2053        )
2054        # concatenate mesh parts
2055        self.end_upper = upper_right
2056        """ 2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m] """
2057        self.end_lower = np.concatenate([lower_left, lower_right[:, 1:]], axis=1)
2058        """ 2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m] """
2059        self.end = np.concatenate([self.end_upper, self.end_lower], axis=1)
2060        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m] """
2061        self.mid = (
2062            np.concatenate(
2063                [
2064                    upper_right[:, :-1] + upper_right[:, 1:],
2065                    lower_left[:, :-1] + lower_left[:, 1:],
2066                    lower_right[:, :-1] + lower_right[:, 1:],
2067                ],
2068                axis=1,
2069            )
2070            / 2
2071        )
2072        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2073        self.mid_x1 = self.mid[0, :]
2074        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2075        self.mid_x2 = self.mid[1, :]
2076        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
2077        # access subparts
2078        self.ix_upper = np.arange(self.mid_x1.size) < upper_right_x1.size
2079        """ Mask of upper fault interface patches """
2080        self.ix_lower = ~self.ix_upper
2081        """ Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing) """
2082        # locked is the part that slips coseismically on the upper plate interface
2083        self.x1_lock = self.D_lock / np.tan(self.theta)
2084        """ Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
2085        ix_locked = self.mid_x1 <= self.x1_lock - self.halflen
2086        ix_locked[self.n_upper :] = False
2087        self.ix_locked = ix_locked
2088        """ Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically """
2089        self.n_locked = (self.ix_locked).sum()
2090        """ Number [-] of locked patches """
2091        # assert self.n_locked == n_lock
2092        self.n_creeping = (~self.ix_locked).sum()
2093        """ Number [-] of creeping patches """
2094        self.n_creeping_upper = (~self.ix_locked[: self.n_upper]).sum()
2095        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface """
2096        # assert self.n_creeping_upper == n_creep_up
2097        self.n_creeping_lower = self.n_creeping - self.n_creeping_upper
2098        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface """
2099        assert self.n_creeping_lower == n_lower_left + n_lower_right
2100        self.mid_x1_locked = self.mid_x1[self.ix_locked]
2101        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
2102        self.mid_x2_locked = self.mid_x2[self.ix_locked]
2103        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
2104        self.mid_x1_creeping = self.mid_x1[~self.ix_locked]
2105        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
2106        self.mid_x2_creeping = self.mid_x2[~self.ix_locked]
2107        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
2108        # for later calculations, need theta and unit vectors in vector form
2109        theta_vec = np.ones_like(self.mid_x1) * self.theta
2110        theta_vec[self.n_upper : self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left] = np.pi
2111        theta_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left :] += np.pi
2112        self.theta_vec = theta_vec
2113        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches """
2114        self.e_f = np.stack([np.sin(self.theta_vec), np.cos(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
2115        """ Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches"""
2116        self.e_s = np.stack([-np.cos(self.theta_vec), np.sin(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
2117        """ Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction """
2118        # get external (from the locked to the creeping patches) stress kernel
2119        K = Klinedisp(
2120            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2121            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2122            self.mid_x1_locked,
2123            self.mid_x2_locked,
2124            self.halflen_vec[self.ix_locked],
2125            self.theta_vec[self.ix_locked],
2126            self.nu,
2127            self.E,
2128        )[:, : self.n_locked]
2129        Kx1x1 = K[: self.n_creeping, :]
2130        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping : 2 * self.n_creeping, :]
2131        Kx1x2 = K[2 * self.n_creeping : 3 * self.n_creeping, :]
2132        K = (
2133            np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()])
2134            .reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_locked)
2135            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2136        )
2137        self.K_ext = np.einsum(
2138            "ki,ijkl,li->ij",
2139            self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2140            K,
2141            self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2142            optimize=True,
2143        )
2144        """ External stress kernel [Pa/m] """
2145        # get internal (within creeping patches) stress kernel
2146        K = Klinedisp(
2147            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2148            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2149            self.mid_x1_creeping,
2150            self.mid_x2_creeping,
2151            self.halflen_vec[~self.ix_locked],
2152            self.theta_vec[~self.ix_locked],
2153            self.nu,
2154            self.E,
2155        )[:, : self.n_creeping]
2156        Kx1x1 = K[: self.n_creeping, :]
2157        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping : 2 * self.n_creeping, :]
2158        Kx1x2 = K[2 * self.n_creeping : 3 * self.n_creeping, :]
2159        K = (
2160            np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()])
2161            .reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_creeping)
2162            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2163        )
2164        self.K_int = np.einsum(
2165            "ki,ijkl,li->ij",
2166            self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2167            K,
2168            self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked],
2169            optimize=True,
2170        )
2171        """ Internal stress kernel [Pa/m] """
2172        self.n_state_upper = self.upper_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_upper
2173        """ Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable """
2174        self.n_state_lower = (
2175            self.lower_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_lower
2176            if self.lower_rheo is not None
2177            else 2 * self.n_creeping_lower
2178        )
2179        """ Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable """
2180        if (self.n_creeping_upper == 0) or (self.n_creeping_lower == 0):
2181            raise ValueError(
2182                "Defined geometry results in zero creeping patches in "
2183                "either the upper or lower plate interface."
2184            )
2185        # # if upper rheology is Burgers, tell it our specific shear modulus
2186        # if isinstance(self.upper_rheo, rheologies.LinearBurgers):
2187        #     self.upper_rheo.set_G(self.K_int[:self.n_creeping_upper, :self.n_creeping_upper])
2188        # discretized locking depth
2189        self.D_lock_disc = -self.end_upper[1, self.n_locked]
2190        """ Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
2191        self.x1_lock_disc = self.D_lock_disc / np.tan(self.theta)
2192        """ Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface """

Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.

Parameters
  • theta (float): Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
  • D_lock (float): Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
  • H (float): Subducting plate thickness [m].
  • nu (float): Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
  • E (float): Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
  • v_s (float): Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
  • halflen (float): Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches. If D_max and x1_pretrench are not set, this length is also used for all creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
  • upper_rheo (Rheology): Upper plate interface's rheology.
  • n_upper (int): Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
  • lower_rheo (Rheology): Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass None if it should not be simulated, but enforced to have the plate velocity.
  • n_lower_left (int): Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
  • n_lower_right (int): Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
  • halflen_factor_lower (float): Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower plate interface.
  • D_max (float, optional): Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive). If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the locked zone. (x1_pretrench must be set as well.)
  • x1_pretrench (float, optional): Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive). If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the locked zone. (D_max must be set as well.)
References

.. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010). An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones. Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3). doi:10.1029/2009JB006611 .

theta

Subducting plate dip angle [rad]

D_lock

Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface

H

Subducting plate thickness [m]

nu

Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone

E

Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone

halflen

Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface

upper_rheo

Upper plate interface's rheology

n_upper

Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface

lower_rheo

Lower plate interface's rheology

n_lower_left

Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend)

n_lower_right

Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend)

halflen_factor_lower

Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length

lower_halflen

Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface

v_s

Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone

mu_over_2vs

Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m]

D_max

Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional)

x1_pretrench

Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional)

variable_mesh

Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not

halflen_vec

Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault

end_upper

2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m]

end_lower

2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m]

end

2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m]

mid

2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x1

\( x_1 \) coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x2

\( x_2 \) coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m]

ix_upper

Mask of upper fault interface patches

ix_lower

Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing)

x1_lock

Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface

ix_locked

Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically

n_locked

Number [-] of locked patches

n_creeping

Number [-] of creeping patches

n_creeping_upper

Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface

n_creeping_lower

Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface

mid_x1_locked

\( x_1 \) coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x2_locked

\( x_2 \) coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x1_creeping

\( x_1 \) coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x2_creeping

\( x_2 \) coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m]

theta_vec

Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches

e_f

Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches

e_s

Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction

K_ext

External stress kernel [Pa/m]

K_int

Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]

n_state_upper

Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable

n_state_lower

Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable

D_lock_disc

Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface

x1_lock_disc

Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface

class SubductionSimulation: 
2195class SubductionSimulation:
2196    """
2197    Subduction simulation container class.
2198    """
2199
2200    def __init__(
2201        self,
2202        v_plate,
2203        n_cycles_max,
2204        n_samples_per_eq,
2205        delta_tau_max,
2206        v_max,
2207        fault,
2208        Ds_0,
2209        Ds_0_logsigma,
2210        T_rec,
2211        T_rec_logsigma,
2212        D_asp_min,
2213        D_asp_max,
2214        T_anchor,
2215        T_last,
2216        enforce_v_plate,
2217        largehalflen,
2218        t_obs,
2219        pts_surf,
2220    ):
2221        """
2222        Create a subduction simulation.
2223
2224        Parameters
2225        ----------
2226        v_plate : float
2227            Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
2228        n_cycles_max : int
2229            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
2230        n_samples_per_eq : int
2231            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
2232        delta_tau_max : float
2233            Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
2234        v_max : float
2235            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
2236        fault : Fault2D
2237            Fault object
2238        Ds_0 : numpy.ndarray
2239            Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
2240        Ds_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2241            Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
2242        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
2243            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
2244        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2245            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
2246        D_asp_min : numpy.ndarray
2247            Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
2248        D_asp_max : numpy.ndarray
2249            Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
2250        T_anchor : str
2251            Anchor date where observations end
2252        T_last : list
2253            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
2254        enforce_v_plate : bool
2255            Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
2256        largehalflen : float
2257            Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
2258        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2259            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2260            or as Timestamps
2261        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2262            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2263        """
2264
2265        # save general sequence & fault parameters
2266        self.v_plate = float(v_plate)
2267        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology """
2268        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
2269        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
2270        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
2271        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
2272        self.delta_tau_max = float(delta_tau_max)
2273        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches """
2274        self.v_max = float(v_max)
2275        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches """
2276
2277        # define fault
2278        assert isinstance(fault, Fault2D)
2279        if not (
2280            isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous)
2281            or isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic)
2282        ) or not (
2283            isinstance(fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or (fault.lower_rheo is None)
2284        ):
2285            raise NotImplementedError(
2286                "SubductionSimulation is only implemented for "
2287                "NonlinearViscous or RateStateSteadyLogarithmic "
2288                "rheologies in the upper interface, and NonlinearViscous "
2289                "rheology in the lower interface."
2290            )
2291        self.fault = fault
2292        """ Fault object """
2293
2294        # cast earthquake slips as NumPy array
2295        self.Ds_0 = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0)
2296        """ Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es) """
2297        self.Ds_0_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0_logsigma)
2298        """ Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space """
2299        # load recurrence times
2300        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
2301        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
2302        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
2303        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
2304        # load the minimum and maximum depths of the earthquakes
2305        self.D_asp_min = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_min)
2306        """ Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
2307        self.D_asp_max = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_max)
2308        """ Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
2309        assert all([D <= self.fault.D_lock for D in self.D_asp_max]), (
2310            f"Asperity depths {self.D_asp_max / 1e3} km are deeper than the "
2311            f"locking depth {self.fault.D_lock / 1e3}."
2312        )
2313        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
2314        """ Anchor date where observations end """
2315        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
2316        self.T_last = T_last
2317        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
2318        # create a NumPy array that for each locked asperity has the slip per earthquake
2319        self.slip_mask = np.logical_and(
2320            self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1) < -self.D_asp_min.reshape(1, -1),
2321            self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1) > -self.D_asp_max.reshape(1, -1),
2322        )
2323        """ Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch """
2324        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
2325        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
2326        self.n_eq = self.Ds_0.size
2327        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
2328        self.n_eq_per_asp = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
2329        """ Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle """
2330
2331        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
2332        rng = np.random.default_rng()
2333        # first, create realizations of occurence times
2334        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
2335        # (ignore zero-slip earthquakes)
2336        self.T_rec_per_asp = [
2337            rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n)
2338            for t, s, n in zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)
2339        ]
2340        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
2341        self.Ds_0_per_asp = [
2342            rng.lognormal(np.log(d), s, n) if d > 0 else np.array([d] * n)
2343            for d, s, n in zip(self.Ds_0, self.Ds_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)
2344        ]
2345        """ Fault slip [m] realization """
2346
2347        # sanity check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
2348        self.slip_asperities = self.slip_mask.astype(int) * self.Ds_0.reshape(1, -1)
2349        """ Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity """
2350        v_eff_in_asp = (self.slip_asperities / self.T_rec.reshape(1, -1)).sum(axis=1)
2351        assert np.allclose(v_eff_in_asp, self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25), (
2352            "The nominal plate rate is not recovered in all asperities.\n"
2353            f"Plate velocity = {self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25}\n"
2354            f"Effective velocity in each asperity:\n{v_eff_in_asp}"
2355        )
2356
2357        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
2358        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate (enforced or not)
2359        # get the effective recurrence time as implied by the T_rec realizations
2360        T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(t) for t in self.T_rec_per_asp])
2361        # same for the effective cumulative slip
2362        Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(d) for d in self.Ds_0_per_asp])
2363        # we need to scale each individual sequence such that it implies the same
2364        # recurrence time and cumulative slip in each asperity
2365        # (again ignoring zero-slip earthquakes)
2366        T_fullcycle_eff_mean = np.mean(T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff)
2367        Ds_0_fullcycle_mean = np.ma.masked_equal(Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff, 0).mean()
2368        T_rec_per_asp_adj = [
2369            np.array(self.T_rec_per_asp[i])
2370            * T_fullcycle_eff_mean
2371            / T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i]
2372            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2373        ]
2374        Ds_0_per_asp_adj = [
2375            (
2376                np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i])
2377                * Ds_0_fullcycle_mean
2378                / Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i]
2379                if self.Ds_0[i] > 0
2380                else np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i])
2381            )
2382            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2383        ]
2384        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
2385        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
2386        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
2387        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
2388        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not """
2389        ix_nonzero_slip = np.argmax(self.Ds_0 > 0)
2390        v_plate_eff = (
2391            sum(Ds_0_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
2392            / sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
2393            / 86400
2394            / 365.25
2395        )
2396        if self.enforce_v_plate:
2397            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate / v_plate_eff
2398            for i in range(self.n_eq):
2399                T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
2400            v_plate_eff = self.v_plate
2401        self.v_plate_eff = v_plate_eff
2402        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
2403        self.T_eff = sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[0])
2404        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
2405
2406        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
2407        temp_slips = np.vstack(
2408            [
2409                self.slip_mask[:, i].reshape(1, -1) * Ds_0_per_asp_adj[i].reshape(-1, 1)
2410                for i in range(self.n_eq)
2411            ]
2412        )
2413        year_offsets = [
2414            (pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")).n / 365.25
2415            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2416        ]
2417        eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
2418            [
2419                self.T_eff
2420                - (
2421                    np.cumsum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[i])
2422                    - T_rec_per_asp_adj[i]
2423                    + year_offsets[i]
2424                )
2425                for i in range(self.n_eq)
2426            ]
2427        )
2428        # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
2429        eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
2430        # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
2431        eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=temp_slips)
2432        eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
2433        eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
2434        # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
2435        agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
2436        agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.fault.n_locked)})
2437        eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
2438        # convert time column to index and sort
2439        eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
2440        eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
