2441        assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
2442        self.eq_df = eq_df
2443        """
2444        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
2445        for each asperity
2446        """
2447
2448        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
2449        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
2450        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate(
2451            [[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff], self.eq_df.index.values]
2452        )
2453        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
2454        t_eval = np.concatenate(
2455            [
2456                np.logspace(
2457                    0, np.log10(1 + T_frac[i]), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False
2458                )
2459                - 1
2460                + i_frac_cumsum[i]
2461                + j * self.T_eff
2462                for j in range(self.n_cycles_max)
2463                for i, t in enumerate(T_frac)
2464            ]
2465        )
2466        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
2467        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
2468        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
2469        self.t_eval = np.sort(
2470            np.concatenate([t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff])
2471        )
2472        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
2473        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
2474        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
2475
2476        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
2477        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
2478        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
2479        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
2480        self.ix_break = [
2481            i * (self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
2482            for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)
2483        ]
2484        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
2485        self.ix_eq = [
2486            self.ix_break[i] + j * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1
2487            for i in range(self.n_cycles_max)
2488            for j in range(1, 1 + self.n_slips)
2489        ]
2490        """ Indices of earthquakes """
2491
2492        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
2493        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
2494        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
2495        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
2496            t_obs = (
2497                self.T_eff
2498                + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)).total_seconds().values
2499                / 86400
2500                / 365.25
2501            )
2502        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
2503            if np.all(t_obs < 0):
2504                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
2505                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
2506            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), (
2507                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of "
2508                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
2509            )
2510        else:
2511            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
2512        self.t_obs = t_obs
2513        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
2514        # combine all possible timesteps
2515        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2516        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted)))
2517        """
2518        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
2519        [decimal years since cycle start]
2520        """
2521        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
2522        self.ix_break_joint = np.flatnonzero(
2523            np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_break])
2524        )
2525        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
2526        self.ix_eq_joint = np.flatnonzero(
2527            np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_eq])
2528        )
2529        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
2530        self.ix_obs_joint = np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, t_obs_shifted))
2531        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
2532
2533        # get vectors of upper plate rheology parameters
2534        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2535            # alpha_h
2536            self.alpha_h_vec = self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
2537                -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2538            )
2539            r""" Depth-variable :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
2540        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2541            # A, alpha_n, and n
2542            alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec = self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
2543                -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper], self.v_plate
2544            )
2545            self.alpha_n_vec = alpha_n_vec
2546            r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] of upper plate interface """
2547            self.n_vec = n_vec
2548            r""" Depth-variable :math:`n` [-] of upper plate interface """
2549            self.A_vec = A_vec
2550            r""" Depth-variable :math:`A ` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] of upper plate interface """
2551        else:
2552            raise NotImplementedError
2553
2554        # get unbounded delta_tau
2555        self.delta_tau_unbounded = self.fault.K_ext @ self.eq_df.values.T
2556        """ Unbounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2557        # get pseudoinverse of K_int for tapered slip
2558        self.K_int_inv_upper = np.linalg.pinv(
2559            self.fault.K_int[
2560                : self.fault.n_creeping_upper, : self.fault.n_creeping_upper
2561            ]
2562        )
2563        """ Inverse of K_int [m/Pa] """
2564        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower = (
2565            (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_max)
2566            ** (1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
2567            - (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_plate)
2568            ** (1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
2569            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None
2570            else np.inf
2571        )
2572        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in lower plate from capped velocity """
2573        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2574            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_max) ** (
2575                1 / self.n_vec
2576            ) - (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_plate) ** (1 / self.n_vec)
2577        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2578            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = self.alpha_h_vec * (
2579                np.log(self.v_max / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0)
2580                - np.log(self.v_plate / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0)
2581            )
2582        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
2583        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in upper plate from capped velocity """
2584        self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper = np.fmin(
2585            self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
2586        )
2587        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in upper plate """
2588        self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower = (
2589            min(self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower)
2590            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None
2591            else np.inf
2592        )
2593        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in lower plate """
2594        # create tapered slip by making delta_tau linearly increase until delta_tau_max
2595        delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded.copy()
2596        delta_tau_bounded[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] = np.fmin(
2597            self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper.reshape(-1, 1),
2598            self.delta_tau_unbounded[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :],
2599        )
2600        self.delta_tau_bounded = delta_tau_bounded
2601        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2602        # get the additional slip
2603        self.slip_taper = (
2604            self.K_int_inv_upper
2605            @ (self.delta_tau_bounded - self.delta_tau_unbounded)[
2606                : self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :
2607            ]
2608        )
2609        # check if the lower plate should have been bounded as well
2610        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2611            assert not np.any(
2612                np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, :])
2613                > self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower
2614            ), (
2615                "Maximum stress change delta_tau_bounded "
2616                f"{np.max(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded)):.2e} Pa in lower interface "
2617                f"above delta_tau_max = {self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower:.2e} Pa"
2618            )
2619        self.slip_taper_ts = (
2620            pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=self.slip_taper.T)
2621            .cumsum(axis=0)
2622            .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2623        )
2624        """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
2625
2626        # need the imagined location and orientation of the deep creep patches
2627        self.largehalflen = float(largehalflen)
2628        """ Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m] """
2629        self.mid_deep_x1 = np.array(
2630            [
2631                self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2632                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2633                * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2634                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2635                * self.largehalflen,
2636                self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2637                - self.fault.halflen_vec[
2638                    self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1
2639                ]
2640                - self.largehalflen,
2641                self.fault.mid_x1[-1]
2642                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2643                + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.largehalflen,
2644            ]
2645        )
2646        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2647        self.mid_deep_x2 = np.array(
2648            [
2649                self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2650                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2651                * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2652                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2653                * self.largehalflen,
2654                self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1],
2655                self.fault.mid_x2[-1]
2656                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2657                - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi) * self.largehalflen,
2658            ]
2659        )
2660        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2661        self.theta_vec_deep = np.array(
2662            [
2663                self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1],
2664                np.pi,
2665                self.fault.theta_vec[-1],
2666            ]
2667        )
2668        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for deep creep fault patches """
2669
2670        # create the Green's matrices
2671        self.pts_surf = pts_surf
2672        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
2673        self.n_stations = self.pts_surf.size
2674        """ Number of surface observing stations """
2675        self.G_surf_fault = Glinedisp(
2676            self.pts_surf,
2677            0,
2678            self.fault.mid_x1,
2679            self.fault.mid_x2,
2680            self.fault.halflen_vec,
2681            self.fault.theta_vec,
2682            self.fault.nu,
2683        )[:, : self.fault.mid_x1.size]
2684        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the main fault patches to surface motion """
2685        self.G_surf_deep = Glinedisp(
2686            self.pts_surf,
2687            0,
2688            self.mid_deep_x1,
2689            self.mid_deep_x2,
2690            self.largehalflen,
2691            self.theta_vec_deep,
2692            self.fault.nu,
2693        )[:, :3]
2694        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the deep creep patches to surface motion """
2695        self.G_surf = np.hstack([self.G_surf_fault, self.G_surf_deep])
2696        """ Joint Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the entire ESPM to surface motion """
2697
2698        # calculate the best initial velocity state from the steady state ODE
2699        v_plate_vec = np.ones(self.fault.n_creeping) * self.v_plate
2700        v_plate_vec[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :] *= -1
2701        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2702        """ Vector with the plate velocity for each creeping patch [m/s] """
2703        # get the initial velocity, taking advantage of the option that there could be a
2704        # deep transition zone
2705        v_init = v_plate_vec.copy()
2706        if self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition is not None:
2707            ix_deep = np.argmin(
2708                np.abs(
2709                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2710                    - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition
2711                    - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition_width
2712                )
2713            )
2714            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2715                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(
2716                    self.v_plate * 1e-6, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False
2717                )
2718            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2719                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(
2720                    0, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False
2721                )
2722        self.v_init = v_init
2723        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """
2724
2725    @property
2726    def locked_slip(self):
2727        """Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan"""
2728        return (
2729            self.eq_df.cumsum(axis=0)
2730            .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2731            .values.T
2732        )
2733
2734    @property
2735    def deep_creep_slip(self):
2736        """Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches for observation timestamps"""
2737        return (
2738            np.tile(self.t_obs.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
2739            * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
2740            * self.v_plate_eff
2741            * 86400
2742            * 365.25
2743        )
2744
2745    @staticmethod
2746    def read_config_file(config_file):
2747        """
2748        Read a configuration file and return it as a parsed dictionary.
2749
2750        Parameters
2751        ----------
2752        config_file : str
2753            Path to INI configuration file.
2754
2755        Returns
2756        -------
2757        cfg_dict : dict
2758            Parsed configuration file.
2759        """
2760
2761        # load configuration file
2762        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
2763        cfg.optionxform = str
2764        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
2765            cfg.read_file(f)
2766        cfg_seq, cfg_fault, cfg_mesh = cfg["sequence"], cfg["fault"], cfg["mesh"]
2767
2768        # parse rheologies
2769        upper_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["upper_rheo"])
2770        upper_rheo_type = upper_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2771        upper_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in upper_rheo_dict.items()}
2772        try:
2773            lower_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["lower_rheo"])
2774        except KeyError:
2775            lower_rheo_type = None
2776            lower_rheo_kw_args = None
2777        else:
2778            lower_rheo_type = lower_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2779            lower_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in lower_rheo_dict.items()}
2780
2781        # parse everything else
2782        cfg_dict = {
2783            "theta": np.deg2rad(cfg_fault.getfloat("theta_deg")),
2784            "D_lock": cfg_fault.getfloat("D_lock"),
2785            "H": cfg_fault.getfloat("H"),
2786            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
2787            "E": cfg_fault.getfloat("E"),
2788            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
2789            "halflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen"),
2790            "n_upper": cfg_mesh.getint("n_up"),
2791            "n_lower_left": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_l"),
2792            "n_lower_right": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_r"),
2793            "halflen_factor_lower": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen_factor_lower"),
2794            "D_max": cfg_mesh.getfloat("D_max", fallback=None),
2795            "x1_pretrench": cfg_mesh.getfloat("x1_pretrench", fallback=None),
2796            "v_plate": cfg_seq.getfloat("v_plate"),
2797            "n_cycles_max": cfg_seq.getint("n_cycles_max"),
2798            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_seq.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
2799            "delta_tau_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("delta_tau_max", fallback=np.inf),
2800            "v_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_max", fallback=np.inf),
2801            "Ds_0": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0"])),
2802            "Ds_0_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0_logsigma"])),
2803            "T_rec": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec"])),
2804            "T_rec_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec_logsigma"])),
2805            "D_asp_min": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_min"])),
2806            "D_asp_max": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_max"])),
2807            "T_anchor": cfg_seq.get("T_anchor"),
2808            "T_last": json.loads(cfg_seq["T_last"]),
2809            "enforce_v_plate": cfg_seq.getboolean("enforce_v_plate"),
2810            "largehalflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("largehalflen"),
2811            "upper_rheo_type": upper_rheo_type,
2812            "lower_rheo_type": lower_rheo_type,
2813            "upper_rheo_kw_args": upper_rheo_kw_args,
2814            "lower_rheo_kw_args": lower_rheo_kw_args,
2815        }
2816        return cfg_dict
2817
2818    @classmethod
2819    def from_config_dict(cls, cfg, t_obs, pts_surf):
2820        """
2821        Create a SubductionSimulation object from a configuration dictionary.
2822
2823        Parameters
2824        ----------
2825        cfg : dict
2826            Dictionary containing all parsed elements from the configuration file
2827        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2828            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2829            or as Timestamps
2830        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2831            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2832
2833        See Also
2834        --------
2835        read_config_file : To load a configuration file into a dictionary.
2836        """
2837
2838        # create rheology objects
2839        upper_rheo = globals()[cfg["upper_rheo_type"]](**cfg["upper_rheo_kw_args"])
2840        if cfg["lower_rheo_type"] is None:
2841            lower_rheo = None
2842        else:
2843            lower_rheo = globals()[cfg["lower_rheo_type"]](**cfg["lower_rheo_kw_args"])
2844
2845        # create fault object
2846        fault = Fault2D(
2847            theta=cfg["theta"],
2848            D_lock=cfg["D_lock"],
2849            H=cfg["H"],
2850            nu=cfg["nu"],
2851            E=cfg["E"],
2852            v_s=cfg["v_s"],
2853            halflen=cfg["halflen"],
2854            upper_rheo=upper_rheo,
2855            n_upper=cfg["n_upper"],
2856            lower_rheo=lower_rheo,
2857            n_lower_left=cfg["n_lower_left"],
2858            n_lower_right=cfg["n_lower_right"],
2859            halflen_factor_lower=cfg["halflen_factor_lower"],
2860            D_max=cfg["D_max"],
2861            x1_pretrench=cfg["x1_pretrench"],
2862        )
2863
2864        # create simulation object
2865        return cls(
2866            v_plate=cfg["v_plate"],
2867            n_cycles_max=cfg["n_cycles_max"],
2868            n_samples_per_eq=cfg["n_samples_per_eq"],
2869            delta_tau_max=cfg["delta_tau_max"],
2870            v_max=cfg["v_max"],
2871            fault=fault,
2872            Ds_0=cfg["Ds_0"],
2873            Ds_0_logsigma=cfg["Ds_0_logsigma"],
2874            T_rec=cfg["T_rec"],
2875            T_rec_logsigma=cfg["T_rec_logsigma"],
2876            D_asp_min=cfg["D_asp_min"],
2877            D_asp_max=cfg["D_asp_max"],
2878            T_anchor=cfg["T_anchor"],
2879            T_last=cfg["T_last"],
2880            enforce_v_plate=cfg["enforce_v_plate"],
2881            largehalflen=cfg["largehalflen"],
2882            t_obs=t_obs,
2883            pts_surf=pts_surf,
2884        )
2885
2886    @staticmethod
2887    def get_n(alpha_n, alpha_eff, v_eff):
2888        r"""
2889        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2890
2891        Parameters
2892        ----------
2893        alpha_n : float
2894            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2895        alpha_eff : float
2896            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2897        v_eff : float
2898            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2899
2900        Returns
2901        -------
2902        n : float
2903            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2904        """
2905        return (np.log(alpha_n) + np.log(v_eff)) / (np.log(alpha_eff) + np.log(v_eff))
2906
2907    @staticmethod
2908    def get_alpha_n(alpha_eff, n, v_eff):
2909        r"""
2910        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2911
2912        Parameters
2913        ----------
2914        alpha_eff : float
2915            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2916        n : float
2917            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2918        v_eff : float
2919            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2920
2921        Returns
2922        -------
2923        alpha_n : float
2924            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2925        """
2926        alpha_n = alpha_eff**n * v_eff ** (n - 1)
2927        return alpha_n
2928
2929    @staticmethod
2930    def get_alpha_eff(alpha_n, n, v_eff):
2931        r"""
2932        Calculate the effective linear viscous strength constant from the real one.
2933
2934        Parameters
2935        ----------
2936        alpha_n : float
2937            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2938        n : float
2939            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2940        v_eff : float
2941            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2942
2943        Returns
2944        -------
2945        alpha_eff : float
2946            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2947        """
2948        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2949            temp = v_eff.copy()
2950            temp[temp == 0] = np.nan
2951        else:
2952            temp = v_eff
2953        alpha_eff = alpha_n ** (1 / n) * temp ** ((1 - n) / n)
2954        return alpha_eff
2955
2956    @staticmethod
2957    def get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(alpha_h, v_eff):
2958        r"""
2959        Calculate the effective viscosity from the rate-dependent friction.
2960
2961        Parameters
2962        ----------
2963        alpha_h : float
2964            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
2965            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
2966            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
2967        v_eff : float
2968            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2969
2970        Returns
2971        -------
2972        alpha_eff : float
2973            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2974        """
2975        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2976            temp = v_eff.copy()
2977            temp[temp == 0] = np.nan
2978        else:
2979            temp = v_eff
2980        alpha_eff = alpha_h / temp
2981        return alpha_eff
2982
2983    def run(self, simple_rk4=False):
2984        """
2985        Run a full simulation.
2986        """
2987        # run forward integration
2988        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2989            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2990                full_state = flat_run_rdlog(
2991                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
2992                    self.ix_break_joint,
2993                    self.ix_eq_joint,
2994                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
2995                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
2996                    self.fault.K_int,
2997                    self.fault.K_ext,
2998                    self.v_plate_vec,
2999                    self.v_init,
3000                    self.slip_taper,
3001                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3002                    self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0,
3003                    self.alpha_h_vec,
3004                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
3005                )
3006            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3007                full_state = flat_run_plvis(
3008                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
3009                    self.ix_break_joint,
3010                    self.ix_eq_joint,
3011                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3012                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3013                    self.fault.K_int,
3014                    self.fault.K_ext,
3015                    self.v_plate_vec,
3016                    self.v_init,
3017                    self.slip_taper,
3018                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3019                    self.alpha_n_vec,
3020                    self.n_vec,
3021                    self.A_vec,
3022                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
3023                )
3024            else:
3025                raise NotImplementedError
3026        elif isinstance(self.fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3027            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3028                full_state = flat_run_plvis_plvis(
3029                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
3030                    self.ix_break_joint,
3031                    self.ix_eq_joint,
3032                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3033                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3034                    self.fault.K_int,
3035                    self.fault.K_ext,
3036                    self.v_plate_vec,
3037                    self.v_init,
3038                    self.slip_taper,
3039                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3040                    self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_n,
3041                    self.fault.upper_rheo.n,
3042                    self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
3043                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n,
3044                    simple_rk4,
3045                )
3046            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3047                full_state = flat_run_rdlog_plvis(
3048                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25,
3049                    self.ix_break_joint,
3050                    self.ix_eq_joint,
3051                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3052                    self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3053                    self.fault.K_int,
3054                    self.fault.K_ext,
3055                    self.v_plate_vec,
3056                    self.v_init,
3057                    self.slip_taper,
3058                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
3059                    self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0,
3060                    self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_h,
3061                    self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
3062                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n,
3063                    simple_rk4,
3064                )
3065            else:
3066                raise NotImplementedError
3067        else:
3068            raise NotImplementedError
3069        # extract the observations that were actually requested
3070        obs_state = full_state[:, self.ix_obs_joint].copy()
3071        # since we're only calculating transient surface displacements, need to
3072        # remove the tapered slip due to bounded stresses
3073        obs_state[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] -= self.slip_taper_ts.values.T
3074        # convert to surface displacements
3075        surf_disps = get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(
3076            obs_state,
3077            self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3078            self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3079            np.ascontiguousarray(self.G_surf[:, self.fault.n_locked :]),
3080            self.deep_creep_slip,
3081        )
3082        return full_state, obs_state, surf_disps
3083
3084    def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
3085        """
3086        Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens.
3087        """
3088        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
3089        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
3090            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
3091        )
3092        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
3093        if n_slips_obs == 0:
3094            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
3095        else:
3096            i_slips_obs = [
3097                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
3098                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
3099            ]
3100            obs_zeroed[:, : i_slips_obs[0]] -= obs_zeroed[
3101                :, i_slips_obs[0] - 1
3102            ].reshape(-1, 1)
3103            obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0] :] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0]].reshape(
3104                -1, 1
3105            )
3106            for i in range(1, n_slips_obs):
3107                obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[i] :] -= obs_zeroed[
3108                    :, i_slips_obs[i]
3109                ].reshape(-1, 1)
3110        return obs_zeroed
3111
3112    def _reduce_full_state(self, data):
3113        # get all NaN columns
3114        cols_all_nan = np.all(np.isnan(data), axis=0)
3115        # check if there was early stopping
3116        if cols_all_nan.sum() > 0:
3117            # get the border indices where integrations have been skipped
3118            ix_last, ix_first = np.flatnonzero(cols_all_nan)[[0, -1]]
3119            ix_last -= 1
3120            ix_first += 1
3121            # get indices before and after the NaN period
3122            ix_valid = np.r_[0:ix_last, ix_first : self.t_eval_joint.size]
3123            # subset data
3124            data = data[:, ix_valid]
3125            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint[ix_valid].copy()
3126            t_sub[ix_last:] -= self.t_eval_joint[ix_first] - self.t_eval_joint[ix_last]
3127            n_cyc_completed = int(np.round(self.t_eval_joint[ix_last] / self.T_eff)) + 1
3128        else:
3129            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint.copy()
3130            n_cyc_completed = self.n_cycles_max + 1
3131        # done
3132        return data, t_sub, n_cyc_completed
3133
3134    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
3135        """
3136        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
3137
3138        Parameters
3139        ----------
3140        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
3141            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
3142        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
3143            Noisy surface observations.
3144
3145        Returns
3146        -------
3147        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3148        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3149        """
3150        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3151
3152        # some helper variables
3153        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf)
3154        i_off = 3 * np.std(obs_zeroed.ravel())
3155        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
3156        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
3157            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
3158        )
3159        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
3160        if n_slips_obs > 0:
3161            i_slips_obs = [
3162                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
3163                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
3164            ]
3165            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
3166        else:
3167            t_last_slips = []
3168        # start plot
3169        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
3170        for tslip in t_last_slips:
3171            ax[0].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
3172            ax[1].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
3173        for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
3174            if obs_noisy is not None:
3175                ax[0].plot(
3176                    self.t_obs,
3177                    obs_noisy[ix, :] + i * i_off,
3178                    ".",
3179                    c="k",
3180                    rasterized=True,
3181                )
3182                ax[1].plot(
3183                    self.t_obs,
3184                    obs_noisy[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i * i_off,
3185                    ".",
3186                    c="k",
3187                    rasterized=True,
3188                )
3189            ax[0].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, :] + i * i_off, c=f"C{i}")
3190            ax[1].plot(
3191                self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i * i_off, c=f"C{i}"
3192            )
3193        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
3194        ax[0].set_ylabel("Horizontal [m]")
3195        ax[1].set_ylabel("Vertical [m]")
3196        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
3197        return fig, ax
3198
3199    def plot_fault_velocities(self, full_state):
3200        """
3201        Plot the velocities on all creeping fault patches.
3202
3203        Parameters
3204        ----------
3205        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3206            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3207
3208        Returns
3209        -------
3210        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3211        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3212        """
3213        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3214        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm
3215        from cmcrameri import cm
3216
3217        # extract velocities
3218        vels = (
3219            full_state[
3220                np.r_[
3221                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper,
3222                    self.fault.n_state_upper
3223                    + self.fault.n_creeping_lower : self.fault.n_state_upper
3224                    + self.fault.n_state_lower,
3225                ],
3226                :,
3227            ]
3228            / self.v_plate
3229        )
3230        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
3231        vels, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(vels)
3232        # normalize time
3233        t_sub /= self.T_eff
3234        # prepare plot
3235        norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1, vmin=-1, vmax=100)
3236        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
3237            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
3238            ax = [ax]
3239        else:
3240            fig, ax = plt.subplots(
3241                nrows=2, sharex=True, figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained"
3242            )
3243        # plot velocities
3244        c = ax[0].pcolormesh(
3245            t_sub,
3246            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3247            vels[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
3248            norm=norm,
3249            cmap=cm.vik,
3250            shading="flat",
3251        )
3252        ax[0].set_yticks(self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3)
3253        # add vertical lines for cycle breaks
3254        for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
3255            ax[0].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
3256        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
3257        ax[0].invert_yaxis()
3258        # repeat for lower interface, if simulated
3259        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3260            c = ax[1].pcolormesh(
3261                t_sub,
3262                self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
3263                -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, :-1],
3264                norm=norm,
3265                cmap=cm.vik,
3266                shading="flat",
3267            )
3268            ax[1].set_yticks(self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3)
3269            # add horizontal lines to show where the lower interface is below the locked zone
3270            ax[1].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
3271            ax[1].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
3272            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
3273                ax[1].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
3274            ax[1].invert_yaxis()
3275        # finish figure
3276        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
3277            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
3278            ax[0].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3279        else:
3280            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
3281            ax[1].set_ylabel("Lower Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
3282            ax[1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3283        fig.colorbar(
3284            c,
3285            ax=ax,
3286            location="right",
3287            orientation="vertical",
3288            fraction=0.05,
3289            label="$v/v_{plate}$",
3290        )
3291        fig.suptitle("Normalized Fault Patch Velocities")
3292        return fig, ax
3293
3294    def plot_fault_slip(
3295        self, full_state, deficit=True, include_locked=True, include_deep=True
3296    ):
3297        """
3298        Plot the cumulative slip (deficit) for the fault patches.
3299
3300        Parameters
3301        ----------
3302        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3303            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3304        deficit : bool, optional
3305            If ``True`` (default), remove the plate velocity to plot slip deficit,
3306            otherwise keep it included.
3307        include_locked : bool, optional
3308            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the locked patches.
3309        include_deep : bool, optional
3310            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the semi-infinite patches
3311            at the end of the interfaces.
3312
3313        Returns
3314        -------
3315        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3316        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3317        """
3318        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3319        from matplotlib.colors import Normalize, SymLogNorm
3320        from cmcrameri import cm
3321
3322        # extract slip
3323        slip = full_state[
3324            np.r_[
3325                : self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3326                self.fault.n_state_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper
3327                + self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
3328            ],
3329            :,
3330        ]
3331        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
3332        slip, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(slip)
3333        # normalize to slip per full cycle
3334        cum_slip_per_cycle = self.v_plate_eff * self.T_eff * 86400 * 365.25
3335        slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
3336        # add optional slip histories, if desired
3337        if include_locked:
3338            eq_df_joint = pd.DataFrame(
3339                index=(
3340                    self.eq_df.index.values.reshape(1, -1)
3341                    + self.T_eff * np.arange(n_cyc_completed).reshape(-1, 1)
3342                ).ravel(),
3343                data=np.tile(self.eq_df.values, (n_cyc_completed, 1)),
3344            )
3345            locked_slip = (
3346                eq_df_joint.cumsum(axis=0)
3347                .reindex(index=t_sub, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3348                .values.T
3349            )
3350            locked_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
3351        if include_deep:
3352            deep_creep_slip = (
3353                np.tile(t_sub.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
3354                * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
3355                * self.v_plate_eff
3356                * 86400
3357                * 365.25
3358            )
3359            deep_creep_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
3360        # remove plate velocity to get slip deficit, if desired
3361        if deficit:
3362            cmap = cm.vik
3363            norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1e-2, vmin=-1, vmax=1)
3364            slip[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
3365            slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :] += t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
3366            slip -= slip[:, -2].reshape(-1, 1)
3367            if include_locked:
3368                locked_slip -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
3369            if include_deep:
3370                deep_creep_slip -= (
3371                    t_sub.reshape(1, -1) * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
3372                ) / self.T_eff
3373        else:
3374            norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=n_cyc_completed)
3375            cmap = cm.batlow
3376        # normalize time
3377        t_sub /= self.T_eff
3378        # prepare figure
3379        nrows = (
3380            1
3381            + int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
3382            + int(include_locked)
3383            + int(include_deep) * 3
3384        )
3385        hr_locked = (
3386            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked] - self.fault.end_upper[0, 0]
3387        ) / (self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0])
3388        hr_lower = (self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]) / (
3389            self.fault.end_upper[0, -1] - self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked]
3390        )
3391        hr = (
3392            [hr_locked] * int(include_locked)
3393            + [1]
3394            + [hr_locked, hr_locked] * int(include_deep)
3395            + [hr_lower] * int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
3396            + [hr_locked] * int(include_deep)
3397        )
3398        fig, ax = plt.subplots(
3399            nrows=nrows,
3400            sharex=True,
3401            gridspec_kw={"height_ratios": hr},
3402            figsize=(10, 5),
3403            layout="constrained",
3404        )
3405        iax = 0
3406        # plot locked
3407        if include_locked:
3408            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3409                t_sub,
3410                self.fault.end_upper[0, : self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
3411                locked_slip[:, :-1],
3412                norm=norm,
3413                cmap=cmap,
3414                shading="flat",
3415            )
3416            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Locked\n$x_1$ [km]")
3417            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [0, self.fault.n_locked]] / 1e3
3418            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
3419            iax += 1
3420        # plot upper creeping
3421        c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3422            t_sub,
3423            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3424            slip[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
3425            norm=norm,
3426            cmap=cmap,
3427            shading="flat",
3428        )
3429        ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
3430        temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3
3431        ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
3432        iax += 1
3433        # plot end patch on upper interface
3434        if include_deep:
3435            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_upper[0, -1], self.mid_deep_x1[0]]) / 1e3
3436            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3437                t_sub,
3438                temp_x1,
3439                deep_creep_slip[0, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
3440                norm=norm,
3441                cmap=cmap,
3442                shading="flat",
3443            )
3444            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
3445            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
3446            iax += 1
3447        # plot left end patch on lower interface
3448        if include_deep:
3449            temp_x1 = np.array([self.mid_deep_x1[1], self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]]) / 1e3
3450            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3451                t_sub,
3452                temp_x1,
3453                -deep_creep_slip[1, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
3454                norm=norm,
3455                cmap=cmap,
3456                shading="flat",
3457            )
3458            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
3459            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, ["$-\\infty$", f"{temp_x1[1]:.0f}"])
3460            iax += 1
3461        # plot lower creeping
3462        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3463            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3464                t_sub,
3465                self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
3466                -slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, :-1],
3467                norm=norm,
3468                cmap=cmap,
3469                shading="flat",
3470            )
3471            ax[iax].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
3472            ax[iax].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
3473            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
3474            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3
3475            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
3476            iax += 1
3477        # plot right end patch on lower interface
3478        if include_deep:
3479            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_lower[0, -1], self.mid_deep_x1[2]]) / 1e3
3480            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(
3481                t_sub,
3482                temp_x1,
3483                -deep_creep_slip[2, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
3484                norm=norm,
3485                cmap=cmap,
3486                shading="flat",
3487            )
3488            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
3489            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
3490            iax += 1
3491        # finish figure
3492        for iax in range(len(ax)):
3493            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
3494                ax[iax].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
3495            ax[iax].invert_yaxis()
3496        ax[-1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3497        fig.colorbar(
3498            c,
3499            ax=ax,
3500            location="right",
3501            orientation="vertical",
3502            fraction=0.05,
3503            label="$(s - t*v_{plate})/s_{full}$" if deficit else "$s/s_{full}$",
3504        )
3505        suptitle = "Normalized Fault Patch Slip"
3506        if deficit:
3507            suptitle += " Deficit"
3508        fig.suptitle(suptitle)
3509        return fig, ax
3510
3511    def plot_eq_velocities(self, full_state):
3512        """
3513        Plot the before and after velocities on all creeping fault patches
3514        for each distinct earthquake.
3515
3516        Parameters
3517        ----------
3518        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3519            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3520
3521        Returns
3522        -------
3523        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3524        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3525        """
3526        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3527
3528        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
3529        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
3530        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3531        tdiff = np.array(
3532            [np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
3533        )
3534        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
3535            warn(
3536                "Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
3537                f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds."
3538            )
3539        ix_eq_last = [
3540            np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last
3541        ]
3542        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
3543        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), (
3544            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the "
3545            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
3546        )
3547        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
3548        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
3549        slip_avg = [
3550            slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
3551            for ieq in range(n_eq_found)
3552        ]
3553        # extract velocities
3554        vels = (
3555            full_state[
3556                np.r_[
3557                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper,
3558                    self.fault.n_state_upper
3559                    + self.fault.n_creeping_lower : self.fault.n_state_upper
3560                    + self.fault.n_state_lower,
3561                ],
3562                :,
3563            ]
3564            / self.v_plate
3565        )
3566        # prepare plot
3567        fig, ax = plt.subplots(
3568            nrows=n_eq_found,
3569            ncols=1 if self.fault.lower_rheo is None else 2,
3570            sharey=True,
3571            layout="constrained",
3572        )
3573        ax = np.asarray(ax).reshape(n_eq_found, -1)
3574        # loop over earthquakes
3575        for irow, ieq in enumerate(ix_eq_last):
3576            # repeat plot for before and after
3577            for ioff, label in enumerate(["before", "after"]):
3578                ax[irow, 0].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
3579                ax[irow, 0].plot(
3580                    self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
3581                    vels[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, ieq - 1 + ioff],
3582                    c=f"C{ioff}",
3583                    label=label,
3584                )
3585                if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3586                    ax[irow, 1].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
3587                    ax[irow, 1].plot(
3588                        self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :] / 1e3,
3589                        -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper :, ieq - 1 + ioff],
3590                        c=f"C{ioff}",
3591                        label=label,
3592                    )
3593        # finish plot
3594        for irow in range(n_eq_found):
3595            ax[irow, 0].set_title(f"Upper Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
3596            ax[irow, 0].legend()
3597            ax[irow, 0].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3598            ax[irow, 0].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
3599            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
3600                ax[irow, 1].set_title(f"Lower Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
3601                ax[irow, 1].axvline(0, c="k", lw=1)
3602                ax[irow, 1].axvline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
3603                ax[irow, 1].tick_params(labelleft=True)
3604                ax[irow, 1].legend()
3605                ax[irow, 1].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3606                ax[irow, 1].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
3607        fig.suptitle("Normalized Earthquake Velocity Changes")
3608        return fig, ax
3609
3610    def plot_fault(self):
3611        """
3612        Plot the fault.
3613
3614        Returns
3615        -------
3616        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3617        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3618        """
3619        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3620
3621        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 3), layout="constrained")
3622        ax.plot(
3623            self.fault.end_upper[0, : self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
3624            self.fault.end_upper[1, : self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
3625            marker="|",
3626            markeredgecolor="k",
3627            label="Locked",
3628        )
3629        ax.plot(
3630            self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3631            self.fault.end_upper[1, self.fault.n_locked :] / 1e3,
3632            marker="|",
3633            markeredgecolor="k",
3634            label="Upper Creeping",
3635        )
3636        ax.plot(
3637            self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
3638            self.fault.end_lower[1, :] / 1e3,
3639            marker="|",
3640            markeredgecolor="k",
3641            label="Lower Creeping",
3642        )
3643        ax.plot(
3644            self.pts_surf / 1e3,
3645            np.zeros_like(self.pts_surf),
3646            "^",
3647            markeredgecolor="none",
3648            markerfacecolor="k",
3649            label="Observers",
3650        )
3651        ax.axhline(0, lw=1, c="0.5", zorder=-1)
3652        ax.legend()
3653        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3654        ax.set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
3655        ax.set_title("Fault Mesh and Observer Locations")
3656        ax.set_aspect("equal")
3657        return fig, ax
3658
3659    def plot_slip_phases(self, full_state, post_inter_transition=0.01, normalize=True):
3660        """
3661        Plot the cumulative slip on the fault for the three different
3662        phases (coseismic, early postseismic, and interseismic).
3663
3664        Only works if there is a single earthquake in the sequence.
3665
3666        Parameters
3667        ----------
3668        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3669            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3670        post_inter_transition : float, optional
3671            Fraction of the recurrence time that should be considered
3672            early postseismic and not interseismic.
3673
3674        Returns
3675        -------
3676        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3677        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3678        """
3679        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3680        from scipy.interpolate import interp1d
3681
3682        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
3683        if not self.n_eq == 1:
3684            raise NotImplementedError(
3685                "Don't know how to plot slip phases if "
3686                "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence."
3687            )
3688        # get coseismic slip
3689        co = np.concatenate([self.eq_df.values.ravel(), self.slip_taper.ravel()])
3690        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
3691        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3692        ix_eq_last = (
3693            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
3694            - self.ix_break_joint[-2]
3695        )
3696        # reorganize interseismic slip
3697        slip = full_state[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.ix_break_joint[-2] :]
3698        slip_pre = slip[:, :ix_eq_last]
3699        slip_post = slip[:, ix_eq_last:]
3700        slip_pre += (slip_post[:, -1] - slip_pre[:, 0]).reshape(-1, 1)
3701        slip_joint = np.hstack([slip_post, slip_pre])
3702        slip_joint -= slip_joint[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
3703        # same for time
3704        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2] :].copy()
3705        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
3706        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
3707        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
3708        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
3709        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
3710        # since slip_joint is now already cumulative slip since the earthquake,
3711        # with the tapered slip removed, we can just read out the early
3712        # postseismic and rest interseismic cumulative slip distributions
3713        post = interp1d(t_last_joint, slip_joint)(post_inter_transition * self.T_eff)
3714        inter = slip_joint[:, -1] - post
3715        post = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), post])
3716        inter = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), inter])
3717        # optionally, normalize by total expected cumulative slip over the entire cycle
3718        if normalize:
3719            total_slip = self.T_eff * self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25
3720            co /= total_slip
3721            post /= total_slip
3722            inter /= total_slip
3723        # make figure
3724        fig, ax = plt.subplots(layout="constrained")
3725        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[: self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, co, label="Coseismic")
3726        ax.plot(
3727            self.fault.mid_x1[: self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, post, label="Postseismic"
3728        )
3729        ax.plot(
3730            self.fault.mid_x1[: self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, inter, label="Interseismic"
3731        )
3732        ax.legend()
3733        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
3734        ax.set_ylabel(
3735            "Normalized cumulative slip [-]" if normalize else "Cumulative Slip [m]"
3736        )
3737        ax.set_title(
3738            "Slip Phases (Post-/Interseismic cutoff at "
3739            f"{post_inter_transition:.1%} "
3740            "$T_{rec}$)"
3741        )
3742        return fig, ax
3743
3744    def plot_viscosity(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
3745        """
3746        Plot the viscosity structure with depth for the steady state, as well as
3747        for the immediate pre- and coseismic velocities.
3748
3749        For multiple earthquakes, it will use the minimum preseismic and maximum
3750        postseismic velocities.
3751
3752        Parameters
3753        ----------
3754        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3755            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3756        return_viscosities : bool, optional
3757            Also return the preseismic, steady-state, and postseismic viscosities.
3758
3759        Returns
3760        -------
3761        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3762        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3763        """
3764        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3765
3766        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
3767        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
3768        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3769        tdiff = np.array(
3770            [np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
3771        )
3772        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
3773            warn(
3774                "Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
3775                f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds."
3776            )
3777        ix_eq_last = [
3778            np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last
3779        ]
3780        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
3781        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), (
3782            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the "
3783            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
3784        )
3785        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
3786        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
3787        slip_avg = [
3788            slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
3789            for ieq in range(n_eq_found)
3790        ]
3791        # extract preseismic velocities
3792        vels_pre = np.array(
3793            [
3794                full_state[
3795                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper, ix - 1
3796                ]
3797                for ix in ix_eq_last
3798            ]
3799        ).T
3800        vels_post = np.array(
3801            [
3802                full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper : self.fault.n_state_upper, ix]
3803                for ix in ix_eq_last
3804            ]
3805        ).T
3806        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3807            # calculate viscosity profiles
3808            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3809                self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_pre
3810            )
3811            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3812                self.alpha_n_vec, self.n_vec, self.v_plate_eff
3813            )
3814            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3815                self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_post
3816            )
3817        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3818            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3819                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_pre
3820            )
3821            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3822                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.v_plate_eff
3823            )
3824            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3825                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_post
3826            )
3827        else:
3828            raise NotImplementedError()
3829        vis_mins = 10 ** np.floor(
3830            np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_post * 0.999).min(axis=0))
3831        )
3832        vis_maxs = 10 ** np.ceil(
3833            np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_pre * 1.001).max(axis=0))
3834        )
3835        # make plot
3836        fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=n_eq_found, sharey=True, layout="constrained")
3837        ax = np.atleast_1d(ax)
3838        ax[0].set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
3839        for i in range(n_eq_found):
3840            ax[i].fill_betweenx(
3841                [0, self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[1] / 1e3],
3842                vis_mins[i],
3843                vis_maxs[i],
3844                facecolor="0.8",
3845                label="Locked",
3846            )
3847            ax[i].fill_betweenx(
3848                self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
3849                vis_pre[:, i],
3850                vis_post[:, i],
3851                alpha=0.5,
3852                label="Simulated",
3853            )
3854            ax[i].plot(
3855                vis_ss,
3856                self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
3857                label="Plate Rate",
3858            )
3859            ax[i].set_xscale("log")
3860            ax[i].legend(loc="lower left")
3861            ax[i].set_ylim(
3862                self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper - 1] / 1e3, 0
3863            )
3864            ax[i].set_xlim(vis_mins[i], vis_maxs[i])
3865            ax[i].set_title(f"$s={slip_avg[i]:.2g}$ m")
3866            ax[i].set_xlabel(r"$\alpha_{eff}$ [Pa * s/m]")
3867        # finish
3868        if return_viscosities:
3869            return fig, ax, vis_pre, vis_ss, vis_post
3870        else:
3871            return fig, ax
3872
3873    def plot_viscosity_timeseries(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
3874        """
3875        Plot the viscosity timeseries with depth for the entire last cycle.
3876
3877        Parameters
3878        ----------
3879        full_state : numpy.ndarray
3880            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
3881        return_viscosities : bool, optional
3882            Also return the viscosity timeseries.
3883
3884        Returns
3885        -------
3886        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3887        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3888        """
3889        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3890        from matplotlib.colors import LogNorm
3891        from cmcrameri import cm
3892
3893        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
3894        if not self.n_eq == 1:
3895            raise NotImplementedError(
3896                "Don't know how to plot viscosity timeseries if "
3897                "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence."
3898            )
3899        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
3900        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3901        ix_eq_last = (
3902            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
3903            - self.ix_break_joint[-2]
3904        )
3905        # reorganize interseismic velocities
3906        vels = full_state[
3907            self.fault.n_creeping_upper : 2 * self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3908            self.ix_break_joint[-2] :,
3909        ]
3910        vels_pre = vels[:, :ix_eq_last]
3911        vels_post = vels[:, ix_eq_last:]
3912        vels = np.hstack([vels_post, vels_pre])
3913        # same for time
3914        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2] :].copy()
3915        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
3916        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
3917        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
3918        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
3919        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
3920        # convert velocities to effective viscosity
3921        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3922            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(
3923                self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels
3924            )
3925        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3926            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3927                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels
3928            )
3929        else:
3930            raise NotImplementedError()
3931        # get index of deep transition
3932        patch_depths = -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[: self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
3933        ix_deep = np.argmin(
3934            np.abs(patch_depths - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition)
3935        )
3936        # subset vels to skip zero-velocity uppermost patch
3937        vis_ts = vis_ts[1:, :]
3938        # get percentage of final viscosity
3939        rel_vis = vis_ts / vis_ts[:, -1][:, None]
3940        rel_vis_masked = np.ma.MaskedArray(
3941            rel_vis, np.diff(rel_vis, axis=1, prepend=rel_vis[:, 0][:, None]) <= 0
3942        ).filled(np.nan)
3943        levels = [0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8]
3944        rel_vis_iquant = np.concatenate(
3945            [
3946                np.nanargmax(rel_vis_masked > lvl, axis=1, keepdims=True)
3947                for lvl in levels
3948            ],
3949            axis=1,
3950        )
3951        # normalize time
3952        t_sub = t_last_joint / self.T_eff
3953        # prepare plot
3954        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
3955        # plot velocities
3956        c = ax.pcolormesh(
3957            t_sub,
3958            np.abs(
3959                self.fault.end_upper[
3960                    1, self.fault.n_locked + 1 : self.fault.n_locked + ix_deep + 1
3961                ]
3962                / 1e3
3963            ),
3964            vis_ts[: ix_deep - 1, :-1],
3965            norm=LogNorm(
3966                vmin=10 ** np.floor(np.log10(np.median(vis_ts[: ix_deep - 1, 0]))),
3967                vmax=10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(vis_ts[: ix_deep - 1, -1]))),
3968            ),
3969            cmap=cm.batlow,
3970            shading="flat",
3971        )
3972        for i in range(len(levels)):
3973            ax.plot(
3974                t_sub[rel_vis_iquant[: ix_deep - 1, i]],
3975                patch_depths[1:ix_deep] / 1e3,
3976                color="w",
3977            )
3978        ax.set_xscale("symlog", linthresh=1e-3)
3979        ax.set_xlim([0, 1])
3980        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
3981        ax.invert_yaxis()
3982        # finish figure
3983        ax.set_ylabel("Depth $x_2$ [km]")
3984        ax.set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3985        fig.colorbar(
3986            c,
3987            ax=ax,
3988            location="right",
3989            orientation="vertical",
3990            fraction=0.05,
3991            label=r"$\alpha_{eff}$",
3992        )
3993        fig.suptitle("Effective Viscosity Timeseries")
3994        # finish
3995        if return_viscosities:
3996            return fig, ax, t_sub, vis_ts
3997        else:
3998            return fig, ax

Subduction simulation container class.

SubductionSimulation( v_plate, n_cycles_max, n_samples_per_eq, delta_tau_max, v_max, fault, Ds_0, Ds_0_logsigma, T_rec, T_rec_logsigma, D_asp_min, D_asp_max, T_anchor, T_last, enforce_v_plate, largehalflen, t_obs, pts_surf) 
2200    def __init__(
2201        self,
2202        v_plate,
2203        n_cycles_max,
2204        n_samples_per_eq,
2205        delta_tau_max,
2206        v_max,
2207        fault,
2208        Ds_0,
2209        Ds_0_logsigma,
2210        T_rec,
2211        T_rec_logsigma,
2212        D_asp_min,
2213        D_asp_max,
2214        T_anchor,
2215        T_last,
2216        enforce_v_plate,
2217        largehalflen,
2218        t_obs,
2219        pts_surf,
2220    ):
2221        """
2222        Create a subduction simulation.
2223
2224        Parameters
2225        ----------
2226        v_plate : float
2227            Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
2228        n_cycles_max : int
2229            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
2230        n_samples_per_eq : int
2231            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
2232        delta_tau_max : float
2233            Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
2234        v_max : float
2235            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
2236        fault : Fault2D
2237            Fault object
2238        Ds_0 : numpy.ndarray
2239            Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
2240        Ds_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2241            Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
2242        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
2243            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
2244        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2245            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
2246        D_asp_min : numpy.ndarray
2247            Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
2248        D_asp_max : numpy.ndarray
2249            Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
2250        T_anchor : str
2251            Anchor date where observations end
2252        T_last : list
2253            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
2254        enforce_v_plate : bool
2255            Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
2256        largehalflen : float
2257            Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
2258        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2259            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2260            or as Timestamps
2261        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2262            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2263        """
2264
2265        # save general sequence & fault parameters
2266        self.v_plate = float(v_plate)
2267        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology """
2268        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
2269        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
2270        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
2271        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
2272        self.delta_tau_max = float(delta_tau_max)
2273        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches """
2274        self.v_max = float(v_max)
2275        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches """
2276
2277        # define fault
2278        assert isinstance(fault, Fault2D)
2279        if not (
2280            isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous)
2281            or isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic)
2282        ) or not (
2283            isinstance(fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or (fault.lower_rheo is None)
2284        ):
2285            raise NotImplementedError(
2286                "SubductionSimulation is only implemented for "
2287                "NonlinearViscous or RateStateSteadyLogarithmic "
2288                "rheologies in the upper interface, and NonlinearViscous "
2289                "rheology in the lower interface."
2290            )
2291        self.fault = fault
2292        """ Fault object """
2293
2294        # cast earthquake slips as NumPy array
2295        self.Ds_0 = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0)
2296        """ Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es) """
2297        self.Ds_0_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0_logsigma)
2298        """ Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space """
2299        # load recurrence times
2300        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
2301        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
2302        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
2303        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
2304        # load the minimum and maximum depths of the earthquakes
2305        self.D_asp_min = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_min)
2306        """ Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
2307        self.D_asp_max = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_max)
2308        """ Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
2309        assert all([D <= self.fault.D_lock for D in self.D_asp_max]), (
2310            f"Asperity depths {self.D_asp_max / 1e3} km are deeper than the "
2311            f"locking depth {self.fault.D_lock / 1e3}."
2312        )
2313        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
2314        """ Anchor date where observations end """
2315        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
2316        self.T_last = T_last
2317        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
2318        # create a NumPy array that for each locked asperity has the slip per earthquake
2319        self.slip_mask = np.logical_and(
2320            self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1) < -self.D_asp_min.reshape(1, -1),
2321            self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1) > -self.D_asp_max.reshape(1, -1),
2322        )
2323        """ Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch """
2324        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
2325        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
2326        self.n_eq = self.Ds_0.size
2327        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
2328        self.n_eq_per_asp = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
2329        """ Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle """
2330
2331        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
2332        rng = np.random.default_rng()
2333        # first, create realizations of occurence times
2334        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
2335        # (ignore zero-slip earthquakes)
2336        self.T_rec_per_asp = [
2337            rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n)
2338            for t, s, n in zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)
2339        ]
2340        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
2341        self.Ds_0_per_asp = [
2342            rng.lognormal(np.log(d), s, n) if d > 0 else np.array([d] * n)
2343            for d, s, n in zip(self.Ds_0, self.Ds_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)
2344        ]
2345        """ Fault slip [m] realization """
2346
2347        # sanity check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
2348        self.slip_asperities = self.slip_mask.astype(int) * self.Ds_0.reshape(1, -1)
2349        """ Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity """
2350        v_eff_in_asp = (self.slip_asperities / self.T_rec.reshape(1, -1)).sum(axis=1)
2351        assert np.allclose(v_eff_in_asp, self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25), (
2352            "The nominal plate rate is not recovered in all asperities.\n"
2353            f"Plate velocity = {self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25}\n"
2354            f"Effective velocity in each asperity:\n{v_eff_in_asp}"
2355        )
2356
2357        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
2358        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate (enforced or not)
2359        # get the effective recurrence time as implied by the T_rec realizations
2360        T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(t) for t in self.T_rec_per_asp])
2361        # same for the effective cumulative slip
2362        Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(d) for d in self.Ds_0_per_asp])
2363        # we need to scale each individual sequence such that it implies the same
2364        # recurrence time and cumulative slip in each asperity
2365        # (again ignoring zero-slip earthquakes)
2366        T_fullcycle_eff_mean = np.mean(T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff)
2367        Ds_0_fullcycle_mean = np.ma.masked_equal(Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff, 0).mean()
2368        T_rec_per_asp_adj = [
2369            np.array(self.T_rec_per_asp[i])
2370            * T_fullcycle_eff_mean
2371            / T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i]
2372            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2373        ]
2374        Ds_0_per_asp_adj = [
2375            (
2376                np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i])
2377                * Ds_0_fullcycle_mean
2378                / Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i]
2379                if self.Ds_0[i] > 0
2380                else np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i])
2381            )
2382            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2383        ]
2384        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
2385        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
2386        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
2387        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
2388        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not """
2389        ix_nonzero_slip = np.argmax(self.Ds_0 > 0)
2390        v_plate_eff = (
2391            sum(Ds_0_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
2392            / sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
2393            / 86400
2394            / 365.25
2395        )
2396        if self.enforce_v_plate:
2397            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate / v_plate_eff
2398            for i in range(self.n_eq):
2399                T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
2400            v_plate_eff = self.v_plate
2401        self.v_plate_eff = v_plate_eff
2402        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
2403        self.T_eff = sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[0])
2404        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
2405
2406        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
2407        temp_slips = np.vstack(
2408            [
2409                self.slip_mask[:, i].reshape(1, -1) * Ds_0_per_asp_adj[i].reshape(-1, 1)
2410                for i in range(self.n_eq)
2411            ]
2412        )
2413        year_offsets = [
2414            (pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")).n / 365.25
2415            for i in range(self.n_eq)
2416        ]
2417        eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
2418            [
2419                self.T_eff
2420                - (
2421                    np.cumsum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[i])
2422                    - T_rec_per_asp_adj[i]
2423                    + year_offsets[i]
2424                )
2425                for i in range(self.n_eq)
2426            ]
2427        )
2428        # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
2429        eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
